Reviews.Title: “Close to a lot of attactions”
Reviews.Author: VWCalgary
Reviews.Content: This is a nice, grand and comfortable hotel but on the expensive side. I went through Hotwire to book it at a better rate. I choose this hotel because I want to be close to Spanish Steps and splurge a little, it did not disappoint me: the room is big and clean and the bed is comfortable, the only complaint is no kettle or coffee maker because I love to have a hot cup of tea. Also this hotel is close to most of the attractions on feet, most are a round 10 - 20 minutes away, and it only took me 30 minutes to walk to the Vatican Museum(one way). My friend invited me to the hotel breakfast buffet, great food and good coffee, also lots of selection, unfortunately I did not know the cost of the buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Classic and elegant”
Reviews.Author: Frank E
Reviews.Content: We arrived from Venice via the slow train. It was a good walk from Termini with luggage. When we got to the Excelsior, it was around 8:30 am, check in is at 3:00. The staff were great, they got us a room early. This was exactly what we needed. Rooms were nice and we loved the nightly turn down service. I thought the location was a good starting point to get to all the attractions that Rome has to offer. Head down Via Veneto to the Bernini Metro and you are on our way. I also found that walking to Trevi Fountain was easy to do and we used it as a reference point for all the walking we did. Great place to stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Once Grant Hotel Trying to Keep up Appearances”
Reviews.Author: SnowNow
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel but aged in too many places that the hotel does not seem to have the means to update. Don't get me wrong, important things like the bed, shower, supplies, room size, tv, chandeliers are still great. Moldings are old and discolored in some places; caulking not applied correctly as well as some dirt that couldn't be cleaned accumulated in some corners gave haunted mansion feeling like in horror movies. And then it came true the second night...the entire night was filled with garbage trucks emptying bottles, garbage, etc. Why did the truck have to make so many trips?! Or why couldn't Excelsior, a supposedly 5 star hotel, have double pane windows?! I forgot to mention the noise to the management because I was so happy that we all woke up alive! Staff are great and helpful with the exception of Paola at the concierge desk, who was unwilling to give me a map and tell me how to get to Spanish Steps. For a simple question, he actually stopped the conversion and talked on the cell phone, purposely engaging a colleague to talk, and answered the phone. Extremely rude behavior that is not excusable. Westin has him to thank for my dropping a star.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel choice for Rome”
Reviews.Author: American_in_l0nd0n
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin Excelsior for a long weekend with our 18 month old son. We found it to be a great hotel for us. The concierge was able to make all the arrangements we required, but there are multiple concierges and you do not get a personal level of service at all. The breakfast each morning was outstanding and they were most accommodating for our young son. Our room was great, but it didn't have a kettle/coffee pot, which would have been nice. Nor do you get water every day (But you can get big bottles for one euro down at the hotel gym) The pool is adequate, but quite small. The location is very nice... walkable to most of the major sites and very close to the Villa Borghese. The hotel also arranged babysitting for us in the evenings. Our English speaking sitter was great, but the service is pricey! 35 euro an hour! Note: there are no ramps, so if you have a stroller (or a wheelchair) you will have to carry it up several short flights (3-5 steps) of stairs.

Reviews.Title: “Nice property for sure”
Reviews.Author: Fishboy100
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, very well kept, large rooms, nice bedding and beds, tv a bit older and our remote didn't work too well. Very nice bathroom in our room with double sink, nice walk in shower with sit and separate tub. Toilet and beday too. 2 single beds is all you can get, if 2 beds are needed. So, a bit different than North America that way. Turndown service offered each night. Quiet rooms. Ours looked into nothing more than a mechanical corridor or something. But, it was quiet. The downside to the hotel for me, really came with ordering room service. The card you can hang on the door for morning breakfast is not clear at all about the pricing. It tells you 2 main options (continental or American breakfast), it then lists the options you can choose from. Problem is, it doesn't say anywhere about items listed that may not be included, nor how much additional items cost. Hence, the way it reads is as if you can choose everything in a particular category for the price listed. The second problem for me was, the first 2 days I had breakfast delivered to the room, the fellow didn't bring anything to sign for it. Thus, I didn't know how much I was actually paying. It wasn't until the 3rd day that the room service fellow had a bill to be signed, and it was a bit of a surprise! In addition to the high prices and hidden additional charges for items, they charge an additional $5 euros just for the delivery itself. I know things aren't cheap Rome, but this is more a case of making things more clear on the menu itself. Not to mention, if you went down to the restaurant instead for breakfast, the items I wasa charged extra for, are included. Hotel is very pricy for sure. I was fortunate and got the rooms on Priceline for $215 USD a night. So, I really can't complain too much. Location is okay, but certainly not the best. Not too much very close. Train about 15 minutes, Spanish Steps about 15 minutes, a few really nice churches in the area, everything else at least a half hour walk or involves the train. The Hard Rock Cafe is within 10 minutes, and by far the best place to eat in my opinion. Food is really good and prices are reasonable. But, it can be very busy for these veery reasons. There are a ton restaurants everywhere, many even have pushy sales people on the street trying to get you to come in (even at the nice restaurants). In the evening time, there's almost no hope of getting any small snack items like pop or chips. Everything other than the restaurants close around 6 pm, and the hotels in the area (including this one) do not have any sort or store or snack machines. Pool is nice, and decent size for Rome. Many Rome hotels are small and have no pool. So, this is a bonus. No hot tub though, and be aware of the typical European bathers. Overall, the area is quite safe, hotel is beautiful and safe, staff are courteous, and rooms are large and very nice. If you can afford it, worth while.

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare concierge!”
Reviews.Author: Kipbh
Reviews.Content: So, what appears to be a beautiful hotel on the web site, was well sub standard. First time to Rome and what a beautiful city! However the hotel, we were in a deluxe suite which was dark poorly lit and frankly appeared to be falling apart with various cracks in the wall. The only redeeming fact was that the bed was comfortable. We chose the hotel as we were insistent we wanted somewhere in the centre of Rome and with a pool/spa. We used the pool once as it was freezing the spa was two rooms from what I could see and the staff were never helpful to supply towels or offer drinks. The concierge was another fact we had major issues with, their resturant suggestions were terrible. Poor quality local taverns when we'd requested an up market pizzareria. We booked tickets to the colloseium and were not informed of anything just given a confirmation number. We requested if we needed any other information eg a separate pick up point. Told just the normal stalls. We also booked a car from the airport to pick up my wifes parents, who speak no English or Italian, this is why we requested a car to pick them up. However we recieved a call asking where their car was and we were informed by the concierge that the car was still at the hotel. And was waiting to take them to the airport. We had the option of waiting for 40 mins for the car to reach them or speaking to a taxi firm ourselves that was close by. This resolution was not offered by the hotel. Our breakfast was also disappointing as we had to wait 15minutes for a table one morning as none were free, however what was obvious was that tables were free just staff were not clearing them. Frankly this experience has put us off the entire group and we will not be staying again. Poor form indeed

Reviews.Title: “Not Quite what I Expected”
Reviews.Author: pauljames403
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Westin three nights in late March. Nothing wrong with the property per se', but my three star rating reflects the standard I expected for the money paid and reputation of the Westin. Rome is expensive in general, and the higher end props will be that much more, but the level of service is not reflected here. Room was a good size by european standards and was fairly well appointed, but certainly not special. Bed was very comfortable, TV offered some english but could have had a specialty chanel or two. Shower was decent, hot, and while not critical, had duel shower heads but one did not work. Not a big deal, but shows a lack of attention. Maid service was good. Generally no major complaints, but again, nothing special. Service was not up to par for one of the worlds major chains, and at $450 per night, service should be a differentiator, but was not. The doorman did not open the door once for me during my stay....now I'm sure many of you are saying well la-de-da,,,,,,you need a guy to open the door? Well no, but if you are going to have a doorman.......Front desk personal answered my questions, which I suppose is all I needed, but did not seem to be interested in actually going any further. I admit I was irked at the fact that they did not have ice machines...no problem as the front desk said just call room service. I did...four times....hey I enjoy a nightcap...don't judge. Anyway, that cost me 8 euros for the 4 trips - 2 per, not a big deal but ice should not carry a charge. At least let the guest know. As I said, we stayed three nights here. We stayed three nights prior at a different hotel, The Mascagni, also reviewed by myself, here on TA. They also did not have ice (yes I had a nightcap there as well) I had to go to the bar to get it but there was no charge. Much preferred that hotel and was less than $300 per night. Anyway, bottom line, again, nothing wrong, but you can do much better for this kind of money.

Reviews.Title: “Best Service”
Reviews.Author: nic d
Reviews.Content: Our stay was very memorable, It is a beautiful Hotel, room is confortable and nice, we went to the restaurant for dinner and we had the best food in town for a good price, the maitre was very please to welcome us. For lunch they have a huge buffet for only 38.00 all included. The location is perfect, the front desk and houskeeping are fantastic. Thank You to all, we will come back

Reviews.Title: “Solid, not great and expensive Hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: solomonpageguy
Reviews.Content: Solid Westin property. Our family stayed four nights over Easter weekend. We had connecting rooms which were a B+, clean, nice bathrooms and Westin beds. No complaints except it cost a fortune. The free breakfast was a solid B, with plenty of choices, but it was not awesome. Room service was the most expensive I have seen in Europe, but coffee and tea were prompt and very good. Great location with a cab stand next to the building. Take cabs in Rome, much cheaper than NYC or Paris. Overall, four star place, five star price. Lots of Americans and everyone speaks English and tries hard.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice property”
Reviews.Author: Charlieojs
Reviews.Content: Wonderful, large rooms with staff that wants to help. Breakfast buffet was marginal and not on par with the rest of the property. The business center had nothing to do with business. No staff and nobody to show one how to connect to the large network printers, etc. This "center" is obviously used 99% of the time to print boarding passes only. No big deal, just get your work done elsewhere. Concierge staff is the best I have found anywhere in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Work award trip”
Reviews.Author: Fan1420
Reviews.Content: My husband and I got to spend 4 evenings fully paid by my company for an award trip I had earned. Enjoyed every minute of it. The people working were wonderful. The room was elegant and clean. The bathroom was large. Not sure what the price was paid by the company but I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “location, location, location; taxi anyone?”
Reviews.Author: thislandisyourland
Reviews.Content: The hotel is 1/2 mile or so from the Borghese Gardens and if you like to wake up in the morning and go for a brisk walk or a nice run, you will find the the location ideal. Being from NYC, I would describe the neighborhood as upper east side and Borghese as Central Park. But, if you want to get to anywhere of historic interest (except the Spanish Steps, which is probably 3/4 mile away), expect to hear the refrain from the Concierge or mostly anyone, "take a taxi". The nearest subway stop (Barberini) is 1/3 mile away down the Via Veneto, towards the bottom of this winding slope-like avenue. It can get a bit tiring if you want to use mass transit walking up and down the street to the central bus stops and subway station (learn to use the buses because they are the only way to get into the nooks and crannies of this city). The Via Veneto had its day (you'll see a lot of references to Fellini's movie "La Dolce Vita", which was filmed in the area) and is still quite nice but it is not central to most of the sites and scenes of Rome. Insofar as the hotel, the lobby is majestic and classic. The rooms are well sized with our king bed room (at the lower end of the room scale) probably 350 SF or so. Bathroom is walk-in and large. The rooms, however, do not quite match the lobby and common areas of the hotel in terms of grandeur but they are quite acceptable. They are a bit worn but, again, comfortable. Wi-fi, for my teenage sons, worked great (included in our room rate). We did not have breakfast but they have a nice continental b'fast for about 20 euros and buffet style one for 30 or 35 euros. We chose to eat breakfast at one of the local cafes on Via Veneto near the subway station with eggs, toast, coffee and juice (hey, we travelled with my kids) for about 10 euros. Expensive by US standards but welcome to the global economy. On a final sour note (addressed as much to the hotel management who may read this as any reader), when we arrived with our 4 relatively small pieces of luggage) we did not need the concierge to show us our 2 connecting rooms (and expect a tip) and then minutes later have not one but two porters show up with our one cart of luggage (each also expecting a tip). Life may be a little rough these days in the euro zone but let's keep it simple. Grazie.

Reviews.Title: “best hotel in rome”
Reviews.Author: shaolinced
Reviews.Content: our stay was very memorablefrom the front desk,house keeping and concierge.room is adequate in size&spacious.best thing is the pool and the spa- after an all day walking tour you could actually relax in the heated pool and sauna.chocolates waiting for you in your bed(Baratti and Milano,I would think is the best I've tasted so far-made in Italy).very close to the spanish steps,just next to the U.S. embassy,along the famous street Via Veneto.you could actually tell its an excellent hotel by the activities going on day and night because of the heavy police and security presence(hence the safest place to stay).I would surely come back next time we visit Rome with my family and would recommend to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service - Felt like an American Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LouiseDenise
Reviews.Content: It is a beautiful hotel and the concierge desk was extremely helpful. It felt like an American hotel and was full of Americans. If that is what you are looking for this is the place!

Reviews.Title: “Nice but average and not for a special occasion”
Reviews.Author: lenkster
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in April 2011 during the Easter break. It was also my 35th birthday which my husband and I wanted to celebrate in Rome. The location is very good; close to many major attractions. However, it operates more as a business type hotel rather than a luxury one. It is big, the staff is not very attentive (not rude but just don't pay much attention to guests - something i often see in big hotels while on business trips). We asked for a little nicer room (within the same price category) given my birthday but were given a room with the view to the internal yard which was not nice at all. Also, the room was quite small. Their swimming pool is good and there were hardly any people there but, for some reason, during 2 out of 3 of our visits to the poole there were some construction people trying to fix something there which didn't make us wanting to use the poole for longer than 10 minutes (probably that is why the poole was constantly empty!). So all in all I would not recommend this hotel for any special occasion, particularly in busy seasons like Easter etc.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: ktfranks
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for four nights in February. It is a luxury hotel, and in a very good area of town. Easy walking distance to many incredible sights. The room was quite nice and comfortable; a bit small but that is common for European hotel rooms. The staff were courteous and helpful. I was there for a business meeting, and the hotel staff did a great job supporting the meeting. All in all I have no complaints, but for the cost it was about what I would expect to receive. Certainly, the hotel did not stand out in my mind as a phenomenal value based on the cost of the room and my experience there. I think the hotel is very nice and it is a decent value for the service and comfort provided. If your budget allows it, I think this is a very solid hotel.

Reviews.Title: “very nice”
Reviews.Author: ugeauxgirl
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay here- hotel was in a nice area of town, within easy walking distance to the Spanish Steps and the Trevi fountain. The beds were very comfortable and the rooms were plenty big enough. The lobby was absolutely gorgeous and the service was very good. The only (minor) annoyance was that it came with an hour of free internet, (wonderful for skyping our kids back in the states) but if you didn't select FREE on the login page, they billed your room for 15 euros, and of course the 15 euro plan was pre-selected. For a hotel this expensive, it seems a bit underhanded to try to "trick" you into an extra fee, however the feeling we got all over Rome was the same- if you were the least bit unwary, you'd get overcharged or not get all your change back or something similar.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Julie37496
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great, trendy location, incredibly quite and the staff is wonderful. You can walk to many of the sightseeing areas from this hotel. I would highly recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Expected to be wow-ed and was underwhelmed”
Reviews.Author: tennisstar1524
Reviews.Content: This hotel has such a prestigous heritage and is on Via Venato so you expect something great. I left my week stay there underwhelmed with this average hotel. I had stayed at another, much less expensive, literally around the corner from this one on my first day and found the two hotels very comparable. My advise would be to save your money from some great Italian meals and sights rather than staying at this overpriced hotel. The outside and common areas of the hotel are beautiful and well decorated. The rooms are average size for past Westins I've stayed at and my room was clean. Others have commented on the decor being outdated, the style of the hotel is somewhat older fashioned but don't take that to mean the furniture is unkept. The decor is just more classical than modern. The staff is not rude but is not friendly. The week I stayed I never had one person at the front desk greet me when I came in and the doorman actually opened the door for me exactly one time my entire stay. At breakfast that was included with the business group I went with, coffee was served at the beginning by waiters but often, about an hour before breakfast was to be closed, they were too busy cleaning off tables to bother with any service. Another let down was construction going on inside the hotel right outside our room. We stayed in a room on the 1st floor looking out at the U.S. Embassy. One morning, at around 9 or 10 which I guess I should be greatful it wasn't earlier, hammer started pounding right outside the door and lasted for about an hour. I was already awake but it's not very relaxing getting ready to go out with all that noise. Also, on two seperate dates (once at 2:30 am and the other time at around 8 am) a voice came over the speaker that is in every room about the beds saying to evacute the room due to a fire and to go out into the hall. Both times it was loud enough to wake me. Both times it was a false alarm that I had to call down to the front desk to figure out what was going on. There is no directory of numbers or even map of where stuff is in the hotel provided in the room so figuring out what numbers to dial when you've just been woken up isn't very pleasant. Be advised as well, there is no air conditioning available until the summer months. When I stayed it got rather warm and keeping the window open all night wasn't much of an option due to the street noise.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, nice rooms, lousy Wi-Fi policy”
Reviews.Author: gcaug2006
Reviews.Content: The only thing I hate worse than paying extra for Wi-Fi on a business trip is to pay extra for Wi-Fi on a family vacation. Unfortunately, this hotel, and perhaps all Starwood hotels, charge $25 per day per device for Wi-Fi. This is quite a bummer when you're traveling with the family, laptops and iPads in tow. And I'm a Starwood's gold member! Otherwise, the rooms are nice the breakfast was good and the staff generally helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated”
Reviews.Author: Jasmine198
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great, central location, and the property itself is gorgeous. However our room was quite outdated. The tv didn't always work properly, it took forever for someone to answer the service express line, and the staff was hit or miss. Some were nice and friendly, others were quite cold. Very disappointed in the overall experience with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “They will treat you like a Head of State”
Reviews.Author: BigFoodFan
Reviews.Content: This hotel is centrally located for walking the entire city and seeing all of the attractions. I found this one of the finest old world hotels I've ever stayed in on a trip. From the moment we checked in, the staff was attentive, interested and extremely polite. We checked our rooms before accepting them. Mine was perfect and my friend found his was a little smaller than he expected and didn't have as nice a view as mine-- he asked for a change of room -they upgraded him to a suite- no charge. My room overlooked the US Embassy and the city-- wondrful view. Breakfast in the hotel was supurb. I know you'll love this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Treated like a 2nd class citizens by snooty staff on our honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Christian377
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here on our honeymoon and it was a huge disappointment and a waste of money. The staff looked us up and down, ignored us, and made us feel unwelcome at nearly every interaction we had with them. I'm not sure what we did to make the staff treat us so poorly- we are friendly and we frequently travel, and we have never experienced treatment like this before. Of the staff, the people at the front desk and concierge were hit or miss- sometimes they would help us, and sometimes they would look us up and down, or see us coming and walk away. The woman at the business center was the same- she looked up and saw my wife coming and walked away and kept her back turned. When she realized we hadn't left after a couple of minutes, she acted inconvenienced at having to explain how to use the computers and internet. The bellhops were the worst. They watched us carrying our bags while they glanced over, talked to each other and laughed. We used several taxi's while we were there, and they never offered to hail a cab for us, even though we saw them do so for other guests. I've never been treated so rudely in all of my life. The rooms were nice, but needed to be updated. The location was good, but was overshadowed by the how the staff made us feel unwelcome.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent!! But some down falls”
Reviews.Author: Mark F
Reviews.Content: Magnificent structure, outstanding locstion,magnificant room, staff super, eat elsewhere!!

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel ever!”
Reviews.Author: JaJa_LuRVeS
Reviews.Content: If you want to experience LUXURIOUS, this is the hotel for it! The best hotel I've stayed in my entire life. The details that they put in to make this hotel a palace is overwhelming. I have nothing but WOW for the room especially the wallpapers and the furniture. It was snowing for the 1st time since 2005 when we got here; and the concierge was helpful with information that we need to know. The reception, OMG! The same person who checked us in, showed us to our room. Now that's what you call 'going the extra mile' and he remembered us when I called reception the next day. A truly wonderful experience and the best service of all eventhough our tours were cancelled due to the weather condition (bloody snow!), the hotel made our trip to Rome a truly unforgettable time of our life. Congratulations and keep up the good work!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: TulaLondon
Reviews.Content: Old and seedy? Threadbare carpets? Can hardly believe the review below, what nonsense! The Excelsior is a beautiful hotel. We stayed just after Christmas for four nights and had a simply wonderful stay. Staff couldn't have been more helpful and our room was huge (not so easy to find in Rome), elegant and comfortable. The hotel is really well placed on the Via Veneto and is within easy walking distance of the main sights. Our young son loved the pool ... sauna and steam room all working fine while we were there. Perhaps the spa could do with a facelift but it certainly didn't detract from our enjoyment. If brand spanking new is a prerequisite go stay in a furniture showroom. The Excelsior will not disappoint those with an appreciation of the finer things in life.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Robert Townsend
Reviews.Content: In my opinion this is the best hotel in Rome. The decor is spectacular, the rooms large, the location central, and the bar terrific. Stayed here several times over the past 25 years and it is always a pleasure to return.

Reviews.Title: “Dreams can come true”
Reviews.Author: TravelinMaggie35
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful hotel. Yes, pricey, but worth it. Great Spa, pool. Near Donys Restraunt. On the Via Vento. Up the hill to Borghese Gardens- down to Hard Rock Cafe.. And Rome all around you.

Reviews.Title: “Top Marks”
Reviews.Author: winstonazzopardi
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a weekend at the Excelsior. This hotel is one of the best in Rome, miles ahead of the Plaza in Via Veneto where we stayed the last time. Our room (416) must be one of the largest and most elegant suites in the city. The hotel has a wonderful bar (important to us) and a good gym. The service is spot on especially the concierge. Breakfast is hearty and in beautiful surroundings. The Via Veneto is one of Rome's chic areas to stay with trendy bars and restaurants. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Stately elegance within walking distance from many Roman sighhts”
Reviews.Author: Rsauer3473
Reviews.Content: We visited Rome as part of a European tour of Italy, Greece and Spain in September. We used Starwood Starpoints for our stay (48K for 5 nights). This is an elegant hotel that is probably in need of a bit of renovation. Check-in was efficient. Our room was on the fourth floor and had two twin beds that an employee made into a king at our request. High ceilings and elaborate tapestry curtains over windows (that did not offer much of a view) were complemented by what appeared to be antique furniture. While there was not a coffee maker, the service staff provided hot water for our instant Starbucks. We did not eat at any of the hotel restaurants. The hotel is across the street from the American Embassy and about three blocks from the Villa Borghese park and museum. A Hard Rock Cafe and many other bistros are nearby and the Spanish Steps is a ten minute walk. Also close by is the Church of Santa Susanna where guests can get tickets for Papal Audiences. A subway stop is about a ten minute walk away near the Spanish Steps. And the ever-present double-decker tour buses have a stop close-by. There are a small pool and spa in the lower level that proved refreshing. Overall, this is a nice hotel for guests unfamiliar with Rome as we were. Clean rooms, good service, and convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “Breathtaking hotel! Average spa...”
Reviews.Author: Livingthedreamco
Reviews.Content: The westin excelsior is an amazing hotel. We stayed here for 8 days and passed new years. The entrance herself makes you feel at a palace. Clef d'or concierges and elegantly dressed doormen. The rooms are vaste and decorated with an impecable taste. The breakfast is well displayed and has a good variety of plates. The only average part of the stay was the spa. It was small with a mediocre pool and a non working sauna. The steam rooms was almost cold. In overall an amazing hotel but could use a spa renovation.

Reviews.Title: “WOW”
Reviews.Author: Michele3062
Reviews.Content: We arrived January 3rd for 4 nights and we did not expect the hotel to be so lovely.We had been to Rome many times but this was the first time we stayed at the Westin Excelsior.The staff were fantastic .The breakfast was also great.The rooms were very spacious we had a grand deluxe room which was great but my sisters room was massive.The rooms are different in size from one to another .The hotel is 100 years old but in great condition.We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “In need of a big renovation”
Reviews.Author: mndnyc
Reviews.Content: This hotel has beautiful bones and is in a good location. But Westin management should be ashamed of how they have let this hotel go. The hotel is old and seedy, carpets are threadbare, furniture is on its last legs and walls and doors look like they have been bashed in many times. This hotel needs a massive renovation. Also, one of the reasons we picked the hotel was for the indoor pool for the kids. However the pool is quite small and the area not that nice to sit in. As well, the work-out area is small and half the machines did not work properly. The service levels though are very good. The management and concierge were quite nice and helpful even when we complained about our room..they upgrade us to a much better room....room service came quickly and everyone was very nice and helpful...so I overall give them high marks on service.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant 5* hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hotel_Habitue
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin for quite a few nights whilst attending a conference. The room I was allocated was massive, as was the bathroom. I have never been in a room where the wall covering pattern included bees, but it was in keeping with the general theme. As I was attending a conference we were allocated a very large room for our breakfast - if I hadn't have had breakfast in the main restaurant on my first day I would have been content with what was available. However, I did keep comparing the display to the restaurant and found it disappointing. However, I did find the housekeeping and cleanliness rather lacking. The bathroom walls were green marble and although the marble is very mottled and veiny, it was easy to see old soap stains and drips, especially behind the bidet and along the back wall and side panel of the bath. The bathroom ameneties, for a 5*, were quite average too, but as I was there for over a week I had my own toilettries. I have also marked down sleep quality because at the time of my stay I was six months pregnant and I found the two mattresses pushed together as a double bed rather uncomfortable. Firm mattresses may suit some but not me. Overall I would recommend the hotel. I cannot comment on the hotel location or proximity to the sites of Rome as I didn't get to see any!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent 5 star”
Reviews.Author: Swiss_voyagerII
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel. All you'd expect from a 5 star:- friendly service; clean, spacious, tastefully decorated rooms with large bathrooms; good in-room entertainment with multiple foreign TV channels; great bar and restaurant; large lounge area; well equipped gym......... We spent 3 nights over New Year and compared with smaller hotels it was also very good value for money. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great hospitality and Great location”
Reviews.Author: clmmanh
Reviews.Content: Although expensive, I would say if you are going to use points or pay what will be a premium for a Rome hotel anyway, this is a great place to stay. I found the service to be excellent and the rooms to be outstanding. The location also works extremely well for seeing the key sites of the city. All in all I don't think you can really fault this as a place to stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Huge rooms, Hugh ceilings, great service, cleanliness and great location.”
Reviews.Author: lostnyctraveler
Reviews.Content: I only have positive things to mention at my two day stay at the excelsior rome. Not one complaint, everything went as planned. The hotel is grand and keeps up with its standard. Good job, guys!

Reviews.Title: “Good location not a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: ebm515
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in September and I was underwhelmed. First the hotel is in a great location. You can easily walk to the Spanish Steps, Colosseum, Via Del Corso shopping, Roman Forum, etc. But the hotel itself isnt great. We had booked a room with one big bed and when we got to our room it had 2 twins. Also - the rooms are very musty feeling. The rooms are huge though which is also nice, especially for a European hotel. For the amount you are paying I would check out a smaller boutique hotel or if you want a huge hotel check out the Hotel Eden which we went to for a drink and it looked great.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Westin hotel !”
Reviews.Author: BforBoy
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel twice and enjoyed both stays thoroughly. The exterior of this hotel is magnificent. I was upgraded to a suite both times and the rooms were absolutely beautiful! The staff were extremely helpful and friendly. The bed was heavenly. The location was very central with easy access to major attractions. The room rates are quite high though--but it is worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Exquisite Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FennyG77
Reviews.Content: I have love the room that they have given us together with the free breakfast which is really great gesture from them. The room is huge, exquisite and we love everything there. The receptionist is extremely helpful and bring us to our room and took really good care of us. Breakfast choices are excellent. One suggestion that I could think of which is to turn on the air condition during hot winter nights. Yes, it was quite hot during my stay, but maybe it's one off thing. Overall it's lovely hotel and we would love to come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Exquisite Property!”
Reviews.Author: Mark42139
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights over Thanksgiving weekend 2011. The property is exquisite. the rooms are beautiful. The staff is helpful and friendly. We did have an issue with the heat and air conditioning not working properly. The beds were also not the most comfortable. It is a very expensive hotel, but compared with other hotels in Rome, worth the price. Overall, we enjoyed it very much, and would come back here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Experience”
Reviews.Author: galutengirl
Reviews.Content: We had stayed at the Westin in April with our young son. They were very nice to us and so when my husband had to return on business we decided this would be a good place to stay. I contacted them and instead of a 'corporate' response we got a very friendly, warm response like you would get at a smaller, privately owned hotel. The location is excellent and our room was very spacious and elegant. We would love to return.

Reviews.Title: “Old world opulence, but with all the modern comforts”
Reviews.Author: pieterde
Reviews.Content: Full disclosure: I am SPG Platinum and got upgraded from a standard room to a Grand Luxe Corner suite. This review reflects this. I stayed here one night on business. Walking into the luscious lobby with the limos parked in front I was immediately pleasantly surprised. Check-in staff very efficient and uberfriendly. The suite I got on the sixth floor was larger than your average New York apartment. All decorated in very fine and delicate old world style. Specklessly clean. Great balconies with deck chairs and fantastic view on Via Veneto. Very comfy bed, excellent breakfast. Splurge redefined!

Reviews.Title: “birthday break in rome”
Reviews.Author: michael g
Reviews.Content: we stayed in the excelsior in oct 2011 as a birthday treat for my wife,s 50th.the hotels location is great for all attractions & public transport & also has several very good restaurants nearby.the hotel upgraded us to a suite on the top floor without us asking for it .the rooms were fantastic,clean & comfortable.fresh fruit & a bottle of champagne was also thrown in.all the staff were very polite & helpful & we could not have enjoyed our stay anymore.we booked through a company called citalia & upon arrival at the hotel we were presented with vouchers for an open top hop on hop off bus tour of the city which is the best way to see everything.true the hotel is getting a bit old now but what counts is the comfort & service & we could not fault either.thanks to all at the excelsior.a little tip-if you are going to visit the vatican or colosseum pre book a guided tour to avoid massive queues.

Reviews.Title: “Fading opulence with fading facilities”
Reviews.Author: Epicurius_at_large
Reviews.Content: I struggled, and struggled between a 3 and 4 star, and decided to be generous. Indeed, I must maintain a healthy does of objectivity. My room was classic empire style, but bathroom facilities are really dated. Love the orange marble, and that was all. There seems to be a dusty feeling about this hotel all around. Concierge was friendly and helpful. Neibourhood was fabulous!! 5 minutes away from giant park, and right next to American Embassy - perfect security. Via Victorio is perhaps the most prestigious address in Rome. This hotel has a perfect loation, and what a pity its management is not comparable to its fabled architecture and history.

Reviews.Title: “Elegance, Comfort, Convenience”
Reviews.Author: bethy2120
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this Westin property for two nights in late October - and while it put a rather large dent on our SPG stash, we were pleased with the use of points. Though hotel lobby was overflowing with people and the front desk very busy checking in/managing a large wedding party, we were able to check in right away - and a few hours before the regularly scheduled check in time (a huge plus since we were arriving via an overnight flight from the US + layover in Munich). A porter escorted us from the taxi, to the front desk and up to our room with our bags - in no time, we were settled in. The room was quite large - even, for what I assume to be, a "standard" room for two. The decor was very elegantly appointed - lots of red, gold, ornate details, large windows & heavy treatments, chandeliers, period style furniture with a decent view. While very grandiose - the room was also very comfortable and even felt "cozy". The bed was very heavenly.... I had to FORCE myself not to get sucked into it's comfort to go sight-seeing, despite the overwhelming jet lag! The bathroom was really the piece de resistance... marble, marble everywhere - large tub, shower, bidet, dual sinks, lots of (BIG, FLUFFY!) towels, slippers and robes. I must add - we found the room to be VERY quiet and great for sleeping in. If you were really looking closely - you would notice a few smudges, knicks, small carpet stains, etc - none of which impacted our overall impression; however; we also did not pay upwards of 450euro per night either. The location is excellent for exploring Rome - we love seeing city by foot and did not use public transportation at all. We walked to the Spanish Steps, Colosseum, Pantheon, Piazza Navona, Trastevere ... everywhere! There are many restaurants, shops, etc in the immediate vicinity so it was very easy to find a place for a morning cappuccino and croissant or evening cocktail. We did not dine in any of the hotel restaurants which were very pricey, but also - the last place I want to eat while visiting a city is in the hotel! We did use the pool/fitness center which was small but very sufficient and clean. The rack rate is on the high end side, but Rome is an expensive city! Overall... it's a beautiful, full service, reliable, property in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “westin is not always westin”
Reviews.Author: DennisvdMolen
Reviews.Content: With a regualr stay in the Westin, people get used to a certain standard. a standard which is not in the Westin Excelsior in Rome. Starting with the frontdesk,, whilst checking in, the guy didn't even looked at us. In the hotel was a big convention, which more or less took over the whole hotel. IF you like old hotles with a certain France rennaisance look this is the place to be, but it seems al a little tacky. Unfortunately we had to leave early because of sicknes of my mother, and we got a 50% refund, even on a pre paid deal , which I found fair enough. The breakfast was a little poor, just finished and the plate is allready gone.. no asking.. The hotel is well situated near the Borghees parc whioch is very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Was the best part about visiting Rome”
Reviews.Author: LondonTravel101
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here twice, the first time better than the second, but still a beautiful hotel with accommodating staff. Very pretty location, beautiful rooms, welcoming staff that were always approachable and had time to chat, recommend good places and assist with needs, but all comes at a premier rate! Worth the good money they charge you I think. Only downfall I found was sitting outside having breakfast there were beggers and homeless coming to the table and asking for money and food - not pleasant and frightening for my 12 year old sister at the time. Food was underpar for breakfast on the second visit, continental buffet where pastries were stale and meat fatty. In a much nicer area than the majority of Rome and I preferred staying in the hotel and surrounding area much more than the main tourist areas we visited as they were flooded with beggers and what looked to be eastern european ladies selling their services on the street. If I were to return to Rome (which I hope I dont have to) I would stay in this hotel as it is one of the only places where I felt privacy and personal space was respected by locals and had an heir of civilisation which many other places did not.

Reviews.Title: “A safe bet”
Reviews.Author: TheMightyRawdon
Reviews.Content: In a reasonably good position for access to the very centre of Rome although if you decide to walk back to the hotel it is uphill all the way. The place is very spacious with generally speaking big dimensions everywhere which is a nice change; my room was spacious and reasonably well appointed. You couldn't call it ultra smart but it was clean and comfortable and very decent. Breakfast was very good and the only issue was not being able to get a sandwich, drink etc at the bar at 10.45pm having arrived on a late flight. We ate in a bar opposite the hotel and spent the €160 there instead! It's not a "go to" hotel for Rome but would be quite happy to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Expensive, but extremely nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Masha C
Reviews.Content: If you are looking to splurge on yourself, then this is the hotel for you! We recently had the pleasure of staying here because my husband was attending a conference. The cost was 350 euros = $473.83 plus VOT per night! This was in a very exclusive location in Rome where most of the hotels seemed to cost the same. Our room was absolutely the most luxuriously decorated room I have ever stayed in. I heard their spa services were to die for. The hotel restaurant was super expensive with a $60 lunch buffet, but again very exclusive lunch. Breakfast was not your typical continental breakfast either and the price of it wasn't either;) But overall we really enjoyed staying here, but wouldn't allow ourselves to stay on our own tab all that often.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Elegant Excelsior”
Reviews.Author: Infowmn
Reviews.Content: Great room, very posh. Large space with a walk in closet. Shower was outstanding. Location on the Via Veneto is wonderful for walking and people watching. Walking distance to Metro. Capuchin Crypt is nearby and a must see.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Likestotravel009
Reviews.Content: We just stayed two nights and we used award points. It is a big hotel conveniently located to walk to most locations such as the Vatican if you like walking. Our room was probably a basic room and looked like a small room in a museum with chandeliers and red flocked wallpaper that matched the curtains. It was cute and comfortable. It was a beautiful, quiet area near the embassies. The concierge's were all amazing and I didn't tip them nearly well enough! They got us into a restaurant that is normally booked a month out and we loved the restaurant. We had a very early morning need for a cab to the airport and everything was on time and perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Could do better for this rate”
Reviews.Author: domibear64
Reviews.Content: A great beautiful historic building, very good location, gorgeous and spacious rooms BUT : - lots of dust, you could actually write your name in the dust on the furniture - you have to pay for WIFI or highspeed internet connection, I think that's a little bit exaggerated due to the rate you already pay - after 9.00 am, it's hard to still have warm, even lukewarm water in the shower - the concierge was not able to help us to find a good restaurant

Reviews.Title: “Like being a prince in my own castle”
Reviews.Author: nicholasevans
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin Excelsior, Rome in January as I was visiting friends. I pulled up to the hotel and my experience began. A friendly gentleman opened the door to my car and escorted me to the lobby. Several staff members greeted me in the lobby and promptly checked me into my room. I was the only person in the lobby so it was a very personalized experience. The gentleman who checked me into the hotel escorted me to the elevator and to my room. He opened the door to my room and my mouth dropped. I had been upgraded to the Via Veneto Suite. I walked into a small foyer filled with beautiful art, crown molding and amazing furniture. We took a right and I poured into the spacious round shaped living room. This place was massive! The room was overflowing in period furniture and art. There was a non-working fireplace, modern amenities like a Bang & Olufsen TV, and large picture windows overlooking Via Veneto. I didn't want to leave...but the tour continued! We went back through the foyer to the other half of the suite. There was a large bedroom with a canopy bed and a small Juliette balcony again overlooking the VIa Veneto. We entered the beautiful marble bathroom (larger than some Manhattan apartments) with it's separate shower and tub, enclosed TV and dual vanity. What a dream! A few minutes later a bottle of wine was delivered, compliments of the hotel. I wanted to move in! I had my friends over to the room and we very much enjoyed the space before our time in the city. I definitely recommend this hotel's service, amenities and facilities. I've stayed at the St. Regis Grand Rome as well which definitely edges out the Westin Excelsior but not much based on my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great locatiob a classical choice”
Reviews.Author: glyka
Reviews.Content: We stayed For one night. We stayed to their suite. Excellent room, service snd location. We loved it!!

Reviews.Title: “Always consistently good”
Reviews.Author: Brunella D
Reviews.Content: I come to Rome very often for business and i find this hotel consistently good in service and quality. Staff has generally a nice attitude expecially in the bar lobby. Room service is great and the heavenly bed is truly a nice cuddling touch. I suggest this hotel for lots of different reasons: you can relax by the spa enjoying the indoor pool or you can just walk around town and reach any point easily. I've been to several hotels in town but this is truly among one of my favourites.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay in Rome, Fabulous service”
Reviews.Author: KikiNY
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights after Tuscany and loved the warm hospitality of the staff and the lovely room. Check in was a breeze-- we were given a gorgeous top floor room with high ceilings, a chandelier and balcony overlooking the rooftops. The bathroom was huge and had a soaking tub large enough for my 6'4 boyfriend. I loved that the hotel was in a neighborhood a little away from the chaos of the touristy center. The concierge was extremely helpful in securing all our dinner reservations (note, most restaurants do not open or answer their phone until 7:30 pm, so make reservations the day before). In the neighborhood, we walked to dinner at Santopodre, which was excellent and filled with well heeled locals. I skipped breakfast at the hotel, but was able to get coffee to go from the dining room without a problem. We walked from the hotel to almost everywhere in Rome-- including the Colosseum. Travastere and the Vatican were quick cab rides away-- we didn't bother with public transport as it was very easy to get taxis everywhere, and the cab drivers were charming and efficient. We also used the indoor pool several times-- it was great to go for a relaxing swim after a day of sightseeing. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel....Nothing is ever for free.....”
Reviews.Author: NYCshopper
Reviews.Content: It was our fifth stay at this hotel and I must say I am even more impressed then before. The location really is fabulous with the Spanish steps and the Borghese Gardens in easy walking distance. People who talk about breakfast are a bit inexperienced in my mind because right across the street (50 feet) is the Cafe de Paris which has amazing pastries and coffee..espresso etc all fresh and for two people was 14 euros a day including two refills. Fabulous. There are two other coffee shops another 50 feet from here...all good. We have been staying here for years. From the Westin we could walk or find our way anywhere easily. Taxi's were happily available to take us to/from the hotel from anywhere....different from the Hilton where the Taxi's previously gave us a hard time, going for a fixed rate..... Many restaurants are in the area...many of them excellent....I always wish I had more time to spend here. When we arrived there was a European conference of Banking professionals so there were mostly Europeans here. This was great was we enjoy the different languages and influences. Great people watching. Our room was fabulous as always, large, great bathroom, excellent sheets and bedding as well as turn down service and great pillows of all types. There were some dings but overall we thought our room as in the past was fabulous....This is a heritage hotel...anyone who expects new....should stay at a new hotel not a hotel that has been around for 80+ years...come on...you must be practical. This place is like a converted palace. Many people complain that "for the price" this hotel didn't measure up. Every time I read this I roll my eyes because certain cities are indeed expensive. Rome is one of those cities. When people expect "American" size rooms in Rome on points or discount rates through various travel based websites offering huge discounts...it is no wonder people negative feedback these large hotels. Unrealistic expectations are tough to meet for the best of businesses or hotels. This hotel has beautiful rooms overlooking the Via Veneto as well as basic rooms (read travelocity, expedia) facing an abandoned courtyard with little light and no view. It is no wonder many people who leave feedback have negativity....you DO get what you pay for here. This hotel has a GREAT location, excellent beds, and friendly service. If I had one complaint it would be that their Concierge desk should all be fired and replaced with some new blood who are all not on the take.....that said...firing employees in Italy is like in Greece...near impossible. Until then....I suggest you do your own research and ask for NO information other than a free map from this group....The faces have remained the same throughout the years (10+)and I am sure the commissions are shared. While I know many of their recommendations are good....I also know that after 10+ years of coming to Rome, much of what they recommend gets them a hefty commission and us a mediocre meal. Beware. We never use this group. This all said, this hotel is a 9+ out of 10.. Enjoy Roma... Ciao, NYCshopper

Reviews.Title: “The bar and lounge inside the Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TOMARO
Reviews.Content: At the request of a good friend back in the USA who has been to this hotel with his corporate guests he suggested we go to the bar to just have a drink. So one afternoon when we were having some down time in our tour we went there because it was right across the street from our hotel. We love Prosecco so we ordered two glasses. As we took the first sip we both looked at each and said is this not the finest Prosecco we have ever tasted? Of course is was as we asked the bartender to let us see the bottle..It was from Valdobiadene the heart of the Prosecco making area. We got four different bowls of nuts, snacks and finger sandwich along with the dirink. Since we hadn't planned to stop for lunch this fit the bill rather nicely. Some people might say spending 12 Euros per drink is a bit high but remember it included lunch especially when you are not expecting it.. If you love Prosecco do yourself a favor and check out the bar/lounge. You won't be sorry. The wait staff was very attentive to us as there was nobody else in the bar at mid afternoon.

Reviews.Title: “Family trip”
Reviews.Author: Brenda C
Reviews.Content: We visited Rome and other parts of Italy with family members and stayed at the Westin Excelsior. Our rooms were very comfortable and well appointed. We actually had a family room (like a living room) which adjoined two of our rooms which was wonderful. It gave us a place to meet, talk about our day and relax while skyping with family at home. The staff was very friendly and helpful. A great choice if you are in Rome. With in walking distance of Spanish Steps and Trevi fountain. We even walked from the Vatican back to the hotel (a longer walk). The restaurant was nice. If your breakfast is included that's great. If it's not included we found it a little pricey for our family. The fitness center was a big plus as well.

Reviews.Title: “High Rent District”
Reviews.Author: PalmSprings13
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in one of the high rent districts of Rome. Expect to pay a premium for food and drink nearby. The hotel is well placed for walking, or if you use taxis, not very good for public transport. Most of our days ended with a taxi back to the hotel, about €9.00. The hotel is tired, but clean. Our room was very large by European standards, and the bathroom was great. The staff are helpful, if approached, but even the doorman did not greet you with a smile. I do expect more from a 5 star hotel staff. Even though we enjoyed the hotel, we would probably stay in a different part of Rome the next time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: msviv
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, nice location, could use a bit of renovation but all in all very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice for First Trip to Rome!”
Reviews.Author: Larchmere
Reviews.Content: This hotel gem was our home base for a recent trip to Rome. It is filled with ornate gold trim, faux marble and real marble and an upscale air. We specifically asked for a "renovated room" and we got a lovely room with all the newer updates on the 4th floor. Our room had fancy star patterned carpeting, thick fabric crown headboard designs, alovely view of the streets and buildings below, a modern flat screen tv, and a gorgeous chandelier in the middle of the room. There were several elevators and we were able to easilly navigate our route down the halls. The food in the hotel was top notch and the service was excellent. The wifi was 4 Euros for one hour or 15 Euros for a full day. One evening I purchased an hour of wifi and the reception was bad and they gave me a full credit when I told them it kept disconnecting me. The location of this hotel was great, we were able to walk to the main shopping streets and to the nearby park which was a delight to experience. There are many restuarants and shops within range of this hotel and we felt we were in a very safe area. The beds were amazing! After staying in this hotel I will be partial to staying in Westin hotels again simply because of how nice the beds were. They left candies on the pillow after turn down service and the soaps were in cute leaf shapes. This is a wonderful hotel to stay in for your first Rome trip, as it was for us. Top notch all the way. Enjoy Roma~

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed and pricey”
Reviews.Author: Tim L
Reviews.Content: We were really disappointed by the poor condition of our room. We were upgraded to a bigger room. But the room was old, the floor had lots of stains, many power pulgs did not work, the shower curtain was dirty, and many light bulbs were broken. Plus, we only got 3 coat hangers. For the price we paid, anyone should expect a more modern and cleaner room.

Reviews.Title: “Fit for Royalty and Tourists”
Reviews.Author: RDMWorldTravel
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is very well located, right on Via Veneto (think of it as Rodeo Dr. in Rome). Walking distance to Spanish Steps and a few more minutes to Pantheon and other sites. Check in was quick and smooth there were no delays. Valet is available on site for $40 euro per day. Normal rate for this area. The room (we stayed in a Junior suite) was very comfortable and large in size. The bathroom was larger than normal to European standards. The staff were courteous and always helpful all the time. Plenty of restaurants in the area as well as bars. Many outdoor dining areas along the street. Not sure if the hotel is kid friendly (I was traveling with my teenage daughter), but it does look like it is. The hotel did not feel uptight at all, I was very pleased with the room and service all the way around. As for Breakfast, it was not included in my room rate so I had to pay (I believe around 30 Euro per person) The buffet style breakfast was very large and well stocked with cereal, juices, meats, eggs, etc. My opinion, get out and have a simple Italian breakfast out in the streets at a Coffee Bar. At that price, I could have a full meal later in the day and still have change. I would say that 90% of the guest in the hotel were American, everywhere I turned I heard American English, so it's easy to know that the staff were very fluent in English. The only real issue I had was when I ordered "caffe" they brought me a cup of American coffee, I told the waiter I wanted "Normal Coffee", got upset and 5 minutes later brought me an espresso that was cold. I think it was more my fault since I am use to getting espresso everywhere in Italy. One of the better stays in Rome for me.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay!”
Reviews.Author: patriciaw9
Reviews.Content: I treated ourselves to a night here through Starwood Preferred Guest points plus pay. We were upgraded to a high floor, huge room with a balcony overlooking Via Veneto. The rooms are classical furnishing, comfortable beds with a huge bathroom but the rooms are a bit tired and need upgrading. Breakfast very expensive $90 euros each. We did enjoy The Westin in Rome and it was a very enjoyable experience.

Reviews.Title: “long in the tooth”
Reviews.Author: brittGlendora_Ca
Reviews.Content: i stayed in this particular hotel in 1962 while doing my grand tour of europe courtesy of my parents i remembered it fondly the location is still great and the staff wonderful with no"attitude" and very helpful the rooms still look the same and need some work they look straight out of 2 centuries ago but are huge and the bathrooms huge unfortunately, when you look closely you see that there is need for renovation the maid service is outstanding with bed turndown, candy, and floor mats where you get out of bed it does not look modern if that is what you are after but if it is service and location you want, this is the place and the beds are wonderful and the bathrooms have serparate shower and tub

Reviews.Title: “Westin Needs Some Help”
Reviews.Author: AnaheimHillsDucati
Reviews.Content: This is the 2nd Westin European Hotel that I have stayed at that dissapointed me. The 1st one was the Marlboro in London. It was a complete toilet. The problem with the Excelsior in Rome isn't that bad, but they need to spend some money on house cleaning, painting, furniture refurbishment....the place is just kind of worn out. Customers who pay 5 Star prices expect, 5 Star facilities.....If you were to compare the Excelsior Rome, to a hotel like say....the New Otani in Toyko, it's like they exist two different 5 Star universes. Unfortunately for the paying public/traveler, we still foot the bill. The location is fantastic, the atmosphere & customer service is indifferent. I spend a lot of my time & money on pleasure travel with my wife.....she loves to travel, in fact she is planning a trip to Spain & Portugal for the spring of next year.....I won't be spending my 5 Star money at any Westin European properties in the future......Tally Ho!!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury in Rome”
Reviews.Author: sandybeachsareus
Reviews.Content: Our last two nights in Italy were spent here . What a beautiful hotel. We had a grand suite and it was lovely. Almost did not want to leave the room. Clean, quiet, air conditioned, huge bathroom, amazing shower, great bed, great service. This is expensive, no doubt, no free bufet breakfast here, but if you want to treat yourself come here. If you like to walk Rome is great for just picking a direction and going out for the day. The hotel is a good spot to head out from. We walked to a number of sites from here and when we were tired the taxi's were not too expensive. Not for families. Business or couples are good to go. Enjoy

Reviews.Title: “In a nutshell... well, no”
Reviews.Author: Panos M
Reviews.Content: I’m afraid I will add little value to the comments already posted about the hotel and would prefer not to go down the “me and my girlfriend went there and it was sooo lovely” or “I’ve been places and I tell you it’s not worth it” etc etc so I’ll keep it nice and to the point. Pros 1. Location - good location, quite central, has a taxi piazza right at the corner which I found extremely handy. The US embassy across the street adds a bit more security to the area with the additional carabinieri (or not, depends on your point of view) 2. Room - high ceilings, great bed. The mattress is to die for. If you’ve got sleeping problems, the “heavily bed” is your medicine Cons 1. Old establishment - this is a very old hotel and needs refurbishment yesterday (unless you buy the “it’s not old, it’s worn out because it’s classic” story). Imagine Europa & Regina in Venice but 1000 years older and without the character 2. Reservation – arrived late (almost midnight) and tired as I was, I was unpleasantly surprised when escorted to a twin bedroom when I explicitly requested a double (matrimoniale) during my reservation. Was then escorted to a double on the first floor right next to the elevator overlooking the beautiful inner courtyard’s A/C and water infrastructure... 3. Room – you need to keep the tap running for a good 5 mins until the hot water kicks in... Perfect for pleasant wake-ups... 4. Staff – indifferent is the appropriate word. No smiles, no sense you are at home, just the usual SWAT in-and-out approach (probably too personal of a comment here, but am always spending my birthday on a city break and this was the first time I didn’t even get a “happy birthday dude, you look like 18, keep it up”) 5. Internet – 4 euro for an hour, 12 euros for 24hrs for wireless internet in a 5 star hotel at this day and age?!? Really? 6. Value for money – almost £600 for 2 nights is hands down the most overpriced hotel I’ve ever visited Conclusion – had the time of my life in Rome but no thanks to the Excelsior. Would not visit again, not for that price. This is not me being stuck-up, but I’ve always been staying at SLH hotels across the world and I know what 5-stars is supposed to be. This was not. Will not deviate again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Chain Hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: La_D0lce_Vita
Reviews.Content: The Westin is not terribly far from the Spanish Steps and is extremely close to the Borghese Gardens. If you feel most comfortable staying at a chain hotel with a familiar name in somewhat close proximity to the sights; then the Westin would be an excellent choice. A Starwood Hotel and it does what it says for guests. Nice amenties and pleasant service. The room I had (559) was quiet and large. It had an immense bathroom and shower and faced inward toward the inside of hotel so there was no street noise. The bed was a king and comfy. While I didn't use any of the amenities of the hotel; they did look quite nice. This was a business trip so price point was not a consideration. However, I did look to stay the weekend at the Westin and it was quite expensive. Would I stay here again? Maybe if the price was right. However, I have been to Rome numerous times and know that you can find less expensive hotels and still decent hotels in even closer proximity to the sights. If you are in Rome, you actually do not spend much time in your rooom- or shouldn't anyway! You are there to explore. The Westin is a very nice hotel and I would recommend it to others if they felt most comfortable with a name brand establishment. I think you can find more competiviely priced smaller hotels closer to the sights if you are willing to forsake some amenities such as spa and fancy lobby. All and all it is a four and a half star hotel and is very service oriented.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely superb start to our honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: crackerman
Reviews.Content: We began our Italy honeymoon tour with a couple of nights here in Rome. What can I say...it far exceeded expectations. On arrival we were congratulated, checked in very efficiently and made our way to our complimentary upgraded room. I had previously emailed requesting a room on a high floor with a nice view to impressive my wife, and this was certainly accommodated...along with an upgrade, personal letter from the general manager, and champagne & strawberries delivered to our room. The room was extremely comfortable (especially the beds), the bathroom luxurious (particularly the shower) and the staff fell over themselves to ensure we were happy. The doorman looked horrified when he saw me picking up a suitcase! Every detail was taken care of. Breakfast is very pleasant, and room service after a late arrival was better than some meals we have dined out. If I had a complaint (to make this a balanced review) it would be that the air conditioning in the room was a bit "all or nothing" and was fairly aggressive at times when we just needed a small dose of it! We would return and I would unreservedly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Could Not Have Been Nicer”
Reviews.Author: NYSojourner
Reviews.Content: We booked Hotel Barocco as it was recommended as a "4" star hotel near Piazza Barberini. It was horrendous and more like a 2 star hotel with 4 star pricing. Fairly awful. Trip Advisor isn't flawless. We escaped down the road to The Westin Excelsior where they could not have been nicer and more accomodating. The hotel is gorgeous and is housed in a spectacular 200 year old renovated building. Everyone we encountered was charming and helpful. Despite the fact that we were like strays off the street after our miserable Hotel Barocco experience, the Wstin was, literally, a breath of fresh air.

Reviews.Title: “Pure luxury!”
Reviews.Author: LolaEire
Reviews.Content: Magnificent hotel, pure luxury. Beautiful, nothing bad to say about this hotel. Highly recommend. Rooms, bathrooms, views all beautiful

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: kcswimmer
Reviews.Content: 5 nights at the hotel in a luxurious suite. The facility was great and the service was quite good. Requests of concierge were handled reasonably but they seemed overworked and did not complete tasks they said they would. Not so good when you have to check on the concierge.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room with a great view!”
Reviews.Author: CKAPPRAISALS
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was not very friendly but the hotel itself was very nice. We did have one night with no hot water. The tub in our room did not drain and it was very difficult to receive extra wash cloths. But the room was very comfortable and the view from the balcony was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury in Rome”
Reviews.Author: lucypup
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5 arrived at the hotel around 3pm after an overnight flight. We were given 2 rooms adjoining. The rooms were spotless and luxurious. The bathroom was beautiful and the beds were heavenly. The girl at the front desk who checked us in was very friendly and helpful. My daughter had a lot of questions about Rome and she was happy to answer all her questions in perfect English too. The concierge was very helpful with maps. And restaurant suggestions. The location of the hotel was great, walking distance to the Spanish steps, trevi fountain and lots of shops. It is an expensive hotel but for Rome the value is good.

Reviews.Title: “lovely, great way to spend points”
Reviews.Author: ETnewlyweds
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently traveled to Rome and loved this hotel. The decor had nice details, including the chandelier. We were upgraded to suite because of our status, which was great. I think the points/night have increased since we initially booked, so that made us feel that we had a deal. We were also given complimentary champagne. The concierge staff were helpful and friendly. I know that king sized beds are not common in Europe, but I was surprised that this fancy hotel had two twin beds pushed together. The location is convenient - a 4 minute walk to the Barbareni metro stop. The restaurants near there seemed to have more locals than tourists. We stayed for three nights and loved, loved Rome. First, you should look into the "NewRomeFreeTour." Our tour was incredible; entertaining and informative. Second, instead of spending lots of time and money going to Pompeii, consider trying Ostia Antica. it is off of the metro - the same line goes out to the beach. Third, enjoy - I'm jealous that you are planning your trip here :)

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Satravellar
Reviews.Content: Great location, best in Rome for access to all tourist attractions. Large and imposing in grand hotel tradition. Big lobby and bar area. Rooms are huge in today's standards. Room we stayed in very comfortable but decor slightly outdated. Breakfast a feast!

Reviews.Title: “A suite to die for...”
Reviews.Author: nycman17
Reviews.Content: Our second visit to Roma and the Westin Excelsior was an unforgettable experience. We checked in around 8AM to the hotel where we expected not to have a room ready for us. The desk clerk informed us that a room will be ready for us in about 20 minutes and being SPG Gold members that we were being upgraded. He offered us complimentary coffee and pastries while we waited for our room. A few minutes later he informed us that the room was being prepared, however if we were willing to wait an HOUR that he was going to upgrade us to a full corner suite!!! An hour later we checked in to our 3 room corner suite with a fireplace!!! We enjoyed every moment we spent in our room for the next 5 nights. We even invited our local friends to see the room and get a few drinks at the bar. Looking forward to our third visit to Roma and the Westin Excelsior….

Reviews.Title: “Terrible hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Shipgeek
Reviews.Content: After 8 hour flight, only thing more tired than us, was this hotel. Staff was very friendly when we checked in. We were given a large room, that looked nice when we first walked into it. But on closer inspection, it quickly revealed it's age. And showed how far the service in this hotel has fallen. The room seemed to have been stripped bare of any decorative elements, as if they were afraid someone would steal them. In addition there were no travel guides, magazines or even a soap dish in the bathroom. The furniture looked dirty and like it had been purchased at a flea market. The bedding was nice. We did appreciate the buffet breakfast the hotel provided, but couldn't understand why none of the coffee pots had lids. Plates were put on top of the pots to keep the coffee warm. Food was adequate. Rarely was there a night doorman on duty after 9:00 pm. The one night we saw one, he was too busy playing Angry Birds on his IPhone to notice us. The best feature of this hotel is it's location. It's conveniently located near the Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, and Borghese Park. But I won't return until Westin fully renovates, and upgrades it's staff.

Reviews.Title: “Polite but not friendly”
Reviews.Author: Starwood2011
Reviews.Content: The Westin Excelsior, Rome is a beautiful old European hotel and we were escorted to our room. The comment I wish to reinforce is that the staff was Polite, but not Friendly. I was a little caugh off guard by this, having stayed at many Westins in the past. I had previously read this comment, and I do reaffirm it. There is a in door pool, spa, steam and sauna and work out area. The hours were good for use. We stayed on SPG points and received a super upgrade to a two room suite. One room was a full living room and a separate room for the bed room. If you are not on the breakfast included plan, the cost of the buffet was 29 Euro per person. There was no coffee maker in our room, and I must admit, I did miss in-room hot tea at night and coffee in the AM. The hotel location was good. If you exit the hotel and walk to your right, you are a few blocks from a very nice large park. If you need a taxi, they seemed to be right around the corner and appeared out of no where quickly.

Reviews.Title: “disappointing....”
Reviews.Author: ArabianGlobeTrotters
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of its location and reputation, expecting there would be an acceptable level of service and comfort. We could not find it... When we arrived it took forever to check-in. Although it was a busy afternoon, the hotel's management could have easily added more people at the reception desk. We waited a good 20 min (with no apology) just to get our room keys. The room was small and old. The bathroom was antiquated and when using the shower, the whole place was flooded. Not a great way to start your day. The only redeeming thing about this hotel is its location in the beautiful Via Vittorio Veneto and the concierge service which was friendly and generally gave good advice.

Reviews.Title: “"Love the location but time for a serious renovation"”
Reviews.Author: HenryK1
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights earlier this month celebrating our 26th anniversary before moving on to 10 days in Sicily. We had stayed at this property 5 years ago and had a much better experience than we did this time. For both stays I was a SPG Gold member and Platinum AMEX. Our stay five years ago included an upgrade to a fabulous room with a view of the Via Venato including two balconies, king size bed and fireplace. This time, we were told we at check-in that we were being upgraded because of our anniversary and we were elated.....until we saw our room. It was a closet! A filthy, tired, smelly old closet. I immediately told them that the room was unacceptable and they proceeded to give us a new room. Not much better. Although it was no longer a closet, the carpeting was stained and dirty throughout the room, paint was missing everywhere and the bathroom door was filthy. This could have easily been prevented by housekeeping. On the plus side, the bar in the hotel was as good as we experience during our first stay. The staff was excellent, very friendly and accomodating. In addition, the concierge was also very friendly and helpful. That's about it. The hotel has truly seen better days and should realize that it can no longer rest on accolades from the past. The property is in need of significant renovations, specifically in the guest rooms and hallways. The public areas of the hotel are very nice and I imagine the 4-5 rooms that are used for publicity photos are ok as well. My family and I have stayed at many 5-star properties around the world, including the usual Ritz, Four Seasons and St. Regis brands,and although this property is rated as 5-star I assure you, it is not. My wife and I did enjoy our stay in Rome and were grateful to the hotel for congratulating us on our anniversary as well as sending a bottle of sparkling wine and strawberries to our room. However, until I read that the hotel has undergone a full restoration, and not the typical Roman restoration of covering everything with new paint, we will stay at a defferent property on our next visit to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “What you would expect it would be...”
Reviews.Author: NYHokie
Reviews.Content: High end quality, spacious, great location in a ritzy area. Within walking distance to the Spanish Steps. The staff at the hotel was friendly and highly knowledgeable of things to do in Rome and how to get to specific restaurants we previously researched. They lined up transportation to the airport and restaurants for us. The more affordable way to stay here would be to use any points you may have earned previously. The walk to the subway system is only 5 minutes from the hotel.
