The great location, the friendly staff, the huge room, the large American style bathroom are all reasons that I will return to this hotel on my next visit to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Coquus
Reviews.Content: Location is great, you have plenty of transportation to go to the center and return at any time. Rooms are big and very confortable. The westin bed is awesome! Bathrooms are also very big and very nice! I only took breakfast at the hotel. No lunch neither dinner but prices were reasonable. Breakfast buffet was ok, not outstanding. Staff at the reception was friendly but those who were outside in the main door weren't so polite... I would recomend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Past it's prime”
Reviews.Author: happy427
Reviews.Content: Stayed here before and liked it. Now, hotel is really warn. Dirt around edges of carpet in room. Concierges were rude and it felt like they were laughing at simple questions. Maybe it's because we are spoiled and usually stay at better hotels like four seasons and we knew that this would not be at that level but we hated it. Even the breakfast buffet, at 20 euros each was an awful, small, picked over selection of food.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel but Short on Service”
Reviews.Author: Maryanne045
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Excelsior primarily because we have Westin Starwood Gold Points. The Hotel itself is very beautiful and presents a relaxing atmosphere in the lobby and the attached bar. For the price, the room was average. Similar price ranges at the Four Seasons will get you a much better room. We were very disappointed in the service. We requested early check-in and did Not get it. We requested an upgrade and did not get it. The Concierge was condescending at best ; his recommendations were marginal. The place he suggested for lunch was in a downstairs restaurant...no windows, obviously, no view & it was a beautiful day in May in Rome! We did Not eat at that restaurant. Overall, a disappointing experience. We were awaiting a memorable experience, and it did not happen.

Reviews.Title: “okay but there are better options when in Rome”
Reviews.Author: pandg27
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin while touring Italy with my teen aged granddaughter. I have been to this beautiful city many times.I have always stayed at hotels above the Spanish steps which is much more centrally located than the Westin which although is on the Via Veneto is not really close by the main attractions and active areas, unless shopping is your thing. The room was adequate but small and there was no walk-in shower. Typical ornate decoration(red brocade walls,chandelier etc) Because we were on a "tour" I dont exactly know the price of the room, but it was clearly on the expensive side. The public rooms were nice and the buffet breakfast was okay. The internet charge was 15 euros per day.Steep The staff was neither rude nor exceptionally helpful.Look around. There are better places in Rome

Reviews.Title: “nice, old hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: PCT1212
Reviews.Content: We stayed only one night as we were heading out on a cruise, but the staff at this hotel was exceptional. The hotel is quite old but our room was big enough for a king bed and a rollaway. All of our requests were handled immediately. The location is in a really nice neighborhood downtown and within walking distance of many sites. We enjoyed our stay very much.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience at the Westin Excelsior”
Reviews.Author: ltgmead
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our 3 children and friends who also have 3, for 3 nights in July prior to a Mediterranean cruise. We had 4 rooms between the 2 families, all paid with Starwood points. We couldn't have been happier. The rooms were clean and spacious. We found the staff to be perfectly adequate and the location ideal. Our 4 older boys were able to find their way to the Thursday night pub crawl starting at the Spanish Steps, and miraculously, find their way back to the hotel many hours later! We found great restaurants within walking distance. Overall, we would definitely recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: esa81
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin Excelsior Rome for two nights in early July. I read the reviews before we traveled and was a little concerned about the negative comments. In our case, there was no cause to worry. Our family had two rooms on the 3rd floor. Both looked fairly recently remodeled. They had lovely chandeliers and fabric wall coverings - but none of the dust and wear that some writers have complained of. The marble bathrooms were huge, with nice toiletries and towels. One room had a street view, the other one - across the hall - looked out on another part of the building. But we spent little time in the rooms and views were not our priority. The rooms were clean and the beds were comfortable. The lobby area of the hotel was elegant, with lots of seating. We ate one dinner and two breakfasts in the hotel restaurant, Restaurant Doney, which was similarly decorated with stunning chandeliers and mirrors. The buffet breakfast was excellent, with more food selections than we could possibly eat. (I should note that the breakfast buffet was also extremely expensive and our family of five would not have had it if it wasn't included with our rooms). Restaurant service was good. My eight-year old had fun cooling off in the hotel pool after a hot afternoon. The pool was small but the area was pleasant and clean. There were four or five families swimming during the time we spent there. As for location, the hotel isn't in the middle of the tourist spots, but getting to the Trevi Fountain/Spanish Steps area by foot is perfectly manageable if you don't mind a walk. We didn't stay long enough to try out any public transportation options. There are a number of restaurants and bars near the hotel, and we had lunch at a good spot that was recommended by the concierge. Overall, my family and I thought that this was a lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Spectacular Rooms”
Reviews.Author: CarteBlancWine
Reviews.Content: The rooms ae filled are luxurious and the hotel holds much history. Stayed here several times. Favorite hotel in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “very nice but don't think it's worth the money”
Reviews.Author: RDP1009
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean and staff is nice, friendly, & helpful. The location is decent, about 5 min walk to nearby train station and very close to the Borghese gallery & gardens. It's in an expensive area of town and a typical "high-end" hotel, but still didn't think it was worth the money we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Classy Rome”
Reviews.Author: Amaracampsbay
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel -great location to walk around and it has that real Rome elegance. The concierge's restaurant recommendation (a family restaurant in Trastevere) was absolutely perfect. Our son loved the indoor swimming pool. The (upgrade) room was extremely big with a balcony and the bed was extremely comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Grand and elegant in a quite part of the city”
Reviews.Author: fvaracch
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during a tauck Tour in July. The hotel is very grand and elegant looking. The rooms were very spacious considering in Europe. The resturant attatched was very nice. The hotel is situated next to the US Embassey but is in walking distance to many area attractions. Asked the concerige a few questions wasnt overly helpful, and suggested a resturant around the corner that was very overpriced, they could have done a better job recommending a resturant right down teh block which was much better.

Reviews.Title: “Stunningly beautiful hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: happymomof6
Reviews.Content: We (two daughters and myself) arrived in Rome after visiting Florence and Siena. As we opened the door to our room, our breath was taken away! Very lovely...opulent and luxurious, from the bed to the bathroom and the beautiful chandelier! It was exquisite! And, after touring Rome all day, it was a wonderful place to come back to and relax. Wonderful stay and highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Not a good experience!!”
Reviews.Author: Nightmare074
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at this hotel in Rome at least once a year for more than 10 years, however, on our last recent visit we did not have a good experience. The room that we were given was of the old decoration and very dark - red velvet walls and heavy curtaining, the cleanliness of the bathroom left a lot to be desired. We had hairs in the bathtub and felt that it was not properly cleaned from the past occupant. The hotel is full of large loud tourist groups that held their morning meetings in the lounge area. The check in staff were very unfriendly and had a "couldn't care attitude" about them. When we complained about our room they gave a "take it or leave it "kind of response even though we mentioned that we have been returning for many years. When you look at their website the rooms shown look modern and very nice, however, this was not one of the rooms that we were given. It is well situated with many tourist attractions and shopping close by, but we feel that they only care about package groups and not individual customers. Also for such a high priced hotel we felt that they should not be charging extra to use the internet.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but a bit pricey”
Reviews.Author: blondeylocks
Reviews.Content: There is no arguing with the location and the service would want to be excellent for the price we paid (and it was) but I couldn't help wanting to pull back all the curtains and giving the place a good airing! I know this is just a matter of taste but I found the bedroom a little stuffy and in need of refurbishment.

Reviews.Title: “A little out of the way from major sights”
Reviews.Author: travelsmartnj
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin Excelsior for five nights using our starwood points.We were upgraded to a deluxe room as we are Starwood gold. Room was a nice size but air conditioning did not work well and it was over 90 the days we were there. Indoor pool was small and crowded but health club was nice. Front elevators are small and claustrophobic but had to be used for part of the time as the other elevators were out of order. Unfortunately, they did not think about putting a sign on the broken elevator at each floor and people were waiting for it We did not have breakfast there as it was almost 30 Euros. Instead we walked aa block or so down a side street and had a continental breakfast of coffee, big bowl of fruit, juice and pastry for 10E.. They were thankful we came up and told them. The hotel is about a 10 minute walk from the top of the Spanish Steps . We planned to walk everywhere and the Westin location was out of the way of the major Rome sights. Front desk staff was friendly but the concierge was really not much of a help.

Reviews.Title: “Fantabulous Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: ajm2222
Reviews.Content: We stayed on July 6th through 9th. Great service, our room was fantastic, Giovanni at the front desk took me around and showed me a few rooms to select from (Maybe it helped that I was a Paisan, and was headed to Sicily to visit family). Rooms looked new and large, i believe it was in the 100's, was able to acces by far stairwell. For a great bar, (and by bar, I mean the Italian Bar's, cafe, tavola calda), exit hotel, turn right at corner, and then left at next street, about 20 yards on left side. Friendly old man runs bar, great prices. Service was excellent, especially when needed a cab or info for the train station, get this from the guys standing outside, the concierge's were really no help.

Reviews.Title: “Old dame in need of refresh”
Reviews.Author: bighead33
Reviews.Content: Good hotel in good location. The rooms are large by european standards but need a remodeling in a hurry. the condition of the walls, carpets are not good. The air conditioners don't cool the rooms, we had to take several showers during the day to stay cool. Service was excellent and other from the room condition theres nothing bad to say.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, romantic and luxurious”
Reviews.Author: UncleDMD
Reviews.Content: The Excelsior is a truly wonderful hotel that feels like the heart of Rome. The beautiful and elegant furnishings are appropriate to the neighborhood, the staff friendly and helpful and the room we had was opulent but highly functional. As with most high-end European hotels that are owned by an American brand (Starwood in this case), membership benefits are provided but not to the same extent as in the US. (No free water or 4 pm check-out for Gold members, e.g.) Nonetheless, we couldn't have been happier with the quality, service or location of this marvelous hotel, and we will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Don't yell fire”
Reviews.Author: onenightstands
Reviews.Content: Points were used for this hotel stay. The first room we were shown was adequate, but not what I expected. I requested a look at another room which was larger and a half step up in comfort. The front desk and gym staff were very pleasant and service oriented. Fire and Safety considerations are important to me where ever I stay. The exit lights are quite small and would provide little help in a smoke filled hallway. This is an old hotel, and the floor plan can be confusing. I did not see emergency lighting (battery backup type) possibly they have a generator that would kick in (hopefully). Loved the sauna and indoor pool. I would probably not stay here again, unless the points needed were reduced. Modern signage saves lives, install it!

Reviews.Title: “NOT the place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: llpollack
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived at the hotel, we sensed there were going to be problems. Rome was the final leg of our trip (having been to Venice, Florence and the Amalfi Coast). We arrived to the hotel around 12:30, after taking the train from Salerno. The gentleman at the Reception desk told us in no uncertain terms that our room would "certainly not be ready anytime prior to 2:30pm". He was not nice about it, but rather fairly snooty. How dare us try to check in early with our two children... We returned to the hotel at 5:30 pm to check in. We went up to rooms 344 and 345. Both were very standard, run-of-the-mill rooms. However, 345 had a large wad of gum on the floor, and was about ninety degrees (30 centigrade). The a/c was not on or not working. We called down, to let them know that the room was not acceptable. They assured me that they would call back with an alternate room in 5 minutes. 15 minutes later, I called down again and was told that someone was on their way to move us. The porter that came up did not speak any English (not an issue, if there were not any issues) and showed us to a room on the 6th floor, 3 floors away from our young children. Clearly, this was not acceptable, so we returned to the front desk, and they miraculously were able to find a room on the 3rd floor, 4 rooms away from our kids. No one was apologetic. The next day, we sat in the lobby for 15 minutes, trying to get someone to notice us so that we could order a drink. We finally decided to leave, as we were totally ignored. The following morning, we arrived to breakfast at 9AM. We were quickly ushered to the bar area, because we must have looked like we wouldn't complain that we were not able to eat in the regular breakfast room. In the bar, there was a limited selection, the tables were tiny, and again, we were ignored. The final straw came upon checkout, when the hotel decided that everyone should donate to Unicef. I have nothing against the charity, and am quite charitable. I simply don't want it to be placed on my bill without my prior approval. Additionally, we were charged daily for breakfast, which was to have been included in our exhorbitant rate (445 euros/room/night). When I told this to the blond clerk at the reception desk she said, "Well, we all make mistakes. You can write a letter to the hotel manager." She was condescending and nasty. After a delightful stay at the Santa Caterina on the Amalfi Coast, this hotel could not have been more of a disappointment. I will recommend that none of my friends ever stay here. It's a Westin with a snobby Rome air. Stay away.

Reviews.Title: “Better hotels in Rome...”
Reviews.Author: trock24
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just finished a 2 week trip to Italy. We saved, what we thought, was the best hotel in Rome for our last 2 days. Being an SPG gold member, we used 50,000 points for this hotel. If you are not familiar with the point system, it is a lot of points. We expected great things, but received very little. The first room we were given was big and very worn. Just imagine stained carpets, and very worn furniture. We were then moved to a newer room... I would say, less worn. The service, below average, definitely not worth the $ or points. There are better hotels in Rome. I am a big fan of the SPG network of hotels, but this one let me down. If I lowered my expections, I would have loved this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nicest hotel we've ever stayed at!”
Reviews.Author: mbshell3
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in July and absolutely loved it! My boyfriend is a SPG and we were upgraded to an incredible suite with views overlooking the U.S. Embassy. The staff was very friendly, especially the woman who showed us to our room. The bed and pillows were amazing! It's in a great location, easy walk to lots of major sights and great restaurants. We would love to stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Good location but hotel is "tired"”
Reviews.Author: Mickeywayne
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a good location(via veneto) but was in need of refurbishing. The service was fair. The restaurant ran out of paper coffee cups so we were unable to get coffee to go in the early am(they open at 7am). Housekeeping did not replenish shampoo and soap. Desk staff and concierge were friendly and efficient. Rooms were fine but need to be refurbished. Gym was adequate. I think wifit should be included, especially since it is "turtle" slow.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: SeaBright16
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel at the end of June and had a fabulous experience. We were upgraded to a gorgeous room with a terrace and the service was fantastic, too. Very clean and has great Italian charm, you feel like you're sleeping in a palace. The location was very nice but we needed to take cabs to most places. We would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “A lovel Gem that needs a bit of polish”
Reviews.Author: earthwalker1017
Reviews.Content: Was with family but with a large group. The lobby & common area's are lovely. The location is superb. I think there is a bit of hit and miss here. I did post a picture on twitter of the room set up.... large & spacious but rather thrown together & a tad sloppy looking which one would not expect in a Starwood Property. I brought the state of the furnishings to the attention to management immediately but nothing came of it. Didn't help that we had just come from a fabulous room & stay in Venice at the Laissidi Palace. I would stay there again if I could be assured there would be more attention to detail. I came from

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rod46
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. The location was great! It was across the street from the US Embassy and just up a small hill a short distance from the metro. There were some nice eating places nearby the hotel. It was only a five minute walk to the Spanish Steps and to our favorite gelato store. There was a grocery story just two blocks behind the hotel which was great for buying snacks at a great price. The hotel provided us with an umbrella to use during our stay. Everyone was extremely friendly and they got us in our room just minutes from our arrival at noon. I would definitely stay here again if I could book the hotel during one of the discount sales.

Reviews.Title: “Tired hotel with unfriendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: MOIntTraveler
Reviews.Content: Great location. Average rooms, especially for the price. Staff was snotty and when asked for a restaurant recommendation, sent us to a tourist trap that was notorious for offering kick-backs to hotel staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in nice area”
Reviews.Author: RedfishDave
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a 6 night stay at the Westin Excelsior and couldn't be more pleased. We had a "standard" king room. It had ample room by European standards, a beautiful marble bath with room for both of us to get ready for the day, VERY comfortable beds and pillows and enough drawer and closet space to hold most of our clothes. The room faced the side street and the US Embassy and was within sight of the intersection with Via Veneto but traffic noise was never an issue. The staff was very accomodating, friendly and spoke English. I wish the nearest Metro stop was closer but it was only about a five minute walk. Also I should have studied the bus system more as the Metro system is limited (compared to other major cities in Europe) and, at least, 2 lines run by the hotel. Taxis are always available though. If you like museums, you should definately make reservations in advance to the Borghese gallery (a short walk). It was amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Good like an Italian car. (More Alpha than Ferrari.)”
Reviews.Author: Pramstroker
Reviews.Content: When in Italy, my expectations are somewhat lower than other European countries. In Italy, it always seems a bit more worn, a bit more untidy, and people get to things when they can on when and if they choose. Same with the Excelsior. "Recently refurbished" but still somewhat worn. I should give them some slack because the hotel is in an old building. However, the baseboards are dinged, the molding has cracks, the furniture is scratched and marred, and the carpets are somewhat stained. But in Italy, I think "refurbishing" means putting another coat of paint over the old cracked paint and not "doing it right." However, as the one-week stay progressed, my view point changed. Instead of seeing Rome as fading, worn, and crumbling I became amazed that - with so much "old" in the city - it's a miracle that everything is in as good shape as it is. Our room faced the inner courtyard on the fourth floor. Usually, I like a "room with a view." No complaint this time. The streets around the hotel are very busy and noisy. So, for a good night's sleep, interior rooms are the way to go. The room was "Rome good." It had the comfortable Westin bed, two sinks, and kind of looked like a room that you would expect if you stayed in a period palazzo. The bathroom was ceiling to floor marble and the water pressure and ability to control hot/cold was good. Irritations: The bathtub was too narrow. At 6'2" - to maintain a safe, wide-enough stance while taking a shower, I had to stand sideways. And as with many hotels, the showerhead (dual) was too low. So, I couldn't stand with my back to the shower and tilt my head back to rinse my head. And the rail that you can hold on to was somewhat rickety. The solution was to use the separate wand shower head on the other wall. Speaking of which, as many hotels have gone more "green" and concerned with water use, this hotel has made no such effort. That can be good or bad depending on your perspective. However, the dual showerhead and toilet that sounded like it was using many gallons to flush used - noticeably - a lot of water. Other irritations: One day, I was lying in bed, naked, and someone from the maid staff just opened the door and came in. No knock. One night, I called room service and their was no answer. I called back and was put on hold and they didn't come back. I called again and they said they were very busy and would call back. All I wanted was a bucket of ice. I know, I'm in Europe, but in other hotels in other cities, I don't remember getting a bucket of ice to be such a big deal, especially in "near luxury" hotels like this. There are no ice machines on the floors and no ice waiting for you when you get back to your room. So, I went down to the front desk and asked for a bucket of ice. They called room service and was put on hold. About a half hour later, a bucket of ice was delivered to the room. Which brings to mind coffee. No near-luxury or luxury hotels have coffee makers in the room, right? Or very few. With this hotel, it is - as with many hotels - expensive to order coffee. The room service fee per person is 5 euros. So take the price of the coffee, the 10 euros, taxes, and you could rent a car for the day just for a pot of coffee in the morning. And actually, I don't mind paying that. What these hotels don't get is that people like me want coffee immediately when they get up in the morning. Being on vacation, I don't want to schedule it and "have to" be up when it arrives. And I don't want to order it when I get up and have to wait for it. Another couple brought their own mini-coffee maker from home. In a hotel at this price point, you shouldn't have to. In spite of the irritations, my wife and I did enjoy the hotel. Slow and few elevators non-withstanding, the lobby is expansive and ornate as are the hallways and the rooms. Like I said before, staying at the Excelsior is like staying at an Italian palazzo with air conditioning. Chandeliers, columns, gold leafing, marble, granite: all very nice. So, if you want a crisp, perfect, American-style hotel in Rome, this isn't the place for you. The hotel is located just a few blocks from the Aurelian wall and a short walk from many of the sites. The Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, and the Pantheon are all very walkable. (I actually found a way to walk underground all the way from the metro entrance at Harry's Bar to the Spanish Steps!) The Hard Rock Cafe full of Americans is just a few yards away and the Via Veneto is considered the upscale part of the city to stay in. For getting around Rome, if you're thinking about renting a car, forget it! Take taxis or walk. Yes, the Italian drivers are as crazy as they are fabled to be and parking is impossible. Taxis are very reasonable, about 5 euros from the hotel to the Termini railroad station (but be careful, at the train station after a certain time, the cab scam goes into effect and they go "off meter" and try to charge you 25 to 30 euros to get to the hotel). Since every 10 yards there is something 500 to 2,500 years old, walking is the best way to see the city. Tour buses seemed hopelessly stuck in the traffic and the taxis are quicker only because most of them seem to aspire to be Mario Andretti. The hotel offers a chauffeur service to the airport in an S class Mercedes for 85 euros and a half-day tour of Rome for 143. Normal taxi fare to the airport is 40 to 50 euros depending on traffic. The train to the Termini station from the airport is 15 euros one-way per person. Note: coming back, there is a fare for 14 euros that takes you to a stopping point at the Termini station that is almost 2 kilometers from the main station. Don't take that one. The staff was polite enough but didn't seem particularly motivated to be pro-active. Sure, if you found them and asked them a question, they would be helpful but not overly so. The Spa staff was great. The 70 euro massage was well-worth it after many days of walking. Only problem is it took me 5 minutes to figure out how to put on the little string bikini "panties" that they evidently have men wear while getting a massage. :) Room service was a bit slow but the food was good. And expensive. There is a Despar market two blocks away where we stocked up on drinks and munchables. And when checking out, beware of the mini-bar charge for items you didn't eat/drink." We had a 12 euro charge and we never eat or drink out of the mini-bar. And almost every couple we talked to that were there with us had the same charge. It seems to be a trend. The last three stays at hotels have included mini-bar charges for items we didn't eat or drink. The W in Miami took it off but then it appeared on my credit card again. The same thing happened at the Ritz Carlton in Atlanta. I'm wondering if that is a part of "Hotel 101" training: add a mini-bar charge to everyone's bill even if they didn't go into the mini-bar. Maybe they figure that if "X percentage" of customers don't contest it and they retain "X percentage" of the bogus charges, then they will make "X percent" more revenue. Very tacky and I hate to think it's true, but it's been a constant and happened again at the Excelsior. One other item: internet. 4 euros for an hour and 15 for 24-hours. Still bugs me that for what one pays for a hotel like this, they don't include the internet. In conclusion - in spite of the irritations - I rate the hotel "very good." However, if we go back to Rome, it wasn't good enough for us not to consider other hotels first. So, no, it didn't have that "wow" factor that makes me say, to myself and others, "if I go back to Rome, I'll definitely stay there." Not a bad choice, but it's like Italian cars. Sure, Alpha Romeos and Fiats are okay but they are definitely not Mercedes or BMW.

Reviews.Title: “COULDN'T HAVE BEEN NICER”
Reviews.Author: twinlions
Reviews.Content: From check-in to check-out, this was a terrific hotel experience. Incredibly friendly and understanding desk staff on all shifts, very helpful concierge who really took time with every question. Lovely room with a balcony overlooking the Via Veneto, and nicely sized (for a European hotel). Room service was fast, and the housekeeping staff was friendly and helpful. Lovely turn-down service. The hotel is well located, with metro stops a quick walk away. We had one of the best meals of our trip in the hotel restaurant, and it wasn't outrageously priced. Loved the Westin Excelsior, Rome.

Reviews.Title: “WOW WOW WOW”
Reviews.Author: Loriegirl
Reviews.Content: LOVE IT !!! The hotel could'nt have been better situated. The staff was SUPER friendly and spoke perfect english and the ROOMS WERE TO DIE FOR ...LOVED THEM.!! What a pleasure to walk into a truly grand room in a beautiful hotel. 14 foot ceilings , Velvet drapes , emboidered material as wall coverings , stupendous chandelier hanging in the middle of the room, thick luxery crown moulding all around the room and a beautiful marble bathroom with a bidet. My husband and I just stopped at the door and immediatly got our cameras out. It was BEAUTIFUL !!! We had a small balcony that looked out upon the Vatican Cathedral. It was dreamy !!! Would stay there again and again. PS the Opera House is across the street and we saw a great Opera.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great servcie”
Reviews.Author: ChrisHolvoet
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for business during couple of days, some parts in the guest room where a bit old dated, but in overal impressive hotel. Had great assistance from the concierge in getting some items send, as well from the lady in the business centre, very professional.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel - indifferent staff”
Reviews.Author: BayAreaRes
Reviews.Content: The Westin Excelsior is very well situated right on Via Venuto, a short walk to Spanish Steps, and Borghese Gallery. It is a beautiful hotel, both on the outside, lobby, as well as the rooms. Breakfast was adequate, good coffee of course, but the pastry is nothing to get too excited about. Internet is 4 euros per hour or 20 euros per day. They have a business center, but you would still have to pay the same rate if you want to use their computer (except to print a boarding pass, which is free). The concierge staff is indifferent, to say the least, maybe that is the Italian way, but they are "to the point" providing an answer, and almost never with a smile. We ordered a wake up call one morning, and the call never came, when we asked them about it later on in the day, the man at the concierge desk just shrugged, never even apologized. Considering this is a 5 stars, and my sister nearly missed her meeting (if I didn't wake up on my own and alerted her), that is a glaring fault! The bathroom only had 1 face cloth (even though they know there were 2 people in the room), and sometimes none. The kleenex box ran out of kleenex on day 2 (we were there 4 days), and it never got refilled. For the money, I think one can do better.

Reviews.Title: “Love this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: athena2apollo
Reviews.Content: This was our second time at the Excelsior Rome. First time was wonderful and this time was even better. Staff is exceptional. Friendly, helpful, polite. After ouir recent stay at the Excelsior Florence (already reviewed) we were not sure what to expect. We walked into our room and I felt like I had a room in a royal palace. I was pleased to say the least. We were not sure what kind of view we had and really did not care becasue we spend so little time in the hotel. I opened the curtains and discovered we had a balcony. Very nice! I went to draw open the curtains of the second window and discovered we had a second balcony! Needless to say we enjoyed some fine wine and food a few nights out on the balcony. I always recommend this hotel as we have never had any issue with any part of the hotel. We find it convenient for walking to all the sites and close to the metro if needed. Lots of restaurants close by and some nice reasonable shopping as well within a short distance. Thank you Excelsior Rome - we cannot wait to come back on our next trip to Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant but tired”
Reviews.Author: AlanW02
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights before a 12-day cruise. We were fortunate enough to be able to get all three nights on Starwood points - so we're certainly not quibbling about the price. We were upgraded to a "Grand Luxe" room. The room was spacious and elegant, but very, very tired. Furniture was marred and worn. Dresser drawers did not open and close well. There were two large windows facing a courtyard across the street. One was covered with layers of heavy drapes and had darkening curtains that were worn to the point of having holes in them. The other window only had one drape and would not keep much light out in the morning. The bathroom was large and well equipped. All walls were marred and scraped and badly in need of painting. There was old, beautiful damask covering on the walls and the plaster work and gold gilt was elegant. Aside from the need for updating worn and tired areas, the room was spacious, the bed comfortable. Although we did not use the internet (cost was about 15 or 20 euros a day) if we did, the only way to plug in a computer was to move the TV and cabinet holding it to reach a plug. In fact, there were a few 3-way plugs already in the outlet there for the TV, lamps, etc. All-in-all the room was OK, the service was excellent. Note that the wonderful breakfast buffet was about 29 euros a day per person. Starwood members can get it for 23 euros (about $35). That's a very expensive breakfast. We would stay there again for a similar price!!! Not sure it's worth the full regular price.

Reviews.Title: “Service was terrible, and they all wanted a tip for no service”
Reviews.Author: ruslov
Reviews.Content: We stayed here just one night. The man who checked us in, took us to our room, but explained nothing about how things worked(air conditioning, lights, phone, electricity) or where anything in the room was and yet he wanted a tip. When the bags came, the guy did not put them on the luggage holder which we had to find and guess what, he wanted a tip too. Of course when the taxi first arrived at the hotel, guess what, the fare was way over what it should have been for a 15 ride, and the hotel guy who took the luggage from the taxi driver also wanted a tip for bringing the luggage into the hotel and he was a different guy from the one who brought them to the room. Thank goodness the rooms were big and nice.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and will go back”
Reviews.Author: Jim_SF_Bay_Area
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel. A true European Grand hotel, with excellent service and in a great location. This was the location of the classic Fellini movie, "La Dolce Vita".

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dentist25
Reviews.Content: We arrived March 11 in the early morning and they had our rooms ready. Staff speaks English quite well. They upgraded both me and a friend (we're SPG Gold Members). The rooms were large and comfortable. I was on the fifth floor and had a very large balcony. The bed was great, the bathroom was very nice. Flat screen TV with plenty of english speaking channels. They have a nice bar area but we preferred to leave the hotel when wanting to have a drink. It is situated in a nice location - The Via Veneto. Very high-end and felt very safe. You can get anywhere in Rome from here in 5-10 min (by cab) and, except for the Vatican, Castel Sant' Angelo you can easily walk anywhere you want to go. I sometimes read these reviews and they are very critical about little things - who is ever perfect? This hotel was very nice and I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Beautiful Building”
Reviews.Author: Itchyfeet024
Reviews.Content: The Positives: -great location; within minutes of subway & a lot of nearby restaurants; two-minute walk for Hop On Hop Off bus. Four minute walk to the subway. -breakfast buffet -friendly staff; extremely helpful concierge (even phoned for restaurant availability); friendly breakfast manager & servers -spacious rooms (but view could have been better) -adequate selection of gym equipment -room attendant helpful The Negatives: -nothing of significant nature

Reviews.Title: “Old Worldly Hotel - probably not our ideal location”
Reviews.Author: rogi8
Reviews.Content: This hotel was aesthetically gorgeous and our room wound up being great after a few minor kinks. Location is decent as well if you want to be able to walk to some sites (villa borghese, spanish steps, trevi fountain), but need to be OK with it being very quiet at night, as well as taking taxi's which are not cheap. The rooms and hotel are very nicely decorated. When we arrived we were given a room that looked large but and comfortable but as soon as we stepped in it clearly stunk like smoke and perhaps some cleaning agent to cover it up. We asked to be moved and were told it was a non-smoking floor, which was probably true, since that is what we booked, but someone had clearly smoked there. They then moved us to a tiny room that smelled fine but was a clear downgrade from what we expected. When we spoke to the mgr he moved us to a gorgeous and large room that was more in line with what we typically get as Starwood Gold members. We were slightly frustrated that when we initially asked for the upgrade we were entitled to as Gold members they said nothing was available when it clearly was. After that the only other complaints were that the concierge recommendations were fairly uninspired, but that is obviously not a big deal. We would gladly stay there again although we booked it when it was 12k pts and now it is 20k which might give us some pause as to the value. We stayed here on points, so for us it was very good value and we were okay paying for cabs instead.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: OrlandoTennisbum
Reviews.Content: We had a good experience(as usual) with Westin. Checked in on points (gold member) and received a huge room on top floor with balcony. Talk about opulence.....all I needed was a tiara. The room wasn't ready when we arrived so we were graciously offered a table at the bar where we enjoyed drinks and snacks until the room was ready. Exceptional front desk service. Enjoyed the location that was close to metro and many attractions. Especially enjoyed the Borghesa gallery (get audio guide) and biking in gardens. San Clemente church (great excavation site),St. Peters at 5:00 mass, Vatican entry Fri. evening. Colisseum lit at night. Really enjoyed going for a refreshing swim after touring. Thanks Westin for another great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Probably the nicest hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Kitalexi
Reviews.Content: We stayed here two different times during May (we did an 11 day cruise in between). First Impressions: - classy, old world charm, expensive, first class - efficient, effective personnel This property attracted several Fortune 500 company functions while we were there and it's clear this is a landmark property. Rooms- we had an inner suite during the first stay- no view but what a pleasant surprise to stay in a city like Rome and not hear the traffic. we opened our window and had cool fresh air both nights. If you are staying here during the cooler periods and enjoy opening your window for fresh air, this room type will work for you. We still enjoyed privacy as the bed was offset from the window. - our second stay was on a balcony suite and this was probably in the top 5 nicest rooms I have ever stayed in my life. It really could be an apartment. we had to french doors and tons of room. If you are traveling for business and need a place for a meeting, this room would accommodate this and if you're a family- this is worth it. Downers- we're coffee junkies from the Northwest. We want it hot, plentiful and early. You won't get that here. If you're staying over 3 nights- you'll do well to bring your own mini Mr. Coffee and leaving it behind because coffee in the restaurant is $$$$$. And when I say $$$$$, I mean it. There isn't a Starbucks to be found and there are no local cafe's open early with take-out so plan accordingly or pay the price! Groceries- Despar is two blocks away (ask concierge for directions) and Carrefour is a bit farther but still walking distance and a bit of an adventure! Bottled water here is extremely reasonable and the wine is fine. Restaurants- if you are arriving late- bring a snack. Via Veneto has some wonderful restaurants but plan to pay top-dollar for everything. (this the grocery hint). Overall- wonderful property in one of the classiest areas of Rome. You can pretty much walk to all the destinations, as we did during our entire stay. Bring a map and don't be shy about using it. Trevi Fountain is a 12 minute walk if you know how to get there and Spanish Steps are 8 minutes, Vatican- 23, Travestere- 27, Colosseum- 25. Enjoy this hotel! You'll have a high class experience and a wonderful time.

Reviews.Title: “Five stars and one very big heart.”
Reviews.Author: greektype
Reviews.Content: Sometimes a hotel is more than a hotel. In my case, we arrived at the Excelsior from a hospital in Rome where my daughter had emergency surgery. Knowing that she would spend the week recuperating, I requested as quiet and as large a room as possible even though we had booked the minimum rate. They put us in a huge corner room with a large balcony and two big windows that brought plenty of light and fresh air. Their generosity made all the difference in my daughter's recovery. The staff was incredibly empathetic and helpful. The room service was expensive but delicious. We never saw Rome, but we did experience the graciousness of a world-class hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay, nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: CarolLeeAtlanta
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night at this hotel in May 2011. As a Starwood Platnium I was upgraded to a HUGE room with a terrace. Room was beautiful! Very clean with nice features! Loved it. Short 10 Euro cab ride from the train station. Overall service was great. My only issue was with the delivery of my free "welcome gift". Checked in at 3 and requested wine. At 5 dropped by front desk to ask about it and was told it would be delivered soon. At 9;30 I went back to the front desk and said "now or pay up" ... they finally delivered. Also, even though there were two of us using two beds for some reason we only got one of the two beds turned down?

Reviews.Title: “Westin Excelsior Excellence”
Reviews.Author: cozama1013
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Excelsior for four days in April. We arrived at 10:30am from the overnight flight from Washington. They had us in our room by 10:45am, even though check in is 3:00pm. The staff was excellent, courteous and professional. The room was delightfully decorated and was in excellent shape for an older hotel. I am a long time Starwood member, and this hotel was one of the best I've stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “The worst thing about this hotel is thestaff. We did not encounter one helpful or even one very nice person at all. Especiall”
Reviews.Author: john-hana
Reviews.Content: “Horrible hotel, will never stay again!” This hotel is horrible. They charge 5 star prices but I would give it no more than 2 and that would be generous. I am an SPG member but did not get treated like one, (not that anyone should get treated with disrespect when they go to a hotel). Not only were the beds not 'Heavenly' they were down right uncomfortable. Our curtain rod was falling down causing the curtain to lay on the floor and inside the tub at our 5 star hotel. The fitness center is nice but every time I tried to use it it was closed. When paying 5 star prices for the room, you should not have to pay to use the internet! Once I called down from my room to see if the concierge could make any ticket arrangements for us to see any of the Roman sites and he suggested I utilize the Internet. They consistently provide misinformation my finance and I nicknamed them the fountain of misinformation. Another time I asked if he could make reservations for us at the Library for lunch and he said "no, you don't need reservations." we jumped in a cab and guess what we found? They are not open for lunch! The concierges (and the rest of the staff) are useless!! But if you like to get 5 star service when you pay for 5 star service then I recommend going somewhere else. Just remember Rude! Rude! Rude!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff but overall did not meet expectations”
Reviews.Author: phenom74
Reviews.Content: I'm a SPG Platinum member and I was able to book this hotel on points for 5 nights as a category 5 hotel before it turned into a category 6 hotel earlier in the year. Taxi cost to this hotel from the airport was 42 euros. When we checked in, the front desk was very friendly and throughout the trip the concierge was also friendly and very helpful in answering questions. I did ask for a Platinum upgrade and the front desk said that they were able to upgrade us to a deluxe room. Looking now at the Starwood site, their base room is a deluxe room so I guess we didn't get an upgrade. There was a conference for Lamborghini at the hotel at the time so maybe they got all the nicer rooms. The rooms are decent but very old and need some rehab. There was free wireless for Platinum members. We liked the location, it was walking distance to the metro and via veneto is a nice area. One tip if you stay here or in via veneto - there is a market called carrefour near the hotel (outside of the hotel, turn right, underground past harry's bar) that will help you save money. You can get fruits, candy, snacks, wine, bottled water, etc. for relatively cheap. For example, you can get a bottle of water here for 0.37 euros where as buying one at one of the shops in via veneto or most places would cost you 2-3 euros. I would not consider this a 5 star hotel. I don't feel this is worth the 400-500 euros per night rates that I saw when booking this hotel. I don't feel it's worth category 6 points either.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Enough Hotel but Many, Many Misses”
Reviews.Author: Jerkey
Reviews.Content: We stayed here twice within 10 days because I was booking on all the points I had accrued over the last year and am a Gold status. The first time, the room was nice enough but the front desk staff was disinterested in niceties. The concierge wouldn't make eye contact when I asked for really minor things like an umbrella that was sitting right there. The first night our room was nice - I mean I will say that it was nice. We were in 523 which has a sign outside that says "Preferred Starwood Guest" and it was sizable, there was a small gift of fine chocolates, which I'm assuming we received because of being Gold. The bathroom was very nice, the bedding was very nice, all was good. Unfortunately, and I don't know or care if this is a Roman thing or a male thing, but every single time we walked into or out of the lobby, not a single employee made eye contact with us and said "Buongiorno", "Hello", "Buona Sera", "How are you"? Absolutely nothing. You have 6 guys standing around doing absolutely nothing and yet none of them were gracious enough to extend Service Industry 101. 2 bellmen, 2 concierge, and 2 front desk staff. Nothing. That really was the most enraging to me. It was unbelievably rude. I'm sure if I was an older white guy, I would have been given the respect. Hate to play that card but I know it's the truth. I've experienced it enough. People can say what they want about Americans, and in some cases it is absolutely true, but in my experience, our service and hospitality industry beats european hospitality by MILES. When I recently stayed at the St. Regis in Dana Point, I was treated like royalty by everyone from the bell staff to the management to the restaurant. Anyway, next - we're spending our last night in Rome after making a loop around the country and they have us booked in a bad room. I said please make sure it meets the standard I received last time and the guy says "not even close". I said that is unacceptable, I am staying here twice in 10 days, I booked the reservation 3 months ago, and I am a Gold. Figure it out." Two seconds later he had an identical room next door to the room we stayed in the week before. I told him we don't need him to show us to the room and he kept insisting, then he stood there with his hand out. I showed him the door. No chocolates, no laundry bags, leaking shower, TV broken and had to have the engineer come up, not as nice as the room before albeit identical. Also, I don't know why anyone says you're paying for the neighborhood. That neighborhood is BOOOORING. It is definitely for the blue-haired crowd. Like staying near the US Embassy is a perk? Of course the only prostitutes and sex clubs I saw in all or Rome were near the Embassy and across the street from the hotel. Totally not surprised. Sorry Westin. I appreciate using points to stay but no way would I ever actually pay for that type of service. These hotels get so big they forget to treat their customers equally.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing. Not 5 Star.”
Reviews.Author: Preater
Reviews.Content: We booked a last minute holiday to Rome for 5 nights for our Wedding Anniversary and my husband's birthday. I booked a break last minute as last year there was the ash cloud and we had to cancel. My first choice hotel was full as it was Easter and this hotel was suggested by the travel agent. I have previously stayed in Westin Hotels so I thought it was a safe option. I was really disappointed by the roomand wanted to cry when I first saw it. There was a layer of dust on the seat at the end of the bed and the fabric covered chair was very dirty. The bathroom was a good size with a separate double shower but there was an old plastic seal on the door which needed repair. The tiles were stained with white limescale marks making the bathroom look shabby and in need of a deep clean. We arrived at 5pm and wanted to iron a shirt for the evening. They don't provide irons. They have a pressing service which is only available at 7.30am. The breakfast buffet was adequate but as the hotel was quite full on our final day there was a queue for tables. It's also quite cramped so going up to the buffet table can be difficult. I checked out at 7.30am and went in to breakfast. At 8.30 am my car arrived but the luggage still hadn't been found. The lift was broken on our fourth day and we were on the sixth floor. It was still out of action the next day. The beds were comfortable but there was loud music somewhere close by on Thursday and Saturday night which went well into the small hours and prevented us sleeping. The turn down service happened at various times. As early as 5pm on one evening. Not a hotel I'd return to and very disappointing. Lots of little niggles which spoilt the overall stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: yaelks
Reviews.Content: My husband and I loved this hotel. It is in a very high-end neighborhood of Rome with beautiful restaurants all around it...but they are very pricey. Everything in Rome is spread out and the public transportation is not the best since it doesn't go everywhere. However, for the places that it DOES go, this hotel is convenient because there is a metro stop just down the street and the bus that you can take down to the Trestevere neighborhood which is really great at night and has some great cheap eats as well. In addition, the hotel is just a 15 minute walk from the Spanish Steps and maybe a 25 minute walk to the Trevi fountain. The hotel itself is very clean. Staff is friendly and helpful. If you come to Rome by the train station...I DO NOT recommend walking to the hotel from there...take a cab. We were very happy with this hotel and our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, enhanced our stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: travel747z
Reviews.Content: I booked with points. Even though I'm only gold both our rooms were upgraded to enormous oppulent suites. We had 3 balconies overlooking the US Embassy. My teenage daughters were thrilled. I read some review here that said the front desk was rude and ignored platinum status. So not the case for me. You need to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “They treated us like Royalty!”
Reviews.Author: viaboma
Reviews.Content: What an amazing hotel! Right from the start of booking our stay, I received an email from Pablo, the Manager asking if we needed anything before our trip. He was extremely responsive to our requests and made sure that we had everything we needed upon arrival. We had a beautiful suite, a welcome bottle of champagne and chocolate covered fruit. The Concierge staff was always helpful...they called churches for masses in English, and as it was Holy week, they confirmed when sites were closing early. They have excellent maps as well. The hotel is situated in what I think is the best location. Only a short walk to the Metro, the Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, Santa Suzanna, Catacombs of the Manchurian Monks, and excellent restaurants. 3 stops to the Vatican/St. Peters Basillica. 2 stops to the Termini where you transfer lines to the Colliseum/Roman Forum. No taxis necessary! The Spa was perfect after a long day of walking. My kids swam in the pool (water temperature was perfect!) and met other kids from around the world. The jacuzzi releaved my "old lady" cramps in my legs, and the steam room and sauna prepared me for a relaxing dinner in the neighborhood. There is a charge for inroom and Business Center internet use, reasonable at 4EU for an hour and 15EU for the day. They do provide complimentary 15 minutes to print out your boarding passes. Speaking of Euro's, there are two banks with ATMs across the street, and the Front Desk also can exchange your dollars. We did not eat at Dorney's, but you can get a "take away" cup of American coffee in the morning for 4EU a cup. We brought cereal for the kids breakfast and purchased milk at the local Snack Bar which fit in the inroom fridge. Our entire experience was perfect and Pablo took care of us like we were family.

Reviews.Title: “You are paying for location”
Reviews.Author: Semasita
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my father between 20-22.04.2011 and on the night of the 23rd of April 2011 at the Westin Excelsior. (we had taken a one day trip to Naples on the 22nd of April) To be honest, you are paying for the location and grandeur of the hotel. The location is very elegant and nice to stroll around. I consider myself loyal to the Starwood brand as they are my first choice of hotels throughout the world however I was not very happy overall with our stay. It was my father's 81st birthday and I wanted this to be a memorable trip for him so we splurged and paid the 405 Euro per night rate for a twin bedded room. (taxes included) Before we travelled I sent the hotel an e-mail to the address written on their web page asking for a nice view room because this was a special occasion for my father. Today is our third day back and still no response from the hotel ! At check-in I did mention my e-mail - the reception had no idea - so repeated my request. We were given a "VERY NICE" room on the 5th floor as the receptionist said. The room had windows but because the ledge is so high you can only see the roof of the building across the street. So basically no view unless you lean out of the window and bend over completely risking falling. The decor in the room was nice, amenities standard and room size was sufficient. The suitcase holding rack was broken though and not replaced during our stay. Very cheap hairdryer but at least it worked. Breakfast is totally overpriced for 29 euros per person however because of my father's walking situation we had to choose this option. Not a sufficient buffet. One stand with a chef making omlettes. The first day, we waited 15 minutes to be served coffee / tea. Upon our return on the 23rd, the hotel could not allocate a room because we came early from Naples around 11.30. They offered a room on the 1st floor and when I asked "is it similar to 553 where we stayed two days ago" the receptionist quickly said "yes yes same kind of room". Then an interjection from a supervisor behind the desk "no not same kind of room. give me five minutes". So we were given a new room on the fifth floor with a view of the courtyard. It was our last night so I didn't want to cause any problems by asking to change to a nicer view because my father was already tired. However there are other hotels very near so I would suggest considering those for price because this was definitely not not worth the 400 euros per night. If you want to stay on via veneto, check out the prices of the nearby Mariott or the Veneto Hotel or Eden Hotel before making a reservation here. Small notes : - The concierge, housekeepers and doormen are very friendly. - There is a small market about 3-5 minutes walking distance called Despar - Ciao Roma is a hop on hop off bus tour which departs from a stop about 5 minutes away - Department store La Rinascente is also within walking distance - Try to avoid the glass enclosed "cafes/restaurants" on the street - except maybe for a cappucino. Not too expensive but the quality of food is not very tasty. - If you like walking, Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain are considered close. Maybe about 15 minutes away.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: SashAndy
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Rome and travelling with a 2 year old, we were extremely nervous about which hotel to pick. Anyone travelling or having travelled with a baby knows that a decent room is essential. The Westin Excelsior was FANTASTIC! Our room was large and spacious enough to put a baby cot in and not have it sitting on top of our bed. There was ample cupboard space to pack everything away and make ourselves comfortable for the week. The marble bathroom was enormous and replenished daily. We had an internal courtyard room which didn't have much of a view but at least it had windows which could be opened each day to allow fresh air into the room. The rooms have old European charm furnishings and could probably do with an upgrade in the near future. That said though, they are still clean and extremely comfortable. The general service around the hotel was friendly and always helpful. The concierge was excellent and happily helped us plan and book train tickets to Florence for a day trip. The doormen were always friendly and helpful with everything from assisting with the stroller to hailing cabs & being general tour guides. We didn't eat at the hotel because there are so many options outside of the hotel and having a little one, you're generally out pretty early. We found a small coffee shop/bakery down the road from the Westin where we would go each morning for a "stand-up" coffee and croissant (which is cheaper than sitting down). This cost us around 8 euro a day for the family versus "plenty more" euro for breakfast at the hotel. Although, we have heard that the hotel breakfasts are excellent! The location is absolutely fantastic and within an easy walking distance to Villa Borghese and its magnificent park (recommend a picnic there) and the Spanish Steps. In fact, it's in walking distance to many of the fabulous sites and restaurants in Rome. We would highly recommend this hotel for families with small children, teenage children or simply just an adult couple. Excellent and we hope to visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: Lori011
Reviews.Content: Wow! What a beautiful hotel. We had very large rooms with very large marble bathrooms. Our children had their own adjoining room with 2 twins and ours had one king. I know that not all the rooms in the hotel are large but if it is important to you and you are willing to pay the price this is perfect! Service was very friendly, concierge extremely helpful, rooms very clean!

Reviews.Title: “quality of services”
Reviews.Author: Peter S
Reviews.Content: First time to Europe with my family, we were picked up by the hotel car from airport and it was a nice experience on our way to the hotel. However, when we get to the hotel, from the doorman to the staffs , we saw no smile and our room will not be ready til after lunch which was about 4 hours away. When we backed at about 1:30, we have our room and got upgraded to a big room on the top floor , nice room but the furniture need to be replaced ( cause is a bit old for sure). Finally , for the location of the hotel is 5 stars service " 2 stars

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel and the location”
Reviews.Author: traveler0605
Reviews.Content: I stayed here at the end of March. I brought my 13 old nephew for his first visit to Rome. We had a great stay!! The room was spacious and the bed was truly heavenly. The concierge team was excellent. I had breakfast at the hotel each morning and it was very good. Giovanni at the front desk was very helpful and warm....Overall a lovely visit! . Great location as well close to the American Embassy and walking distance to all the major sites. I will be back!

Reviews.Title: ““Superb location,very nice rooms and excellent breakfast””
Reviews.Author: kikolina
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed here for five nights and thought it was ideal. Check in was efficient ,very pleasant staff,(Danilo, very polite and welcoming) .We got an interior courtyard room and it was very quiet but the view wasn't much, even if the window opened wide which is a major plus.The rooms are very nice decorated with high ceiling, and do have old European charm but definitely need a bit of a make over. The room service was excellent.Also the building exterior and interior are gorgeous. The location is perfect, 5 minutes from piazza di Spagna and 2 minutes from Villa Borghese! You can actually walk from here to many major attractions The breakfast buffet is amazing! The pool was small but very nice and all spa area is very relaxing. The only complaint I have with the hotel was that they don't have "Free" internet. Overall this is a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Prefer Via Vento View”
Reviews.Author: JulieCB
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at the Excelsior Rome. We have stayed there numerous times over the years. We used Starwood Points and we were upgraded to a Suite. We didn't really need that extra living room and we would have preferred a Jr. Suite with a Via Vento view. The hotel was totally booked with several conventions so we still appreciated the great upgrade. The AC worked perfectly and the bathroom was large and had a tub and a walk in shower,two sinks.

Reviews.Title: “Great Property”
Reviews.Author: JD1946
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights - all in all a great stay. As an SPG Platinum member, we were upgraded to a corner suite overlooking via Veneto. Despite being on the 1st floor - there were no noise problems - and this is a very busy street. I heartily disagree that the hotel is difficult to walk to as it is on a hill..........really? This is simply not true - there is some uphill walking if you are coming from the Spanish Steps but that is all. There are some great restaurants within a couple of blocks - and the US Embassy is right across the street. My only complaint was that we were given a smoking room - and the hotel was full. The suite literally stunk of tobacco - but since we were only staying 3 nights and it was such a beautiful room we stuck it out. That being said - I would probably try another SPG property - the Eden next time just for some variety.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, but wouldn't pay for it.”
Reviews.Author: nzedhoneymooners
Reviews.Content: I was unimpressed with the Westin Excelsior. When we opened the door to our room, a fairly strong smell of mold hit us. While the room was spacious and the front desk was helpful, the unpleasant scent of mold emanating from the bathroom left us feeling like the hotel was merely adequate. Also, the tubs have high walls and are very slipery, so seniors might have a hard time with the shower.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with beautiful rooms but......!!”
Reviews.Author: Fasted09
Reviews.Content: I have been to a few Westin's and there never seem to let me down but this Westin has a lot to work on in regards to staff friendliness and warmth. This is a very bad reflection on the management and staff. Positive, rooms are just fantastic and the hotel is in a great location. I was just really dissapointed with the staff overall level of service as they lack the warmth of a 5 star service. For the price you pay you kind of expected better. The management and staff really need to undergo a thorough training on how to treat their guest better or change the management. Summary, great location, beautiful rooms but the staff spoils it all....Would I come back again..NO. There are better hotels in Rome that has better staff.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded my expectations”
Reviews.Author: Nardiesally
Reviews.Content: Like everyone else, I read all of the reviews and would say they were mixed. My wife and I came from the Westin in Florence and presumed the Rome Westin would not be as nice. I had reserved a room with Starwood Points and paid for the upgrade (i reserved when it was category 5, it is now Category 6). We were upgraded to a massive and modern 2 bedroom 2 bathroom suite. Perfect in every way. No complaints. The suite faced the courtyard and was completely quiet. The staff was adequate. The concierge was fine, but nothing special. Certainly nothing like the team in Florence. The location was great, right downtown, within walking distance to most things. The elevators were very small. As an SPG member, we got a "discount" on the breakfast, from USD$41 to USD$32. I would skip it and use a cafe across the street. Based on my experience, this is a fine hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It could be so much better”
Reviews.Author: blueBuenosAires
Reviews.Content: Rome was our last stop in our travel, we stayed there 5 nights. The hotel is magnificient from the outside, it is located in one of the most beautiful Rome Avenues, and indeed on the most elegant, very close to Villa Borghese and Piazza di Spagna. It is up hill so you need to have strong legs. The fitness center is fantastic and also the pool, little but very relaxing. The rooms are big and old, the hotel is from 1906 and requires a lot of maintenance, so it is like a gigantic old house you will always find something falling apart. As I said our room was big and old and has a funny smell, I think it was humidity. The housekeeping service was fine, the staff was very nice and helpful. The internet expensive and slow. The breakfast selection was very good but as the hotel receives a lot of tour groups in the early morning always the restaurant was packed so it was hard to find were to sit.Sincerely, we were treat very well, the location was very nice, the fitness center the best in our whole trip but I will not reccommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, but...”
Reviews.Author: tpage_97
Reviews.Content: We booked the excelsior for the last night of our trip, thinking that we would treat ourselves to a great hotel before the long haul home to Canada. We found the Excelsior difficult to get to - it is at the top of a steep hill, and unless you are in a cab, it's a tough walk, even for our family, and we walked ALL of Rome. Once we did get there, the staff was perfunctory, bordering on condescending. Our room was not ready (fair enough, in spite of requesting an early check in, we were 75 minutes early) and so they took our bags to store. We were told that they would be kept securely, and then taken to our rooms. We went back a few minutes later to grab something that I had forgotten, to find our bags in the middle of an unlocked, unattended storage room. My husband pointed this out to the conceirge, who said it was "under control". When we returned hours later, our bags had not been taken to our room, in spite of assurances that they would be waiting for us... We had requested an extra bed for our thirteen year old son, and were mildly amused to find that a crib had been set up.Still, we tried to keep a good humour, as the rooms were nice. Unfortunately, at every turn, we found the attitude of the staff to be one of tolerance. We found the room service - we only ordered a cheese platter, and a bottle of wine to celebrate our trip - stunningly overpriced, and again, the waiter was barely polite. We've stayed in Westins before, and if you are used to "Westin" service, prepare to be stunningly disappointed. In terms of value for your hotel dollar, there are so many there are so many hotels in Rome where you can either get outstanding character and friendly service, or, if you are interested in a "splurge" you can find other hotels where you will get MUCH better service for your dollar. A real disappointment for our last night in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ellencarroll27
Reviews.Content: After reading all the reviews on this sight I was very concerned about staying at the the Excelsior. I stayed here ages ago as a teen, and had very grand memories. Many years and several trips to Rome later I was convinced to stay here again with my teenage son. Our room is absolutely beautiful, overlooking the Via Veneto. There is not a hint shabbiness. And my observations are coming on the heels of a stay at the Peninsula Hotel in Beverly Hills, a five star property. The bathroom is perfect, with marble and all the right amenities. I am thrilled we are staying here!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in wondeful part of the city”
Reviews.Author: campbell_jamesn
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel in a beautiful location.... very helpful and attentive staff.... would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MiriamPercia
Reviews.Content: I was a little bit affraid to stay at this hotel due to many different reviews. The hotel is really old, a renovation would be very welcome but it is still charming. The grand luxe room has a nice size and a nice bathroom with shower separate from bathtube. One great problem is that we can hear all the sounds in the rooms besides and we heard some sounds of private practices of our neighbors. The breakfast, for 29 Euros should be better too, more different kinds of bread and cold cuts. Cold swiming pool. The staff is polite but cold. Not value for E 500 or E 600 but value if you pay E 200 or E 300.

Reviews.Title: “terrific hotel, would stay again in a minute”
Reviews.Author: travelgd
Reviews.Content: huge room, got king bed even though we thought we'd end up with two twins pushed together. like a 4 seasons in terms of appointments, with oldEurope luxury. good service, except we could not get hair conditioner for whatever reasons downside - that stupid Westin thing where they dont change sheets or towels unless you jump through their hoops. also i realized after that they charged us E1.00 for a UNESCO donation (which i will have reversed on principle of jamming us on something like this)

Reviews.Title: “I enjoyed my stay at Ewstin Excelsior”
Reviews.Author: CGC155029
Reviews.Content: I was hesitant to stay at the Westin Excelsior because of the few negatives remarks; my room was confortable, clean and in good conditions. Good location also in a nice area. I'm happy with my décision. In front of the hotel you can buy a coffee and croissant at Café De Paris. Very good!

Reviews.Title: “Best Stay in Italy”
Reviews.Author: slwpgator
Reviews.Content: We used Starwoods Points to stay here and they were points well spent. We had a suite which was the most unbelievable room either of us had ever stayed in. We had multiple balconies overlooking the streets of Rome, but heard no noise when everything was closed. The room was huge with a separate living room, so was a nice change of pace from the smaller rooms that you get used to in Europe. As most people said, the location is perfect. Being next to the American Embassy and only a 5 minute walk from the metro are huge advantages. The Spanish Steps are only about a 10 minute walk through an underground tunnel. From there most other sites are pretty close by. When going to Europe you spend minimal time in your hotel room. However, my wife was sick one of the days that we were in Rome, so she spent almost the whole day there and didn't want to leave. She still talks about how relaxing it was to open the doors to the balcony and lay in the room while I was out exploring. I've seen some mixed reviews about this hotel and I know everybody's experiences are different, but I have a really hard time believing anyone could not enjoy their stay here. It was our best stay in Italy.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel....But....”
Reviews.Author: davidandrose1
Reviews.Content: The location of the property is outstanding, adjacent to the American Embassy, lots of great restauarants, a grand ole park that includes Rome's original city wall, and lots more like the Spanish Steps just 10 mins away. But our room - which was on the 6th (top) floor and exceptionally large and including an spacious outdoor balcony, was quite run-down. The case goods all should have been replaced years-ago, and the room never became comfortable; we typically slept with the HVAC unit turned off and our double-doors left WIDE open on nights when daytime temps never cracked 50F. Others on our trip complained of the same excessive heat in their rooms. This was uncomfortable and unacceptable. The hotel staff was accomodating and friendly, offering to make dinner reservations or to recommend area sights on a moments notice. While they seemed to care about our sauna-like room temps, they appeared helpless to change the circumstance and failed to follow-up on our concern. This clearly once was a grand hotel in one of the worlds grandest capital citites. Starwood needs to spend several $million to bring the quality of the rooms up to level of its surroundings and potential. When you begin with 18 foot ceilings and oodles of intricate gold trim and crown-wood moulding, the incremental expense of tossing out furnishings that seem to have come from a frat-house is minimal. STEP UP my friends!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Westin on Via Veneto”
Reviews.Author: zephyr221
Reviews.Content: We spent out last night in Europe at the Westin Rome on a Starpoints award. We were upgraded to a HUGE and nicely appointed suite. The hotel was clean, nice, centrally located. I can't say that the staff went "above and beyond" but we didn't encounter any problems either.

Reviews.Title: “Better than other reviews would have you believe”
Reviews.Author: Rach727
Reviews.Content: We were very apprehensive about our stay given the very mixed reviews on TA and debated changing our reservation to the St Regis, however decided to stick with the Westin because of the location. When we arrived, my husband's Platinum SPG status had not been linked to our reservation which was concerning since he had called the SPG line ahead of time to confirm our reservation. The general manager was very apologetic and assured us that he would be able to upgrade us halfway through our stay (the hotel was packed for New Year's). The general manager followed through with his promise, and we were upgrade to a large suite with two full bathrooms. While the staff were more reserved and less effusive than the outstanding staff at the Westin in Florence, they were still helpful nonetheless. This Westin property is both elegant and grand, and I am surprised by the reviews that suggest it is "run down". The pool and health club area appeared to be recently renovated. The location on Via Veneto is ideal for tourists, and it is an easy walk to the Spanish Steps, Borghese Gardens, the Metro, and the Trevi Fountain. We tried to eat at the restaurant in the hotel the last night of our trip, but unfortunately my husband became very ill when we sat down from something he had eaten earlier in the day (not at the hotel). The manager was incredibly concerned, and made sure that the bill and my food order were both taken care of so I could tend to husband. It is that extra level of service that makes the Excelsior a 5 star rather than 4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel even better staff!”
Reviews.Author: culturevulture12
Reviews.Content: This is a really good 5 star hotel, what I found set it apart is the staff, they all speak English and most of them have very good English. They were helpful, friendly and could't do enough, always friendly and smiling what more could you ask for. Oh yes and it's on the Via Venetto! The hotel is really lovely and the food excellent would highly recommend it and will return with my husband (not for work) Such a refreshing change especially in Rome

Reviews.Title: “wrong hotel”
Reviews.Author: cody089
Reviews.Content: bed ,bed. bed..............rude staff,nice location,park is100 euro a day,old hotel is not worth $700 a niht.

Reviews.Title: “Ok room, poor service, get interior to sleep”
Reviews.Author: TravelCuties
Reviews.Content: DH and I stayed for a few nights over the holidays. Platinum SPG status meant nothing - no upgrade, no welcome gift, not even a smile from the front desk. Room was large and well-furnished and bed was extremely comfortable (almost without compare in our Italy travels). The hotel is across from the US Embassy and on a very busy road with bus traffic. Got an interior courtyard room and had no issues with noise. Clean bathroom, plenty of hot water, toiletries were a little sad - definitely bring your own conditioner. Concierge was rude and could not be bothered with public transport advice. Suggest learning the 63, 630, 85 and 95 routes to get around to and from the tourist sites. Forget the little 116 electric bus - it takes forever and you need to switch sometimes because it runs out of electricity. Enjoy Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel...almost like little America”
Reviews.Author: QCRodgers
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel during our 2 day stop over in Rome with our 2 kids. Everything about it was nice, we had to make a few accomodations and have a extra bed brought into the room, which was done with ease by the hotel staff.
