The breakfast buffet was very nice, a little expensive, but no complaints. Hard Rock Cafe is within walking distance and there are great Italian Restuarants on the left side alley as you leave the hotel. One owner knows every golf course in America, which was our dinner conversation. On that note..,this hotel is right beside the American Embassy, hence alot of Americans. If you take the get on-get off bus, got right pass Hard Rock and make sure you have a current tour map. We waited 30 mins at our pick-up stop as buses kept turning before our pick-up point. The pool was excellent for our kids in the evening after a day of touring, so we could find very little wrong with this stay...highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: mickeycoff
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel and the staff are very appreciative helpful accommodating. We stayed at another hotel with not as nicenof amenities , and ease. The food was great and I loved the location.;)))))

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Frank_BE
Reviews.Content: Its the kind of hotel where you expect to feel special from start to finish, and as an SPG platinum even more so. Not here however. No room upgrades (even tough better rooms were available), had to ask three times to get my welcome bottle of wine, no other benefits recieved. Informed in advance of the room configuration needed (one for 2 adults, one for 1 adult and 2 children) but this had not been taken into account, we recieved 2 standard double rooms. I ask for help with a mobile connection but they try to send me off to the nearest shop (the help I needed was basically someone that spoke Italian) Maybe they didn't like me staying for points, but hey, I got *beautiful* upgrades in both Monaco and Nice Meridien hotels when staying for points during peak season, so why do they treat us as second class here? Also, no club lounge. Pool is OK but noisy and small. Based on the experience this far we finally decided not to visit the hotel restaurant. I guess this one needs a new management to see us again. From online reviews, spg Plat members get better treatment in both St Regis and Eden, both very close by.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - Great staff - Great room”
Reviews.Author: tshissler
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for three nights at the start of our Italian vacation, which would also include stays in Florence and Venice. We couldn't ask for anything more from the location, the helpfulness of the staff (especially the concierge) and the room. The hotel is located on Via Veneto right next to the U.S. Embassy. It's close to the Spanish Steps, as well as walking distance from the Trevi Fountain. There are plenty of restaurants and shops, even ones that are not tourist traps. We made requests of the staff even before we arrived in Rome and found the concierge to be extremely helpful, even in purchasing train tickets for the other legs of our trip. This kind of service continued throughout our stay. As an SPG Platinum member, we got upgraded to a beautiful suite that had every convenience and comfort. I have read other reviews of this hotel that state that this hotel is old and rundown...well, it is an old building, that is true, but it has been very well maintained and has an abundance of character. We found this hotel to be truly "grand" in an old-school kind of way. I think that saying that this hotel needs to be renovated is almost like saying that the Coliseum needs a facelift...you have to appreciate it for what it offers. If you want a modern edifice, look elsewhere. If you want luxury, character and service, this place is a great choice. By saying that this building is old doesn't mean that you go without modern conveniences...we found the plumbing to be fine, the electricity and everything to be in working order, the wireless internet was fast, and our suite even had two flat screen tvs...one a Bang & Olufson equipped with a DVD player amongst other gadgets. Also, we took a peek at the pool/gym/sauna and was impressed at the facilities. We had a a great experience here and will definitely return on subsequent visits.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful old hotel”
Reviews.Author: DrFady
Reviews.Content: location is a long walk to attractions but its a hotel that when visiting a city like rome you should stay in. rooms are hugh and palace like. just dont park here. up to 70 euros a night. ask for alternatives.

Reviews.Title: “Ahhhhh....what a hotel!”
Reviews.Author: lisalmusso
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel 2 different times and loved it! This last time in February 2010, we had a fantastic stay. The night before we left though, I got very sick and had to change my Delta flight for the next morning. Here is a word of advice. If you are flying on an american carrier, the hotel will not have their italian contact info and the 1-800 number will not work from Italy! My husband had to ride all the way to the airport to change the ticket. Back to this hotel, they did everything they could to help us, even they did not know how to contact delta. They had arranged for a doctor to come to the room and give me an injection and a prescription. This was a very comfortable stay and the room was large. The bed was comfortable and they had english speaking channels. You will not find english speaking channels in cheaper hotels. This hotel was also on the Via Venneto. The location is PRIME and very recommended by me! This was my third trip to Roma and I am hoping those coins I threw in the Fountaina de Trevi will work so I can return soon to my favorite Roman hotel! Ciao Bacci!

Reviews.Title: “Great location - good rooms - weak staff”
Reviews.Author: mls208
Reviews.Content: Great rooms on both parts of our stay. Good location. Unfortunately the staff is inconsistent. Concierge desk was a roulette game. Either got terrific advice and recommendations or we got someone who could not care less about our experience with the hotel or Rome. An example: one afternoon we had asked a concierge to make a dinner reservation, [not his suggested tourist laced throwaway restaurant]. When we came down to leave that night for dinner, we stopped by the desk to get directions. He had not made the reservation! His excuse - the restaurant was not open yet. We suggested he might have called and let us know. He ignored us, picked up the phone and surprise, the restaurant was suddenly open and could accommodate us. By the way, we were not asking for an early bird reservation, we wanted 7:30-7:45. This is the biggest challenge the hotel faces: Inconsistent service, lack of attention to details such as housekeeping carts left in hallways or the front desk not offering the morning paper for your room at check-in. At the end of the day, they are just providing lodging, not exceptional service. Recommend with caveats.

Reviews.Title: “awesome experience!”
Reviews.Author: crdesigner
Reviews.Content: I have to say that i really liked my experience at the hotel: The front desk staff was very courteous at check in, the location was quite nice , and the rooms was exquisite. The only negative point was the concierge team that was a bit snotty, for no reason. but that i can let slide by...

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not La Dulce Vita”
Reviews.Author: QueenieKC
Reviews.Content: Absolutely beautiful stately outdoor facade with unfortunately Very Very poor value for money. Wrong building - very poor upkeep, not very clean and overpriced coffee and food. The king sized bed was comfortable and rooms are spacious. Room conditions are however very poor. It was nice to have a balcony, off of the suite, but also very dirty. Close to subway and shopping. Nice location/neighborhood. Staff not friendly nor attentive. Must pay daily thirty Euros for regular television channels.

Reviews.Title: “Location is the only good thing...”
Reviews.Author: iolanta
Reviews.Content: Being a former Roman citizen decided to spend a lavish Dolce Vita style weekend. However, Dolce Vita fairy tales vanished as soon as I entered the hotel. Pros: - Location - Friendly stuff - Good breakfast selection Cons: - Rooms are COMPLETELY WORN ( cracked ceiling, dirty old carpet, light switchers are all scratched and should have been changed a century ago, dusty worn wall fabrics, etc etc etc). Thus it doesnt matter how good the cleaning service is when the room just needs to be completely refurbished! - Lobby is dirty, soiled carpet and worn reception. - Room overlooked Via Venetto, but since has no double glazing, was too noisy to sleep. I can go on and on...and THIS IS NOT WHAT YOU WOULD EXPECT FOR 374 Euro/Night. IMHO, the hotel lives by its past glory & reputation...and reality of it today is not even close to what it is used to be in the past.

Reviews.Title: “Memorable Stay”
Reviews.Author: NycSonny
Reviews.Content: The Westin Excelsior is a beautiful old world hotel. If you're looking for modern, look elsewhere. The location is amazing, and Rome is your walking city. We enjoyed a lunch outdoors at the hotel. The pappardelle pasta dish was exquisite. I used Starwood points and was upgraded to a gorgeous room with balcony overlooking the city. If I had to pay $500 and upwards per night, my review might be reduced to 4 stars based on value.

Reviews.Title: “First time in Rome and had a Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: kgny
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin Excelsior with my wife for my anniversary for six nights and had a wonderful time. We are Starwoods members and typically spend our vacations at Westin Hotels. I also should mention that we booked our stay on points so it was certainly worth it for us. While some comments regarding the "tired" appearance may be true it really did not effect our stay one bit. When we checked in (don't plan on an early check-in, although you can leave your bags at the hotel) we were upgraded to a room with a veranda overlooking Via Veneto, which was a real plus. The room and bathroom were clean and spacious. I'm not sure if our room was recently renovated but it certainly seemed new and I don't have any complaints. I will say that generally speaking the conceirge and staff can be a little standoffish which I don't believe is a trait that they should possess. However, my wife and I used the conceirge many times throughout our stay to get reservations, directions, and shopping suggestions and never had any issues. They are polite and helpful but perhaps not overly friendly like some other hotels. The restaurant and bar were definately over our budget so we did not eat at the hotel, but there are plenty of cafe's in the surrounding area. Finally, the area couldn't have been better. We were about a five minute walk to Piazza Barberini were we could find something to eat. It is also a hub for both buses and the metro which we found to be very convenient. All in all the Westin Excelsior was a great hotel in a great location and I would certainly recommend staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable well located but "soul-less"”
Reviews.Author: matmid
Reviews.Content: Good location and comfortable but totally soul - less despite its beautiful architecture and high ceilings. About 3 staff watched us get out of our taxi and drag the suitcase up the stairs - no help offered. Throughout our short stay,I did not see one member of staff smile or gesture a greeting -in the lounge bar,reception,concierge and door area. As a Starwood Gold member, we were upgraded to a suite and received the bubbly and fruit - all very nice but the surly unfriendly staff marred the overall stay.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not worth $700/night”
Reviews.Author: davidho65
Reviews.Content: The Excelsior is a grand old hotel, and the lobby, restaurant and bar are all beautiful, but our room was very disappointing. We splurged and upgraded to a Grand Luxe Room for the equivalent of $708/night. The photos on the Westin Web site look nothing like the two Grand Luxe Rooms we stayed in during our stay. The first one had a couple windows that looked out onto an internal atrium with ugly HVAC equipment and provided very little light. We asked for a room with a view of the outside for a second night which they happily accomodated, but still the room was in serious need of a facelift. There were not enough electrical outlets to recharge our camera batteries, cell phones, etc. The bathroom was dark and stained with lime deposit; and the lack of lighting in the room made it impossible to read. It was about a 15-20 minute walk to the Trevi Fountain or Spanish Steps which sounded OK when I booked, but during the vacation I ended up wishing we were closer. I think it would be much better to book a three-star smaller quaint hotel the next time I head to Rome. The 4- and 5-star hotel options in Rome just don't provide significant value.

Reviews.Title: “not 5 stars”
Reviews.Author: cookie168
Reviews.Content: After a long trip overseas to Rome I was dissapointed with the Westin Excelsior. I had booked a king size bed only to discover the room they had given me had only a single bed. When I complained to the front desk, they responded that it was their only room even though I had a "Confirmed reservation for the larger bed". The room was tired and old and with all of the choices available to one in Rome I would not go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel with a terrific staff!”
Reviews.Author: Mickp1117
Reviews.Content: My wife and I arrived at 8:30am and were up checked in and upgrade to a wonderful suite! The staff was helpful and courteous and went out of there way to help. The cleaning staff was absolutely outstanding. Our room was in great shape. Short cab ride to ALL major destinations! Ciao!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful old-world hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: knspr
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here October 31 through November 3rd and we loved it. We stayed on Starwood points and we were upgraded to a beautiful, large room complete with high ceilings, gold moldings and a crystal chandelier. The hotel is so pretty....wide marble stairs and a pretty lobby on each floor. The location on Via Veneto is fabulous. It is very close to the Spanish steps and Trevi Fountain. We walked to all the major atttractions including the Colliseum and the Vatican. Don't be tempted to take a taxi or you will miss all the historic sights along the way. It seems like there is a beautiful piazza or church around every corner. We never ate at the hotel because there are so many fabulous and reasonably priced restaurants in Rome. Walk a few blocks off the Via Veneto and you'll find cafe's for breakfast, pizza restaurants and trattorias. We ate at different places every day and never had a bad meal. Try cy3O on a little alley near Piazza Navona for a great prixed-fixed meal for only 12 euro...appetizer, huge pasta portion and wine all included.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Siciliangal
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin Excelsior in Rome for three nights in October. I was pleasantly surprised with the great location. The location is in the fashionable district of the Via Veneto and we were able to walk to most things or take the metro. I found the staff very accomodating and friendly and in fact, because our room was not ready in time, they put us in an upgraded room with a balcony. It was beautiful. The bed was very comfortable. The only downside to this hotel, is that the breakfast cost is too expensive. I think it was 30 - 40 euros per person. Instead of spending the money and having breakfast at the hotel, we walked down two small blocks to Via Sardenga and took a right. Right there is a small Bar called Caffe Lotti. It serves pastries and coffee. Fabulous!

Reviews.Title: “Anniversay Celebration Jackpot!!!”
Reviews.Author: SKG109
Reviews.Content: Could not have picked a better hotel to celebrate our anniversary! They upgraded us to a HUGE suite! Followed by a chilled bottle of Asti Spumante and a basket of fresh fruit! The hotel is getting a wee bit old-in-the-tooth but the staff tries so hard that it is impresive! The only downer was that the Jacuzzi was only at the swimming pool temperature, so we had to keep running to the steam room. Tough, eh?!?! LMAO!

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS....FABULOUS....FABULOUS.....”
Reviews.Author: charlotte55
Reviews.Content: We booked the Westin for 2 nights, one on our way to Sorrento and then the last eve of our trip in Italy, also. my birthday. This hotel is very elegant and the location is beautiful. Harrys is right down the block and the walk is so beautiful. By the way, the food at Harrys was superb. The first night we a little dissapointed in the room. We told the manager when we left for Sorrento as we were coming back. When we came back several days later the manager gave us the most beautiful luxurious room. He told us that he wanted to make sure we were happy. Well, we were happy, very happy. The room was huge and dripped in luxury linens and furnishings. It really made an impression especially when someone goes out of their way to accomodate you. This was not my first visit to the Westin Excelsior and will not be our last. Thank you Westin for going above and beyond.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely European Decor”
Reviews.Author: trarvelchica
Reviews.Content: I have to say that I was nervous about the reviews, so I had that in mind during my stay. I have to say our stay was great. If you love old-world eurpoean decor, then the style of the rooms can't be beat - chandeliers, silk padded walls, marble bathrooms, etc. You have to be comfortable with antiques and with a little shabby chic, too. If you are looking for a new or modern hotel with lots of modern amenities then this might not be as much for you. Our "heavenly bed" was really comfortable and the room was super quiet, we never heard a soul. I liked the location on Via Veneto - it was quiet and a little removed, but close, Spanish Steps a 10 minute walk. The swimming pool and steam room were a bonus. We got a really great rate, but the normal rack rate is really high - though Rome is really pricy in general.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but time for a renovation”
Reviews.Author: LAgirltravels
Reviews.Content: I've always loved this hotel and it's location can't be beat. It's in a stunning building but the lobby and rooms are just underwhelming for the price. We used starwood points for our stay otherwise I wouldn't have been happy to pay over $500 a night to stay in our very tired and dated room. The lobby was refurnished at some point awhile back and the person responsible for the furniture should be fired. The breakfast buffet is amazing and costs and arm and a leg so eat up. The concierge was very helpful and sent us to several amazing restaurants. I hope Westin will recognize the gem they have and step it up.

Reviews.Title: “Grand, spacious room, but room a bit dated”
Reviews.Author: Fokai
Reviews.Content: This hotel sits in a great part of the city. Close to many attractions, restaurants, and shops. The hotel itself did not live up to the reviews, photos, and other accolades that I had seen prior to our stay. The room that we stayed in was a deluxe and was just over 300 sq ft. Two windows to allow natural light in, LCD TV, king bed, two lounge chairs, and a chest of drawers, desk and two desk chairs. The bathroom was marble, had double sinks (dated fixtures), and a tub/shower combo. It is not that this property was bad, it was just very dated. The room itself was very ornate, wonderfully detailed with gold accents and beautiful woodwork. However, the smell of mildew permeated as you entered the room, carpets were worn, moldings in the room were scuffed...the room was simply a bit worn out. Service was not overly friendly, but adequate. To be fair, we did not make many requests during our stay and had little interaction with the staff. We enjoyed breakfast at the hotel twice, and a cocktail in the bar one evening all with good service and good quality food and drink. Before I wrote this, I took another look at the hotel's website and I can tell you that our room looked nothing like the rooms that are featured on the website. I've included a couple of photos, the clarity of the photos are not great, but hopefully will give you an idea. Perhaps we had a room that was not renovated, but for the price that we paid, I would not stay at this hotel again. Too many other gorgeous properties on Via Veneto.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Old Hotel In Need of Some Front Desk Improvements”
Reviews.Author: The_TravelerUSA101
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Westin Excelsior and I had a mixed stay. The Good: -The room was an adequate size and clean. The furnishings were nice, but slightly worn. The decor was fine. The bathrooms were elegant and spacious. -The concierge was great with directions/recommendations and professional. There seemed to be someone on staff at all times (I spoke with the concierge as early as 7:00AM and as late as 2:00AM). Having a 24 hour concierge was extremely convenient. -The lobby and common areas were luxurious and impressive. -The bar was cool and the bartender we had mixed some great cocktails (the Pimms Cup was excellent). -I liked the hotel's location on Via Veneto. It's a 20 minute walk from the major tourist areas, but it's an oasis from the hustle and bustle of central Rome. Plus, Via Veneto offers some great options for late night coffee/snacks and cocktails (try Harry's Bar for great cocktails and atmosphere). The Bad: -Check-in was chaotic and when our room wasn't ready the woman at the front desk asked us to wait in the bar for 15-20 minutes. She promised to come in and give us an update on our room in 15-20 minutes. 45 minutes later we were still waiting in the bar (which was pleasant given the atmosphere and the great cocktails). Then, when I went to the front desk and asked about my room they seemed confused. We were finally provided with a room a few minutes later--after an hour's wait! The front desk needs some work. -At the time of check-in, the front desk told me my reservation was in order and after the ordeal above, I was given my room. When I checked out 4 days later, my rate was over 100 Euro more per day than the rate I confirmed at the time I made my reservation. I asked why, and the front desk did not have a good reason--I was in a rush to get to the airport, so I figured I'd call Westin when I got back to the U.S. When I called Westin they first claimed the rate increased because it was a corporate rate and I used my personal credit card. Then, they claimed that it was a rate based on one person occupancy and not two (my girlfriend and I stayed in the room). My biggest issue with the increase was that no one told me about it upon check-in, even though they knew I was using my non-corporate credit card and they knew two people were staying in the room (I asked for and received 2 keys). Instead, the hotel waited until my stay was over and I was rushing out to catch my plane to spring the rate increase on me (and 100 Euro per night is not an immaterial increase). Eventually, Westin gave me a refund, but I really had to fight it and I spent a lot of time getting the issue rectified. It was very disappointing to say the least. If you decide to stay at the Westin Excelsior, make sure to confirm the rate upon check-in and review your bill upon check-out. If not for the front desk/billing issues referenced above, I would have given the hotel 4-stars. Unfortunately, I'm giving the hotel 3-stars due to such issues and subsequent headaches. BTW--there are many amazing restaurants in Rome, but for a truly special and unique experience, consider dining at Hostaria Antica Roma. It's a family run restaurant located in ancient ruins on the an Appian Way. A quick taxi ride from the center city, the food, service and romantic atmosphere can't be beat. The homemade cheese spread is to die for! The pastas are great in general, but the Patina Cotidiana (from an ancient Roman recipe dating to 1st Century AD) was AMAZING. This place was so good, we ate there twice in 4 days (lunch and dinner). It's also close to the Catacombs, so you can work-up an appetite exploring the Catacombs and then enjoy an amazing meal. Ask for Paulo if you go there, he's part of the ownership and is a fantastic host. Be prepared for a great meal in a romantic setting, the interesting stories from Paulo are a bonus! He'll also call you a cab when your meal is over (a 15-20 Euro trip to the Westin Excelsior).

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful old hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: skibunny33
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night on a whirlwind tour of the city. It's a beautiful old hotel with huge ceilings and a very grand lobby. We were upgraded to an enormous room - huge walk-in closet, bathroom, and sitting area. We only wished we had more time to hang out there, but definitely appreciated the westin heavenly bed after a long day of touring! The hotel staff were very helpful in getting us get oriented and even called to track down our dinner restaurant since we had the incorrect address - saving the day! We definitely hope to return soon.

Reviews.Title: “MIXED EMOTIONS”
Reviews.Author: bichonfrisemick
Reviews.Content: If you love Rome, you will forgive this hotels its many faults. I spent 6 nights there with my husband and daughter, celebrating our 15th wedding anniversary (nobody noticed it, but it was mentioned in the reservation communication, lack of interest). Check in was efficient (Danilo, very polite and welcoming), although I'm not sure how the garage price is set: by e-mail they informed me it was 70 Euro per night (!!!) and when we arrived and insisted the car should be driven to a cheaper garage (Ludovisi) in the neighborhood all over sudden we got a discount to 50 Euro per night, which is still way too much. So, it left us wondering what the actual best rate for the garage was? The room (227) was a complete disappointment (we had asked for a high floor and a view, of course non of this happened), old, shabby, dark, with a grotesque fake fireplace, the bathroom, although in marble, with a smell of mold and a leaking bidet and bath tub (we didn't report this, because we were under the impression nobody would care or do anything about it). The "heavenly bed" left us with a painful back for the first three days, and the noise outside was outraging (as if garbage was taken away all night), and one night a statesman (President) with a large group of businessmen arrived at midnight to the back entrance, just beneath our window, and you can imagine the noise from several motorcycles, police cars, buses and the whole fuss...The breakfast room was the highlight and so was the service there (Daniel, very kind), but the choice was not really what we have expected for 29 Euro per person. The nice thing was they let our 11 year old eat for free, as a nice gesture. I think you can find a more up-to-date hotel for this price, and also a closer down-town location. It makes me wonder, after all those negative reports, why doesn't the general manager wake up und take action? Also, it would be nice to take a stand to all this issues, and not just take the easy way out, by ignoring his guests' comments...he may actually run out of guests some day soon if he continuos this neglect, and it would be such a crime for a beautiful pearl this hotel once (long ago) was...this wonderful building is just crying out for a better management...

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced.....location is not ideal”
Reviews.Author: DGTraveler123
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my wife in September 2010 for 2 nights. We are Starwood platinum members and were upgraded to a suite, which was very nice at first glance. However, upon closer inspection it was revealed that the carpets are old and dirty, and the marble in the bathrooms is covered in limescale and mold. The staff are very pretentious, and the cost of food and internet at the hotel are just plain obnoxious. The location is great of you plan to spend a lot of time around the via Venteo area, but it is a good 15 minute walk from the Spanish Steps and The Trevi Fountain, and the walk back is completely uphill. This was very tiring at times. We learned that there are comparable five star hotels located much closer to the Spanish Steps. I think that this hotel will appeal to some, but most will find the prtention to be over the top and unecessary and would be smart to find better value and location at other five star locations.

Reviews.Title: “Really wanted to love it left disappointed”
Reviews.Author: LucyIntrepid
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at the Excelsior as the last nights of our holiday in Europe. We were very much looking forward to this hotel as looked magnificent on the web. Booking with Starwoods is always a pleasure - the staff on the phone are very helpful and courteous. We had quite mixed emotions about our stay, some parts of it wonderful but others left us puzzelled as to what constitutes a luxury hotel. Staff at the hotel were courteous but aloof with the exception of the bell hop who met our taxi on arrival, not only taking care of our luggage but making us very welcome including bringing a map to us and showing us the main attractions. The reception staff were ok but it is a little frustrating when one of the first things you are told is that you cant be shown to your room because you have arrived before check in (an hour early) then no refreshment or any place to sit & wait are offered. Arriving back a few hours later we were shown to our room, 3 phone calls and 1.5 hours later our luggage was delivered. We asked for details of the hotel services several times so we knew where the restaurants, swimming pool etc were, it never arrived. No complementary water was provided in the room. Breakfast wasnt included in our booking and at 29euros each, we decided to eat elsewhere. WIFI is expensive at 15euro per day. Our room (we were upgraded to a suite so had a separate large living room and balcony- fantastic!) was beautiful, spacious, very comfortable and had great street views. The condition of the room though was disappointing, furniture & paint was chipped, chairs dirty & stained and carpet worn. This was surprising as the web site states the rooms have just been remodeled. The bed was comfortable but was two beds joined together. Walking along the corridors it feels as though the tiles under the carpet are loose & missing in places causing you to trip. We used points for our stay so not sure if this was why we had such a luke warm response from the staff. We could not have afforded the 600+euro per night but have stayed in 4 star hotels at less than half the cost offering much better value for money. The hotel feels very much like it needs TLC. On the up side, the location was great, building and fixtures are beautiful, all linen was luxurious, the maid staff were very friendly and did an excellent job, the gym is well equipped and on the last night a cake arrived for my husbands birthday which was a lovely thought.

Reviews.Title: “Great for free, but a rip if you paid”
Reviews.Author: SoCa1l26
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Rome at the Westin after a train trip from Venice. Took a cab to the hotel. Staff was helpful and check-in was efficient. Hotel is very pretty inside in older/ornate way. Location is pretty good but not extremely close to major attractions. The Trevi fountain is about .7 miles or a little over a km away. The Spanish steps are a bit further. The hotel is a typical Westin. You are expecting a very nice room and impeccable service. As usual, food and all amenities are very overpriced which is what you expect from the this type of hotel. We chose not to eat at the hotel at all. Continental breakfast was over 30 Euros, I don't know if they would add 20% gratuity and a delivery charge like they do in the US. So for my wife and I we would have paid around $70 total for a continental breakfast, perhaps more. We passed. The room was very nice. When we checked in we were told we had been given an "upgraded" room due to our Starwood status. The room was very nice if a bit dim. The king bed was exceptionally comfortable. The shower was excellent in particular, but not a lot of lighting. We faced an inner courtyard rather than the streets. We were a bit disappointed that we did not have a street view of Rome. So what was in the courtyard? A drab bunch of windows, parts from air conditioning ductwork lying on the ground, and 4 or 5 pots with dead plants in them. Not what I would expect from a purported 5 star hotel. The hotel was nice and the location was pretty good. It was expensive if you paid, but luckily it was free for us. At that price it was a great value. I'm not sure the "upgraded" status was real or just a line to make us feel good about the view of the dead plants and AC ducts lying around outside the window. See the attached pictures.

Reviews.Title: “Not all it pretends to be”
Reviews.Author: Star125
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin Excelsior in Rome and found it rather pretentious and not at all up to the five-star standard. The restaurant is extremely expensive. There is an air that they are doing you favors for simple requests. The staff was just adequate and not extremely helpful. The internet service is expensive with no shared internet area so the beautiful lobby is constantly empty with no music, hor d'oeuvres or reason to sit and enjoy it. The location is a bit out of the way and we found the need to walk to many of Rome’s attractions. It is a hike from the train station as well. The double bed was as in most of Italy two singles; but without one sheet connecting they continually separated. We also noted neither coffee maker nor iron nor hair dryer yet in other areas of Italy we had coffee makers & hair dryers. The shower always flooded when used and the bidet leaked. Breakfast for two is over $100. The Westin Excelsior Rome was rather ordinary. We also stayed at the Westin in Florence and found a completely different experience; one that was five-star, helpful, elegant and thoughtful.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as it thinks it is!”
Reviews.Author: colw08
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 night recently and for the prices they are charging they are certainly under delivering on most aspects. They are living on a reputation of 5 star hotel. It started out well with a welcome bottle of champagne and fruit form the manager. Nice gesture. Room was dated and is crying out for a makeover. Dirty glasses left in the room for the entire length of our stay. Could not get over this. I didnt bother calling housekeeping to remove them as i was interested to see how long it would take them to clear them out using their own common sense/initiative. They were still not cleared upon our departure. For the prices they are charging its the least one could expect. Toiletries were not replenished each day and we had to call housekeeping for more. Again unacceptable. No room service menu or welcome guide/instructions in the room. Usual charges for pressing etc were horrendous €14 to get a shirt ironed! (they do not provide in room irons or ironing boards as the staff said they were not allowed due to it being a fire hazard...hmmm certainly does encourage and force people to pay the outrageous prices for the pressing service) I suppose we just have ourselves to blame for staying here and have learned a lesson that all the glitters is certainly not gold when it comes to certain 5 star hotels. Would not return.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but this hotel need some makeup”
Reviews.Author: platinum4life
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a great Via Veneto hotel the Westin is right next to the US Embassy and about a 5 minute walk to the subway station. There are tons of "expensive" places to eat near by and on some of the side streets you can actually find some good places with reasonable prices. The hotel staff really try hard to help all they can and cannot be faulted. I am sure the rooms at one time were the talk of the town and are all old world design and charm. The only complaint that I would have is that they just need some basic maintance, like new paint and carpet. This is a pretty high volumn hotel and it shows. If you are Starwood gold or platinum and can get an upgrade to one of the corner suites, you will not be dissapointed as the one I got had a fire place in the hugh living room and seperate shower and tub in the bath. Overall it is a good place to stay and quite at night but you won't be wowed like you would be if you stayed at the St. Regis.

Reviews.Title: “the best hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: someone66
Reviews.Content: This is the best hotel ever! Located in the center of the city, few minutes away from the most attractive “piazza’s of Rome, shops and most known cinematographic roads. Very fashionable and classic! Excellent service, professional, polite, cleaned and shined! If you need to go anywhere or do anything, concierge is always there very professional and well organized with any information and time scheduled of what is happening in the town. A remarkable experience

Reviews.Title: “best hotel in romas history”
Reviews.Author: armenianburbank
Reviews.Content: From the day I went to Westin Exelsior I fell in love with this hotel. It is located in the best location of Rome. The staff that works in the hotel are the most friendliest, and kind people I have ever seen. The rooms are beautiful dolce vita style. They welcome u every moment with a big smile. Specially the manager Her name is Elisabetta pantano. She is the most kindest, knowledgable person I ever seen in this business. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone in the world . You never want to leave the room after staying in this hotel. I cant wait to go back to Rome to stay at the excelsior again. I not only stayed in an excellent place I made long time friends with the staff. They truly are wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice rooms, great concierge”
Reviews.Author: abc713
Reviews.Content: We had a great experience. The location was great and the staff super helpful. Many of the restaurants in Rome were closed the week we were there (Romans take off for vacation in August) but the concierge was great about suggesting places they knew were open or calling some of the places we wanted to go to and checking if they were open. Rooms were in need of a bit of updating. We used Starwood points for the entire stay so it was a value for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but Pricey”
Reviews.Author: ShaunMc
Reviews.Content: I know its Rome, i Know its bang on the Via Vittario Venato but 70 euro a day to park my car was a little steep as was 22 euro for two small coffees and a Sprite. We did not eat in the hotel because of all the lovely places around the hotel. We had two connecting rooms on the family package and they were large if not in need of a bit of TLC. I guess they call it Shabby Chic. It is an old hotel but very nicely laid out and in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “stay anywhere but here.”
Reviews.Author: NeilandGill
Reviews.Content: Awful. Cold and pretentious. After spending two weeks of our honeymoon in Sorrento at the fabulous Hotel Bristol, we decided to top off our holiday with a three night stay in Rome, staying at the "5 star deluxe" westin excelsior. The hotel is so cold and unwelcoming. The breakfast (40 euros per person per day I might add!!) was no better than what is on offer at the buffet at any Premier Inn in the UK, and the staff at breakfast are so slow and so disinterested it is untrue. Speaking of the staff, my advice is that unless your name begins with Sheik or Lord, do not stay here because the staff will not be the slightest bit interested in you. We stood and watched great service one day as a new sheik and his family checked in, and then immediately afterwards got the service they seemed to give to "normal" people, which included the concierge not even being bothered to get my new wife a map - to his mind, it was good enough for him to point at it at the other end OF HIS OWN DESK, and then we practically had to beg for directions. In short, Rome is beautiful, and should definitely be visited. However, there are loads of other 4 and 5 star hotels in the centre where this one is, and so I'd recommend staying in any one of those rather than this stuck up place. By the way, the pool is the size of a postage stamp, so please don't stay there purely because this hotel has a pool and the others don't.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Smoof
Reviews.Content: The Westin Excelsior is in a great location, just a few minutes from the top of the Spanish Steps. Our room was spacious, very quiet and comfortable. However it could have been a bit cleaner. The carpeting was dirty and our feet were black after walking the floors. And I didn't love having to pay for WiFi. But all in all, definitely a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Find something else”
Reviews.Author: Mittens27
Reviews.Content: Upon our arrival late at night, the roll away bed that was booked ahead of time by a manager at another hotel in Paris was nonexistent. I had been quoted 40 E extra for that. I was given one finally, but I was told it would cost me 95 E extra. We had booked two rooms. The rooms are very small, old and in need of upgrading. I went to use the pool in the morning, but it had a lot of white stuff floating in it. Upon asking the spa person where the steam room was, I was told it was out of order. The manager heard from the concierge that I was looking for another hotel. He asked me why, and I explained. He said he would honor the 40 E price for the cot, and also said he would reduce the price of the rooms substantially. When I checked out the next night, none of his promises were upheld. The girl at the front desk raised her voice at me when I tried to explain what had been promised, and said the promise would be upheld only if I stayed extra nights. I went to another hotel right around the corner, which had big rooms, and was ultra modern in aesthetics as well as technology, and with much better prices.

Reviews.Title: “Simply gorgeous hotel, sheer elegance !”
Reviews.Author: carlajeanne60
Reviews.Content: This elegant hotel located on the Via Veneto is simply the best. Great location just a few minutes to the best Rome has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible suite, pleasant hotel”
Reviews.Author: JCW
Reviews.Content: As SPG Platinum guests, we were upgraded to a truly wonderful suite - as good and as comfortable as you could ever wish for. As a result, our overall ranking of the hotel is excellent. There were a couple of niggles - the room was serviced very late one day (well after 3pm), and the concierge bizarrely and rudely despatched my wife to go and find a local shop for stamps rather than sorting out our letters himself. (The front desk rectified this for me, with profuse apologies, then posting the items at their cost). And the hotel restaurant and hence terrace on Via Veneto were closed for a refurb - not something that had been publicised at the time I'd booked a few months before. Overall, though, the suite was so good that this has to get a five star review from us.

Reviews.Title: “STAY AWAY...THERE ARE BETTER HOTELS IN ROME”
Reviews.Author: jthornto
Reviews.Content: My husband and I used our points to stay at this hotel for two days. If you expect customer service - STAY AWAY- if you expect breakfast buffet to be fresh- STAY AWAY- knats were flying around the food - if you expect a helpful concierge- STAY AWAY-I witnessed the concierge crumble up a 100 euro tip and literally throw it in a drawer and then he did not offer the couple the most helpful information on how to get around town...all he would say is there is a cab outside...almost as if he was getting a kickback from them???? We had just checked out of the Excelsior on Lido Beach in Venice and traveled to Rome to stay at this hotel...Night and Day difference...I would not even recommend this place to my worst enemy.

Reviews.Title: “Sorely, and sadly, in need of renovation”
Reviews.Author: LossForAName
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin Excelsior for a very muggy 4 days--2 days on Starpoints and 2 days on a tour. We were assigned a good-sized room in the older section. It was a bit run down (knobs missing, tile had seen better days, carpet not great), but the big issue was that the room did not cool properly. This was something that was duly noted at the front desk, but nothing was done about it. Well almost nothing. . .the housekeeper also found the room too hot and stuffy and brought a fan (and left it for us--thank you!). Re-circulating the air did help keep things a bit more comfortable. On the plus side, the location was wonderful--extremely convenient for nighttime walks to the Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain, and right next to the Villa Borghese. The food was good; the bar was nice and also friendly. Both were pricey--but you expect that in this area. Housekeeping was also a plus--not only did our regular housekeeper get us a fan, but when I discovered the first morning that the hair dryer in the room didn't work, it was a matter of very few minutes before a new one was delivered. This is a grand old hotel which desperately needs a thorough renovation (even the carpets on the stairs provoked immediate dust allergy attacks). Until that occurs, I suspect that one's impression of this hotel will be largely dependent on the room to which he or she is assigned.

Reviews.Title: “Best Bed Ever”
Reviews.Author: TennesseeTraveler057
Reviews.Content: It's hard to criticize anything about the Excelsior. I can say the two things we liked most were the bed and the location. The size of the bathroom, with double sinks and separate shower and tub, are close seconds. We had a standard room and the overall size was impressive. The decor and furnishings gave us a feeling of historic luxury, without them seeming old by any means. The location on Via Veneto is beyond the distance you would want to walk to sites in the ancient quarter, but Rome is so spread out that you need to learn the metro and particularly the bus system. Both of those systems are convenient to Via Veneto and once we learned them, getting around was relatively easy. It was also a nice quieter area to come back to at the end of the day. Via Veneto and the Westin are extra pricey for food and drinks, but if you're picking the Excelsior you probably already know that or don't care. We stayed on points, so we didn't expect to eat at the Westin's restaurant or drink much from the bar, and therefore weren't bothered by 10-12 euro beers or more for mixed drinks. Attached to the bar was a very comfortable lobby area with couches and chairs where you could have a refreshment if you so cared or just chill out. I did try the pool which is in the basement and usually wasn't busy. It felt great after a long hot day and the sauna helped relax any tired muscles. Finally, the concierge was helpful on several occasions with dinner reservations. I slightly knocked the service rating in my review solely because we felt this was a very business oriented hotel and staff generally showed a similar efficient side without much of a personable side. It wasn't rude or condescending, just not friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Certainly not what it used to be..Come on Westin where are your standards?”
Reviews.Author: pmdubai
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the Excelsior before, the decision to book again was an easy one as the location is good and the property is certainly grand. Perhaps the indifference at check-in should have given me some hint as to what our latest experience would be like an as to had happened to this once refined and beautiful hotel. The Grand Luxe room was just slightly smaller and cheaper than the standard we had also booked, which appeared a little odd and when given teh pice difference, but as we were on vacation and only there for three nights, we could tolerate this. What was intolerable was the grime, apparently from polution, that coated the soft furnishings - curtains, carpets and headboards. The 'sumptuous furniture' as described in the sales blurb consisted of only one armchair and this had seen better days. I felt that I had to say something at this point but the indifference, verging on arrogance, at reception raised it's ugly head a further time when we pointed out concerns. Again, the short stay and busy itinerary allowed us to ignore this. Perhaps the oint where our tollerance faltered was our first morning at breakfast. The hotel had sold its soul to some large tour operators and so had no space in its restaurant to cater for the peak numbers coming in at the same time just before their coach picked them up; so their answer was to close the tasteful restaurant that sits on the Via Veneto and convert the large characterless ballroom at the rear of the building into a 'Vegas convention style' mass buffet, complete with an odd collection of poorly disguised ballroom tables that had seen there best days, and a compliment of staff that simply could not cope with the numbers; clear your own table, find your own cutlery and cross you fingers that the coffee would be warm. How could Westin do allow this to happen to their premier property in Rome? Is business that desperate? A short conversation with the General Manager of the property to simply express our displeasure was met with a response that suggested that the hotels focus had changed and rather than being a stop for the discerning traveller, the hotel must now attract the dollars of the volume operators....and in the current economics who could blame them for that? All I wuld ask is that they make this shift in approach a little more apparent on their websites and that Westin, as a group, came clean on this. The GM did all he could by offering us dinner and there was a bottle of prosseco placed in the room of one our guests on our return that evening. The gestures were nice, but in reality all we wanted was the experience of teh Westin Excelsior that we had previously enjoyed.....but I fear this has gone for good.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional stay”
Reviews.Author: Debtheweb
Reviews.Content: Stayed four nights at this great hotel. Upon arrival check in was fast. Gal took us right to our room and showed us our room. Nice. We also saw LL Cool J in the lobby. The room was very large with very good amenities. Double sinks in the bathroom very nice. Great shower and good beds with great sleep. The service was excellent. We emailed the concierge a number of times prior to our stay with fast and excellent responses. When asked for extra towels within five minutes they were there. Had room service for breakfast each morning. Excellent food. One morning running late for our tour and they delivered breakfast in ten minutes. Each morning the same. Outstanding. When the tour bus got there front desk called to say your tour is here. Again travel lots and not often you get this high level of service. Location was great. Unbelievable how quiet the room was. Great sleep Highly recommend. Would return for sure. Maybe one of the best hotel stays. Moved to Intercontinental for conference after that. If could would have gone back to Westin in a heartbeat. Not even close to the value and service of the Westin

Reviews.Title: “Skip This Hotel When in Rome”
Reviews.Author: PAQ
Reviews.Content: As an SPG Platinum member, I had very high hopes for this hotel. I was disappointed. Location is ok, and check in was friendly and smooth. The hotel has not been upgraded in decades. Supposedly, I got an upgraded room but that was hard to believe. It was on the 2nd floor facing the loud street below. Westin Heavenly Bed was great, and AC and water pressure in shower were also great. Breakfast not included, no complimentary water, and not upgraded to a suite. Worst part was a truck outside the building with some sort of a pump from an engine making noise from 1 to 4 a.m. Otherwise, a fine hotel but no way worth over U.S. $350/night. This place really needs a makeover.

Reviews.Title: “Exclusive hotel in a beautiful setting”
Reviews.Author: Redrebeltraveller
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel situated at the top of a stunning tree lined avenue just below Villa Borghese. It is approximately five minutes walk from the Spanish Steps and shopping district and 10-15 minutes from the Trevi Fountain and Pantheon with a further short walk on to Piazza Navona. I have stayed in hotels closer to the 'centro storico' but found that even from the Westin Excelsior, everything was in walking distance. The hotel is in a very safe, affluent area, and is situated near to many restaurants and bars so there was no shortage of nightlife and we felt safe walking to and from the hotel during the day and at night time. The hotel itself was quiet and restful which was a welcome break at times from the buzz of the city. The rooms were spacious and tastefully decorated, and the aircon in both the corridors and the rooms themselves kept the temperature at just the right level. Breakfast was well organised with a considerable variety of choice, and the service was friendly and efficient. I stayed at this hotel for three nights whilst attending a conference in Rome with several work colleagues, and would recommended it for both business and pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Room”
Reviews.Author: HR2007
Reviews.Content: We were upgraded to a beautiful 2 room suite that was probably 1500 sq. feet. The room amenities were very nice and the heavenly bed was very comfortable. It was in a good location in Rome and I would go back.

Reviews.Title: “high end hotel with many missing details = lack of luster”
Reviews.Author: illinicane
Reviews.Content: nice hotel and location......but when all is said and done, it just does not hit the mark for the money spent. my shower door keeps dragging against the floor and i fear it will break. have told front desk three times and no response. cleanliness is lacking in the bathroom as well. the restaurant is closed and they have a make shift one in a meeting room for breakfast. the key stops working every day (i did not erase with my cell) and have to have it changed. the elevator is sloooooooooow and frustrating. on a positive note, the gym is decent and the pool is nice. there are many friendly people working here, but i am not sure if this is a hotel issue or a cultural issue.

Reviews.Title: “Old World Elegance and Opulence”
Reviews.Author: The_Diva_Traveler
Reviews.Content: What a luxurious feeling it was to arrive at the Excelsior Hotel in Rome. As a SPG Platinum member, I had hoped for an upgrade, but was doubtful since we booked the entire 4 night stay on points. What a lovely surprise to be upgraded to a fabulous 1 bedroom corner suite! The suite was exceptionally large, with a marble fireplace, marble bathroom, and separate bedroom. The celiings were at least 15 foot high, and had lovely gilded crown molding. The wall panels were in a deep red silk with the Borgehese bee embroidered upon them. The flat screen TV was a nice touch of modernity amongst the very old world furnishings. The couch and 2 chairs were dwarfed by the room, and while comfortable, lacked the scale to match the room. The shower in the bathroom was surprisingly small - despite the bathroom being gigantic by European standards. The plumbing fixtures (faucets) were outdated, but the bathroom still felt very high end. The large windows open up fully, and when closed, the road noise was very muted. The room service prices are outrageous - there is simply no reason why an American Breakfast of coffee, eggs, toast and bacon should cost 42 Euros (about 60 dollars) plus service charge. Ate at the hotel restaurant, and was charmed by the blend of modern and classic furnishings, the fantastic service, and the ambiance. However, was vastly disappointed in the menu - overpriced, mediocre quality. Would definitely not eat there again - there are too many far better choices with far better prices. The amuse bouche was by far the worst piece of tuna I have ever eaten. The waiter actually clicked his heels when we asked for something, and it seemed that he was only taking care of 2 -3 tables because his attendance was constant without being obnoxious. The General Manager sent up a lovely large plate of fruit just after check in, and we felt valued as Platinum members. After staying at the Cardinal Hotel St Peter earlier in the week for business, it felt like we had reached an oasis when we arrived at the Excelsior. Overall - a fantastic choice for a stay in Rome - especially when on an expense account. My only suggestions to the hotel would be to ensure that they don't get too caught up in the old world without ensuring that they are providing a modern viewpoint.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, but expensive hotel”
Reviews.Author: KatieCharlotte
Reviews.Content: Everything about the Westin Excelsior is beautiful. The lobby, the bar, the restaurants, the room - they were all fantastic. Service was great as well. The room was spacious, though we didn't have a view. However, it was quite expensive - and probably a little overpriced. The location was great too - we were able to walk to most places we were interested in seeing, and the bus and subway stops were close by when we wanted to go someplace further away.

Reviews.Title: “Old Fashioned is not the same thing as old...”
Reviews.Author: AlexBaillie
Reviews.Content: This hotel should be fantastic - its a great location and a stunning building. Unfortunately, for me it just doesn't live up to its promise. I love hotels with a bit of history and I have stayed in the Westin in Madrid several times where you feel you are transported back to a more opulent and genteel era. Unfortunately, its a fine art to combine this feeling with modern travellers expectations and The Excelsior definitely isn't pulling it off - it just feels a bit neglected and fusty. It's fine, but at these prices 'fine' isn't really good enough.

Reviews.Title: “Very Enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: LIVEINHOuSTON
Reviews.Content: Am an SPG member with platinum status - booked 4 nights - first night using 12K points, the other three nights took advantage of free weekend promo currently in play. Was upgraded to a large suite with 2 rooms on the 4th floor...one room with a king bed and bath with shower and separate tub, and the second room with a sofa and sitting chairs and it's own bathroom (no tub, just shower). Inside suite, so view of the buildings walls...wasn't bothered by this at all. Never ate at hotel and food was way overpriced. Excellent room - very pleased with all that. Check-in staff was very nice, the rest of staff were so so, not overly friendly but helpful when needed. About a 10 minute walk - a bit uphill - from nearest metro stop. Solid 15-20 minute walk from hotel to Termini train station...downhill; would certainly take longer uphill with bags. Overall very pleased with hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & beautifully appointed room”
Reviews.Author: georgianananina
Reviews.Content: Had beautifully appointed room with marble bath and balcony overlooking Via Vittorio Veneto. No noise. Helpful staff. Would highly recommend. Pricey but worth it. Had problem with airline losing luggage and staff went beyond the call of duty helping us.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Location”
Reviews.Author: gconsig
Reviews.Content: Loved being on the Via Veneto. The hotel feels like a busy, business hotel. Located next to the US embassy, with a wonderful park nearby for running. I very decent gym. Staff might have been a bit formal for my tastes, but after hours of touring its a very nice hotel to return to. We have lovely rooms with courtyard facing balconies and they were large and very quiet. By European standards, huge bathroom. I tend to like more of a boutique hotel experience, but for my first time in Rome, this was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Just so so”
Reviews.Author: kevinh73
Reviews.Content: A bit of a disappointment all around. Definitely not a five star hotel experience. First, when I check in, I requested an interior courtyard room because I was afraid the ones facing exterior would be noisy in the morning. I was led to a fairly nicely room on the second floor. I asked for a room with two beds since a friend of mine was going to join me the following day. The room I was led to only have one large bed but the receptionist said that they will have someone to come up and split the bed right away. I looked outside very quickly and it was facing very close to a next door neighbor. Clearly not an interior room but I was ok with it....until I started to hear construction sound. I look outside once more and noticed there were scaffolding on my side of the hotel wall. I was livid. I dragged my luggage downstairs and demanded they gave me an interior room. They quickly gave me an interior courtyard room and the room already came with two beds. It was also slightly bigger than the room that was given to me originally. If you are a light sleeper, definitely ask for the interior courtyard room. There were several behaviors that were unbecoming of a five star hotel. For one, a hotel of this stature should replenish the body wash bottle daily. I noticed that the body wash bottle was never replenished during my stay. I ended up running out of it since the bottle was so small and had to request more. Then there was an incident that after taking away our dirty body towel, they totally forgot to put in new ones. When I got back to the hotel after a long day walk. I took a shower right away and when I got out, I noticed there were no body towels and ended up using hand towels to dry myself. Let's see, what else... The marble tile bath was nice but there were so many molds on the grout that I have to believe they never even bother to clean my shower the whole six days I stayed there. In fact, when I first moved into the room, the grout was already covered in mold. All of this is not that big of a deal. The reason for the complaint is that this hotel is suppose to be a five star hotel. One of the best in Rome. And clearly this hotel does not live up to any five star hotel's expectation. Also this hotel is kinda fard from all the attractions. It's about 15-20 minutes walk to tourist traps. The walk is agreeable enough. But if your main goal is to be close to the attractions, then this hotel may not be suitable for you. Also this hotel is situated near the end of Via Veneto which can be a bit of a track since Via Veneto is not a flat walk. So every time after a long day walk, you'll have to track upwards from the tourist traps to your hotel. Normally it's not that bad. But on tire legs, well, is kind of a drag. If you are taking taxi everywhere, then it should not be of any problem. Overall it was a pleasant stay but I would say it's not worth the money considering the cons.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: enr12
Reviews.Content: Hotel is situated above the Spanish steps in a very good central location, close to restaurants and the gardens. It has an old world charm and the rooms are good size,. The service was excellent, but breakfast was very expensive, close to 45euros. had a very good tour of the city using Romcabs. They used a mercedes minivan which was very comfortable, and it was a good way to get to various sites in one day.

Reviews.Title: “Well used, stuffy and overpriced”
Reviews.Author: wired_ed
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel twice and the experience has been consistent: nicely situated, yet stuffy and in dire need of a restoration. Fairly small spa area, fine Fitness machines. The personell is not overly enthusiastic and the resulting service is accordingly. While the standard lives up to what is common these days at the large US chains, it falls well short of what is considered 5 star standard in Europe. It is ok for burning points, but don't pay the exorbitant rates, as you will be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely classic hotel”
Reviews.Author: hmarti24
Reviews.Content: We had three rooms at the Westin Excelsior for 5 nights and were not disappointed. The location was central enough that is was easy to get around. We did the unthinkable and rented a car in Rome. It's not easy, but with a map and a good sense of humor it can be accomplished. Getting in and out of this hotel is doable for families continuing on to other destinations. Our rooms were spacious, clean and classically appointed. The staff was friendly with us and our brood which included 5 children between the ages of 4 and 14. The hotel was very child friendly. My husband and I particularly enjoyed relaxing in the hotel bar after a long day of sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “I am booking this hotel for the 6th time”
Reviews.Author: Lilit_LA
Reviews.Content: I just found out that Westin Excelsior is offering its rooms at 12000 starpoints points to SPG members. I'll be in Rome on May 10 and had reservations at St. Regis Grand, but when I saw how many points I could save, I immediately switched my hotel. Westin has treated me well, even though I am not a platinium member. Last time I was there, when I came to the room, there were beautiful flower arrangement and chocolate dipped strawberries left with a note from management welcoming me back. I like the location (one time we wondered thru the streets of Rome and ended up in Vatican. That was so great! We didn't even realize how much we walked) and rooms. Nice bathrooms too. However, I noticed that hotel staff do loose attention to regular guests if there are VIP guests around (such as last time there was a film festival going on and they had all the stars staying there, or diplomats come in with their securities and they take the whole attention to themselves). Concerige can be helpful. Once we asked them for a recommendation for mama's and papas trattoria and they suggested one. We went there and all the eaters there were from Westin Excelsior. The place is good. I went there twice, but it was funny to see all Westin Excelsior guests there. Overall, I am looking for another good experience at this hotel. Planning on lots of walking, so hope that weather is not going to be rainy all the time.

Reviews.Title: “3rd time here...just as good as the first”
Reviews.Author: sirlawrence_9
Reviews.Content: We were "delayed" by the volcano and being a starwood platinum def has it's advantages.. The excelsior staff took great of us and made sure we had a beautiful suite and were very comfortable for the four nights we were there with the exception of one major glitch with the transportation desk ( beware of them but also realize they have no affiliation with the hotel) everything else was perfect ! we were also there when the delegation from lebanon was staying at the excelsior, and that only added to the fun and mystery ..after all we are in Roma use the concierge..they directed us towards such a great place we went back twice I love this hotel and staff and thanks to them for making us feel so welcome !

Reviews.Title: “Horrible hotel, will never stay again!”
Reviews.Author: Photosinger
Reviews.Content: As the title mentions, this hotel is horrible. They charge 5 star prices but I would give it no more than 3 and that would be generous. I am an SPG Platinum member but did not get treated like one, (not that anyone should get treated badly when they go to a hotel). First of all when we checked in they refused to give us more than one key with out asking them 3 times. Then when we got to the room we were given a suite with 2 twin beds instead of one with one queen or king sized bed. They claimed that was all they had available. The room we got was in bad shape. The beds were uncomfortable. The sheets on one of the beds was stained. There was a big stain on the silk fabric on the wall as well. Our shower door was coming off, along with one of the curtain valances. We also had to have the mini-bar refrigerator replaced because it stopped working. In regards to the fitness center and business center: the fitness center is nice but every time I tried to use it it was closed or there were security guards all through it because some U.S. dignitary was probably staying there. (The hotel is right across the street from the U.S. Embassy.) The business center was nice but very expensive (£6.00) for a half an hour. When you are already paying 5 star prices for the room, you should not have to pay to use the internet! The worst thing about this hotel is the staff. We did not encounter one helpful or even one very nice person at all. Especially the concierge staff. Once I called down from my room to see if he could make any ticket arrangements for us to see any of the Roman sites and he said no. Then he recommended that I ask for help at the information booth across the street. Which by the way is a newspaper stand not an information booth. Another time I asked if he could make reservations for us at the Hard Rock Cafe around the corner. He said "no, they don't accept reservations." Then I asked what time they opened that night and he said they are only open for dinner after 6:30pm. Later that day we discovered that both of those statements were wrong. They do accept reservations and they open at 12:00pm and close at around midnight. Another night on our way out of the hotel we asked for an umbrella because it had been raining really hard earlier that day. When we asked for the umbrella the concierge just replied "it's not raining." We said we would still like one and he gave one to us. We found out soon after, when it started raining again, that the umbrella was broken! These concierges (and the rest of the staff) are useless!! We then found out that our flight was canceled because of the Volcano so we switched to the Hotel Eden for the 4 additional days that we were stuck in Rome. So, if you like horrible service, rooms that are falling apart, and like to feel unimportant then I recommend this hotel. But if you like to get 5 star service when you pay for 5 star service then I recommend going down the street two blocks to the Hotel Eden which is also a starwood property.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for! Great Hotel Great Location Great Place”
Reviews.Author: xTarynx
Reviews.Content: I went to Rome to celebrate my 24th birthday, after hearing that hotels in Rome are not very nice I wanted to book a lovely one and I wasnt dissapointed, this hotel is lovely the rooms are big and clean and very comfortable, the location is fantastic everywhere is within walking distance staff are so helpful, I left my phone there and realised when I got to the airport (didnt get it back) but staff were understanding and checked the room for me. Great hotel breakfast was also so nice would defo recommend.

Reviews.Title: “...great rooms, but food and service bit diappointing, would have expected more value for the money....”
Reviews.Author: ellen1001
Reviews.Content: Overall a good, high class hotel, but for 5 star prices I would expect a bit more service and quality of food. Therefore I would hesitate to recommend it at 100%. I spend 5 nights in this hotel, while I was attending a course. The seminar rooms were located in the basement, unfortunately without windows. But as a solution they placed lights behind "fake windows". The food (breakfast and lunch) was served in the room beside. The breakfast was ok (tho expensive), but lunch was not very good at all (pasta disappointly soft, total lack of spices and every day the same, sometimes even heated from day before). Coffee and snacks where very good and balanced it out somehow. The rooms were very nice and clean. But I was obviously a bit unlucky and got the room beside one, where they started some drilling work early in the morning and one tube was causing noises all night long (water from washing mashine?) The hotel was additionally on for a meeting of diplomates and therefore I had to pass numerous bodyguards (and their looks) to get to my room (~15-20). Service: Housekeeping came in twice, once I was getting dressed, once I was in a shower! When I came to the room in the afternoon to relax for 20 minutes the service was in and kept cleaning, thus I left again. Reception:just 1 point:due to the outbreak of the volcano and no outgoing flights, we had to prolong a night or 2. They appeared to be very unflexible(no proactivity).Nightstaff was far more helpful! H Bar and Restaurand Dooney were providing good food.

Reviews.Title: “We felt like Royalty”
Reviews.Author: DForeman
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Westin Excelsior twice in Aug. 2009, at the beginning and end of a cruise. We brought our 7 and 9 year old daugthers. We were using cash and points, as Starwood Preferred Guests, but were a bit frustrated that they did not have any rooms with double beds. To sleep four, we needed to reserve 2 rooms. Once we got past that everything was great. The staff was very helpful, and I must say the concierge was excellent in helping us arrange for a private tour at the Vatican and perfect restaurant reservations. The rooms we stayed in were unbelievable--you truly felt like you were in a palace. We enjoyed every second of our stay at this hotel, and cannot wait to return. The staff, rooms and location were beyond wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: kmc1021
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel on 3/27. Tried to check in as a starwood gold member and the staff could not find us in the computer. My mistake in making the reservation for 4/27 instead of 3/27. The staff could not have been nice enough in making the change and giving us a beautiful room on the second floor with a private balcony overlooking the Via Veneto. The room was very spacious, beautifully appointed and the bathroom was huge with slippers and lush bathrobes. The mattress was wonderful. The whole experience was outrageous. We walked to the Galleria Borghese, Trevi Fountain and a great restaurant in the area. We did not use the concierge services so I can not comment on that situation. Would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, obnoxious staff”
Reviews.Author: AngelinaTexas
Reviews.Content: The Westin Excelsior Hotel is very elegant and well located for touring Rome. As Americans, we often depend on concierge service at hotels when in Europe for tour booking, hotel reservations and recommendations and general directions. This hotel employs a rather large number of concierge staff and with the exception of one, all resented helping a guest in English. This staff made mistakes like booking us on an early morning day tour which we found when we tried to take the tour that morning, the tour was actually on the next day. Shopping and restaurant recommendations were made by taking out a map and circling most of the central part of Rome and suggesting you "check there". The reception staff are particularly rude and indifferent and the staff in the business/internet office are plain hostile. We expect great service for a hotel in this price range and this hotel is terrible for service.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic ambiance”
Reviews.Author: Nordberg
Reviews.Content: If you're the type to enjoy life's finer things then look no further than the Westin Excelsior. The staff was extremely attentive to our every need and the rooms were very spacious. Alot of detail was evident in the rooms decor which was top notch.

Reviews.Title: “Top choice for business”
Reviews.Author: jacobfuller23
Reviews.Content: From check-in to check-out I was treated like royalty. The staff were very courteous and professional, aswell as friendly. the service is top class. The rooms are kept extremely clean and spacious. When i go back to Rome, definitely i'll stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, but not without issues”
Reviews.Author: VacationAddicts07
Reviews.Content: We are Starwood Preferred Guests and had used up a large amount of points to stay at this extravagent hotel. Good location, very nice rooms and beautiful hotel overall....HOWEVER, I spent a couple of hours of my first night in Rome stuck in the shower of this hotel! The hinges on shower door were old and unable to support the weight of the heavy glass door which got stuck on the surrounding stone. Beautiful bathroom, but not exactly where I wanted to spend my first evening in Rome. Luckily my husband was able to call the front desk and throw me a towel through the small opening above the glass door. I hate to think of what would of happened had we both been in the shower or if I was travelling alone. A non-english speaking maintenance man finally arrived and took the hinges off the door and removed the door to free me. No apologies, no free breakfast , no mention of it even!! We didn't find the staff to be particularly friendly or helpful. The food prices were outrageous, but then if you can afford to pay the room rate for this place, you can probably afford the food. Lavish yes, location fine, customer service oriented not so much.

Reviews.Title: “Well...I'll never stay there again....”
Reviews.Author: HopAlot9
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for a few nights in December 2009. It was my worst hotel experience of the year. The room was not acceptable. Dirt on the walls, worn carpeting, shower that only released scalding hot or ice cold water. Worst of all, there was no way to regulate the heating. I can't believe this is a Westin.

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable hotel but resting on its laurels”
Reviews.Author: LukeUk
Reviews.Content: The luxury class Westin Excelsior is very well placed in the Via Veneto. The hotel is polished and elegant, even if the decor is becoming tired - as witnessed by threadbare patches of carpet in front of lift doors, scuffed paintwork, etc. The staff at reception are attentive and helpful, but elsewhere they appear unmotivated and disinterested. Do not expect the doorman to say hello when you see him in the morning, or the porter to leave his station to help with your luggage when you arrive by car. Breakfast trays left outside bedroom doors were still there 12 hours later. Rooms comfortable and good beds, although due to the huge size of the building, most overlook the three internal courtyards, making them quiet but rather dark. A small gym in the basement - three of the machines were out of order - and also an internal swimming pool - a real plus in the winter. A good base from which to explore Rome, but do not expect to be charmed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff at the Excelsior”
Reviews.Author: SusansIndianapolis
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for over a week, and were impressed with the cordial atmosphere from the front desk and concierges. Location along the Via Veneto is fairly good, although Rome is so spread out that we still took taxis to many sites. The rooms are just above average, decorated nicely, could use some updating. The health club is small, but has new equipment and there is a small pool and sauna.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: MIAMIBEACHMOM
Reviews.Content: I thought this Westin was amazing. As we are members of Starwood, we got two beautiful adjoining rooms that were larger than expected, both appointed with beuatiful glass chandeliers and fireplaces. The concierge couldn't have been nicer & even drew out a walking tour of the city on a map for me, so I wouldn't miss anything on the way. Amazing is the Galleria Borghese up the via Veneto. Check out Apollo & Daphne in the gallery. For food,"Cafe de Paris" at the bar accross the street is great. Amazing sandwiches, stylish, and not expensive.
