Pool is great at the end of the day for the kids.

Reviews.Title: “Service Beyond Expectations”
Reviews.Author: In79days
Reviews.Content: This review is a little old, but as I've just joined Trip Advisor, I'm slowly adding reviews on a few of the gems I've ben fortunate enough to stay at. This is one of the best. It is beautiful, elegant, decorated like a palace, and with wonderful service in a great location. However, I wanted to recognize what I think was an example of amazing service. We were ripped off by the cab driver who brought us from Rome's Central Station to the hotel. Being ripped off by Rome's taxi drivers is unfortunately not new, who on this occasion pulled the 20 for 5 Euro switch on me (they are both blue). What was new was how he the Westin dealt with it. I'd taken the cabs number, and when we got into the hotel, I asked them to call the police for me to report the driver. They gently explained how futile that would be, and instead, upgraded us to a beautiful room with a wonderful balcony that overlooked the city, and sent up a bottle of excellent wine as an apology for a problem they had absolutely no part in. What a terrific way to turn a problem into a great experience, and to guarantee that I stay at that hotel every time I go back to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “liked it !”
Reviews.Author: ranaho
Reviews.Content: the pros are more than the cons. great great location, classy hotel and nice rooms for who that love historical embiance . when we first arrived , they showed me to a room that i did not like, they had no problem showing me another, and still did not like .. than they showed me a room that has main road view .. which i accepted .. it was a big and spacious room with a tub and shower in the bathroom. the staff in the restaurant are very friendly and helpfull, but cannot say the same for the reception and concierge staff, they were dry and you can feel that they hate it that they have to attend us.

Reviews.Title: “Classic Hotel in Classic Location”
Reviews.Author: CathyBNewYork_NY
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in the Westin Excelsior three times, beginning in 2001 and most recently in 2007. Each time, we used Starwood points to book the rooms. The design is Italian Baroque, richly decorated in red silk curtains and walls, gilded ceilings and stunning marble baths with the most plentiful water of any hotel in the world! Rooms were clean and I saw no signs of wear during any of our visits. We found service to be excellent at the desk and through concierge and room service (and attributed this to SPG Gold Status, which is not even the chain's highest tier). Hotel is in a great location on Via Venetto and we walked for hours to enjoy Rome's attractions. Taxi cabs are plentiful at Hotel port cochere.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive, beautiful but needs a bit of work”
Reviews.Author: CaptRandall
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room #280 which was away from the street and therefore quite although it overlooked the central core of the hotel and the rooftop heating/cooling systems. We used a combination of Starpoints and money to book the room so the price was excellent. The rooms are incomparable – elegant, historic and beautifully furnished and decorated. However they appear to be lax on maintenance – I counted at least 10 light bulbs that were burned out in the room and the bath. The hotel is very expensive. A pot of hot tea cost 6 Euros and the breakfast buffet was about 42 Euros. It seems that if you walk a little ways from this hotel area you can get a good meal for 1/3 the cost of dining in the hotel. The internet cost extra as well. This is the hotel to be at while in Rome. During our 3 nights here we had at least 2 dignitaries arrive complete with police escorts. Makes for a bit of loud confusion in the lobby area while they are being whisked into their rooms, but not too much inconvenience otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Overall”
Reviews.Author: kapbak
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 days in October. While the entrance and lobby area were lovely, the room itself was extremely tired, run down and in need of renovation. It was also during a hot spell in October and the room was quite hot and stuffy , but the air conditioning was turned off for the season. We also found the staff to be quite indifferent. We would walk into the lobby and there would be 4 or 5 staff people standing behind the registration adn the concierge desk doing nothing, and none of them would even look up and acknowledge our existence. Best thing about the hotel is the location and large size of the room.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Experience”
Reviews.Author: honestfeedback25
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel using our starwood points. There were two couples in our party. One of the people in our group was a platinum starwood member. We were slightly hesitant about booking the hotel as we had read some poor reviews about service and the condition of the hotel. However this was not the case when we stayed there. We had great service from the moment we arrived in the taxi cab, the bellmen were very poliet and efficent, the front desk staff had great manners and efficeny. We were upgraded to two suites due to the platinum mebership status both were VERY large in size if you have ever travelled to euope they are about 3 times the size of a standard room. The rooms were not quite ready at the time of arrival but the front desk staff escorted us to the lounge and we had a drink on the house while waiting a few minutes for our room. The hotel itself is slightly older but kept very clean and in good condition. The view of the via Veneto was amazing from our room. We checked out the pool and spa/gym area they were all quite nice. The pool was not spectacular but we didn't come to Rome to swim so it was not a problem! I have to say we did not eat at the hotel or order room service as it was quite expensive, but not more so than anywhere around the hotel. We ate breakfast at a coffee bar across the street and it was fantastic. We also had dinner at a place across the street in a little glass street car which was also great. You need to realize that this hotel is on the most expensive street in Rome as it is the most famous street (Via Veneto) therefore if you are wanting to pay a little less just walk off the street a couple blocks. There are tonnes of magnificant resaurants and coffee shops a small walk away that are affordable. One of the best places we ate on our whole trip to italy was in Piazza Navona. In true Westin style the beds were plush the towels, robes and slippers were great and the bathroom had all the immenities! Overall this hotel was great and a true experience when in Rome. Location was also perfect! I would come back any day.

Reviews.Title: “Roman Excellence”
Reviews.Author: ajtroiano
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in a great part of town (right next door to the US Embassy). The hotel was clean and staff was very helpful. The best meal we had in Rome was 2 blocks behind the hotel, at Giovanni's; a family owned place open since the 1930's.

Reviews.Title: “OUTSTANDING!”
Reviews.Author: stevenmal
Reviews.Content: I read a couple of the negative reviews and they were wrong. This was a great hotel with a good location. I read people concerned about the price of the breakfast buffet and they are correct it is too expensive. What they did not say was there are other things on the menu that are reasonablly priced. Plus you could walk a few steps outside of the hotel to little cafes for breakfast as well. The staff was awesome and I cant think of one bad thing to write. We stayed in Grand Luxe rooms that were adjoining. (I am gold with SPG and it was a complimentary upgrade) We had more than enough space in our rooms. We really could have had 4 people in the room but the kids wanted their own room. I travel almost every week and am really pretty critical of hotels. But this place is a must!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: prbyers
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel a total of 4 times. We have been impressed each time. The style is traditional and classic. The rooms are a nice size and very clean. We were upgraded to a suite once which was a real treat. The location is excellent and we walked to everything in Rome, although it's closest to Villa Borghese and the Spanish Steps. The staff was more than helpful on several occasions. They helped often with directions, train schedules and general suggestions of thing to do both inside and outside of Rome. The food and drinks in the hotel are pricey but that is to be expected. We went across the street for breakfast each morning instead of choosing the 30 euro breakfast in the hotel. We will stay here again and recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but will not stay again in this hotel”
Reviews.Author: joespie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Westin Excelsior, Rome for 1 week (May 29 to June 7, 2009) using our starpoints. Via Veneto is a very expensive area to dine and shop. We are disappointed when we arrived at the hotel on May 29 our room was not yet ready. We have to wait till 2pm, and when they gave us our keycard and went to our room. Our room was not ready. The housekeeping was still busy cleaning our room. So we have to wait again for about 4 minutes. The hotel needs renovation, its already worn out. The furnitures, cabinets needs to be replaced. I was hesitant at first in booking/making reservations at this hotel. There are other two hotels which is Eden and St Regis with the same starpoints used which is nearby. We had dinner one night at the hotel, I remember ordering a coke, it cost about 10 dollars. The service at the restaurant is excellent. We are not coming back at this hotel again and will not recommend to my friends. But I would like to commend the housekeeping staff for a job well done.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel in all Manners”
Reviews.Author: DavisEM
Reviews.Content: Spent Labor Day weekend (Spet 3-7) at the Westin Excelsior and the hospitality was fabulous. Before my trip, I sent several emails to the hotel concierge to help books reservations, put in a request for a Starwood points upgrade and also to add a friend to the booking. The Concierge made all of my requests and answered my emails within one day - they were so polite in their correspondence as well. I checked in early, causing total inconvenience, but it was not a problem and never given a sign of discontent by the front desk. They accommodated my early arrival and were more than happy to provide me with valet help as well as they tried to check out people. The suite was large and very beautifully decorected. Did need a fresh coat of paint and new carpet, but regardless the place was spotless. The property was very well kept. Staff kind. Requests fulfilled in a quick manner. The location is fantastic on the beautiful Via Veneto - nice little walk to the Borghese Gardens, the metro, Spanish Steps, etc. Will go back definitely.

Reviews.Title: “Our own Palace in Rome”
Reviews.Author: CyberAynne
Reviews.Content: My teenaged son and I stayed here during his spring break and it was impressive. The location was great for seeing the Via Veneto and Borghese Gallery but not for much else. That said, the spa is excellent, the service sublime, and if you want to impress someone, this place will fill the bill! We had 15 foot ceilings in our standard room with chandelier and were greeted with a bowl of rose petal water to refresh ourselves.

Reviews.Title: “Beware--this hotel is not accommodating to women at all.”
Reviews.Author: lovestotravel321
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to Rome on a company trip. The part of the hotel where we stayed had room keys that are the kind that swipe. Our room keys did not work on several different occasions. Each time that this happened, I was required to show photo ID and I was questioned. I was dressed professionally and treated badly. On no occasion did my husband ever have to show any type of ID. He was just handed a new key without responding to any questions or showing anything. The first few times it happened, I was annoyed, after that it got really old. I wouldn't recommend this hotel to a dog.

Reviews.Title: “Stodgy and Grumpy”
Reviews.Author: laabis
Reviews.Content: We chose the Excelsior because the St. Regis was fully booked. We were told that the Excelsior was a sister hotel and since we had such a wonderful experience last year at the St. Regis, we decided to give it a go. The problem with this hotel is not the lobby, the rooms, the facilities--it is the grumpy service. We had just arrived from 3 nights at the Four Seasons in Florence, so the juxtaposition was obvious. We pulled up to the Excelsior in our car and the hotel greeter couldn't muster a hello or welcome. The first words out of his mouth were "It will cost 70 euros to park the car here. Do you want to do it?" Next we arrive at the front desk and the joyless lady gives us the key and asks, "Do you want me to accompany you to your room?" The worst offense was the concierge, Claudio, who sent us to one of his buddy's tourist traps. I'm truly sorry to be so negative. If you see my other reviews, you'll find that, in general, I really like where we stay--because I study various sources pretty well before choosing a hotel. Final complaint is that the Via Veneto is simply an unappealing road in Rome. It is quite dirty and there is a bit of riff raff at night. On the positive side, we thought our room was great. It was beautiful in an old world sense. While the decor was a tad bit too old-world-parloresque for my taste, it still was a very nice bedroom and bathroom. Additionally, we loved the breakfast which was comprehensive with every imaginable item. For those of you who have traveled in Italy over the last couple of decades, the best way to describe this hotel is that it hasn't changed its service orientation from the 80s. It used to be that all the 5 star hotels in Italy were grumpy and most have changed out of necessity. This place still treats its customers the way the motor vehicle division treats the 16 year olds trying to get a driver's license for the first time.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby”
Reviews.Author: MorganJ
Reviews.Content: Mostly stay at Westins when we travel. After looking thru tripadvisor it seemed that the Excelsior was a good option. Let's be honest - centrally placed roman hotels are never "great" - we can only hope for rooms that are more than 20m2 and no rodents. ;) The Westin does indeed look very nice from the outside. The style is what it is. If you like it, great - if not - you have to cope as modern hotels are not really widespread in Rome. We stayed for 4 days 27-30th of sep. We hit several snags. First arriving, no one made any attempts at helping us with the bags. Reception was busy (all the time) and hardly welcoming. English skills above average for Rome. The room we were assigned on the 4th floor (Grand Luxe) overlooking the main street was old. I mean - really old. I don't mind the old world luxury hotel style if it's "crisp". This was not. Every corner on every piece of furniture had a chip in it. Carpets were ok, but torn in the hall. Closets stank OLD. Bathroom was worn (but im sure nicely done 30 years ago in marble), windows looked like they were past expiry, TV digital channels didn't work, I counted 4 lightbulbs not working etc etc. AC had a loud clicking noise... Had some (removeable) stains on atable, they stayed there thru the entire stay. The AC had clearly been fixed and refixed so the lowered ceiling plates were just barely covering the ceiling by the AC and all covered in dirt / oil. Room service was above par. Cleaning was clearly below. Maintenance was way way below. The pool in the basement was great. Too cheap to offer comp. water though. (only a small water dispenser hidden in the fitness room). It's a shame, the hotel location is great, theres a lot of posibilities in the property. None of which Hotel management chose to use.

Reviews.Title: “Great Central Hotel, near park”
Reviews.Author: dan_berlin
Reviews.Content: Room: my room was in a nice size. with a comfortable king size bed. plenty towls, cushions etc. available. a desk, two chairs with a table. Futniture are "old fashioned-style" with a baroc look. all in all the standard is maintaned and nice. The bath was in a comfortable size with nice marble tiles. very clean. beds are prepared for the night, curtains closed etc. location. the hotel is a nice area of Rome further to the north. bus service is close by. the subway is about 500m (1/4 mile) away. the spanish steps are within walking distance. major sightseeing attractions eg. Vatican are in reach by cab within a 10 Euro reach. Service Staff is friendly, speaks fluently English. Customer orientation could be a bit more intense, considering 5 stars plus! I had a request going beyond just the talking, in the need of having the staff to interact with other hotels / reservations within the Sheraton group. Here I had to do intense convincing to help me on my request. So the hotel service just receives a below average considering the 5 stars! the hotel has a wellness area (massages, work-out area, steam bath and swimming pool). I had a look, the work out area has plenty room, with free weights, cardio and some other devides. Pool is small in size, enough to let one-self float in the water :) in general the area had been clean with a nice warm atmosphere. Overall: The hotel is in a central location with good access to many sides in Rome (eg. Hard Rock Cafe and American Embassy in walking reach of 5 minutes; Termini (main train station) within reach of 15 minutes (taxi) etc.). And not to forget, a very beatiful and nice park for leisure, running etc just around the corner! A nice Alternative in the area are the nh hotel, splendide royal. Pricing: At the time of my stay the rates varied among 300 up to 500 Euro / night in a double room exkl. breakfast. Breakfast is marked at 35 Euro.

Reviews.Title: “Rather tired, surprised it is a Westin”
Reviews.Author: ruperthebear
Reviews.Content: The lobby of the hotel grand if rather antiseptic. However the lifts, corridors etc are rather tired and could do with updating. Also, the public areas were not well maintained - cups and glasses were left around for long periods of time. Our room was rather dark and dingy altougjh we had a lovely exrernal balcony (without this the room woudl have been a bit oppressive). It had a great bathroom and a typical high-qality Westin bed. The soundproofing was not good. A lot of noise leaked in from the corridors, nearby rooms and from outside. All in all this didn't feel like a 5-star hotel and certainly not like a typical Westin. It was OK but I know that Rome has lots more to offer so I wouldn't come back here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: MissAisling
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a stunning exterior and a great location. The room was huge but it felt old and unwelcoming. The staff were fine but not particularly helpful. Breakfast was not included in the rate. It was an expensive hotel and I felt that it wasn't really worth the cost.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, not so great staff”
Reviews.Author: Oninekim
Reviews.Content: Upon check-in we were given an upgrade to a room that has a balcony that overlooks the rooftops on Via Veneto. The room was very clean and spacious. The upgrade was a very nice suprise. The only issue with the room was that the balcony was very dirty and looks as if it has not been washed down or swept regularly. This hotel is historic in the sense that the building is very old and so is the antique furnishings within it. The only issue with this hotel was the staff. The concierge staff was not very helpful or friendly. We waited in line to speak to one of them for a good while and not once did they acknowlege our presence. It was as if we were bothering them and so we simply gave up and left. One thing that we noticed is that none of the staff had smiles on their faces, ever. The H bar was nice and modern. The drinks were pricey and the staff was more interested in talking to each other rather than serving their customers. Aside from the service, this hotel is located in a very nice area and there are alot of great restaurants and attractions nearby to keep you very busy and entertained. To sum it all up, this is in a great location but the service could use some adjusting. I think the prices were too high for the brunch and drinks for what you got. You would do better to go elsewhere for that.

Reviews.Title: “Westin Excelsior, Rome- Great room, excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: travelmomwkids
Reviews.Content: We had reserved a room for 2 nights with points to unwind before a cruise on 8/15. We reserved one room and although we had 2 children they allowed us to book one room. European hotels are a bit sticky when having 4 people in one room. The room was large and clean, it was a little like staying in Napoleon's bedroom with the chandelier and the silk brocade wall paper. I liked the decorations it just reminded us that we were in Europe. Our room was on the top floor with a small balcony with a great view. The gym pretty small but looked like it had some decent equipment. The pool area was hot!! It looked nice but the temp in the room must've been 100 degrees. We had no problems and the concierge was pleasant and helpful. They all spoke English. The best part of the hotel is its location. Everything was within walking distance and the area is hard to beat with great restaurants just across the street and shopping up the street. The worst was the price of room service breakfast 45 euros for coffee, a mini croissant and 2 rolls.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL!!!”
Reviews.Author: travelenvy76
Reviews.Content: Redeemed my room on points so can't weigh in price, however, this is a Great hotel! Service was excellent, both at the front desk and the concierge. Hotel is beautiful and the room was enormous and beautifully appointed. I can't imagine how someone would be disappointed with their stay. Less than a 5 min walk to the subway and within walking distance to the many major sites. My only complaint is that the girl at the front desk gave us the hard sell on a "special" room which turned out to be the Westin Workout Room - not my idea of a romantic getaway - the room has wood floors and all sorts of exercise equipment.

Reviews.Title: “Quite as expected”
Reviews.Author: imagine71
Reviews.Content: I attended a conference that took place at the hotel and I have to admit that I'm a bit biased against the location. Personally I think there are many better locations in Rome than Via Veneto, which I consider not very charming and in no way conveying the real athmosphere of Rome, meaning I probably would not have chosen the hotel due to it's location had it not been for convenience. That said Via Veneto is definitely a central location and absolutely the opposite of a bad area. The hotel itself was besically just as expected. High quality rooms - though nothing special at all, friendly and efficient staff - though with a kind of "we are such a great hotel you should be thankful for staying here" attitude and all the services you would expect from a Westin. Food at the hotel restaurant unfortunately was really sub-par, but there are many nice choices in Rome and within walking distance. Overall I probably would not chose to stay at the Westin again because I believe there a much nicer hotels in areas that I prefer, which also offer much - and I really mean much - better value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Experience”
Reviews.Author: fiftiesgirll
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Westin Excelsior for 4 nights in early August, 2009. I wanted to stay at a grand Italian hotel. It was a mixed experience. The lobby certainly lived up to my expectations and I had no complaint about our room. We stayed in the basic room and it was very comfortable. I was worried in particular about the size of hotel rooms in Rome but the room was more than adequate. When you walked in, there was a small hallway with a closet to hang clothes in that also had a set of drawers. The main room had an extremely comfortable, large king sized bed with soft sheets. There was a windsor chair and a table and a desk and chair. In the closet, there was also a safe which we always like to have in the room. The bathroom was huge and beautiful and featured two sinks, a glass shower stall, a bath (no jacuzzi) and a toilet and bidet. Also, having read other reviews on Trip Advisor about the noise in the hotel, I had requested a quiet room and they put us on the top floor in an inner courtyard. There was no view but it was absolutely silent. The air condiitioning also worked perfectly However, the halls were so scuffed and marked up and the carpets so frayed, that the hallways looked like a 2 star. Worse, was the service. The first night we asked the concierge for a dinner recommendation and he sent us to a restaurant that was a complete rip off. Without going into details, we had been in Italy for 11 days by this time and the way the owner was all over us, placing things we hadn't ordered in front of us and intimating that they were giving us complementary tastings and then, when questioned, admitted they were charging exorbitant prices for them, all led us to the conclusion that the concierge must be getting a kickback from this place. As well, when we approached the concierge about what to wear to the Vatican, he gave us the wrong information, which fortunately we ignored. My dress was too bare but I brought a sweater in case, even though they said I did not need one. They were also very curt and rude to me whenever I called the front desk for anything, including a wake up call. As I said, we had been in Italy 11 days when we came to Rome. Up to that point, we had stayed in upscale boutique hotels and resorts and had had wonderful, personal service with excellent dining and sightseeing tips. As well, the hotels we had stayed in previously were more mixed with respect to their clientele, more of a European, American mix. Even the rooms, equally comfortable to this hotel's rooms, had a European charm. This hotel, although it had comfortable rooms as stated, could have been a Westin anywhere. If you want assured, impersonal, American style comfort, this is the place. There are no suprises. It was worth the 240 or so euros we paid per night but certainly not the 350 euros which is the usual rate. It is not a special, luxurious hotel. And , next time we will risk staying in a smaller room, at a more authentic hotel. Last thing, the breakfast buffet is 42 euros per person and the room service menu is equally expensive. However, we stood at the bar at the Cafe Paris across the street and had a croissant and a cappuccino each for about 6 euros. Be careful not to take a table or the same breakfast will be about 20 euros each.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel- could be better”
Reviews.Author: abrunot
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three night in two rooms with a connecting door which created a nice suite. Rooms we large with a terrific terrace. The hotel is beautiful and the rooms are nicely appointed and quite large. The four of us could have stayed in a single room. However, simple things were not done. If a light bulb burns out change it, Both rooms had bulbs out. The tile in the shower was showing some mold. Someone left a map(free ones given out the the concierge) on a table outside the elevator. It was there for two days? The concierge recommended a restaurant after I complained that many in the tourist areas were not very good. He agreed and sent us to one in a charming hidden street. Look great, but was closed? Its a nice hotel in a nice area but lacks an attention to detail.

Reviews.Title: “Old style luxury.”
Reviews.Author: seedling
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very grand. The shared areas of it are beautiful. The rooms, however, were not up to the same standard and could do with updating - new carpets, fresh paint etc. The beds were good though - you can see why they are a Westin trademark. We did have a great view of the Via Veneto from the room which was good, although even with the curtains and the windows shut it was incredibly loud. The staff in this hotel were friendly and polite, although we didn't deal with them much. They would always greet you as you walked through the reception. One tip I would give is only stay in this hotel if you have plenty of money, as it's in an expensive area of Rome. A room service continental breakfast for 2 was more than 80 euros, and even the nearby bars would charge 15-20 euros for 2 beers. Although it was a good experience staying here, I wouldn't bother again - I'd go for somewhere more modern.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION & GREAT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: TRAVELSALOT522
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel many times. It is in a quiet location and on the famed Via Veneto. Close to Spanish Steps. Taxis at corner. Luxury at a price. Somewhat tired hotel. Good staff. Terrific bathrooms and exercise room. Pricey food.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but a bit overpriced”
Reviews.Author: divetravler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a very good location. Within walking distance to the Spanish Steps and several other significant areas depending on your fitness level. It's true the hotel is beginning to show its age in some areas. The carpet in our room needed to be replaced and the furniture could use some updating but the bed, linens and bathroom were very nice. Anything purchased through the hotel or additional services were very expensive. Internet was 16 e per day and room service was more than double the price of nearby restaurants. They wanted to charge me 70 e per day for parking! I asked if there were any other options or garages near by and was told no. (I understand they want you to spend $ at the hotel but seriously...) I managed to find a garage two blocks away for 17 e per day. The staff were generally very nice and helpful. Housekeeping was okay, they did not clean our room one day and depending on who was doing the cleaning it was either 'cleaned' or the bed was made. The indoor pool, sauna and steam room were included with the room rate and we enjoyed them in the evening. Overall I would stay here again but only if I were able to use Starwood points or a sale rate. The hotel is nice and I don't think you'll be sorry you stayed here but expect a few flaws.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay somewhere else next time”
Reviews.Author: clovejoy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Excelsior for 3 nights while in rome and were not impressed. The charge top dollar and we thought it was way over-priced and over-rated. The hotel staff was slow and not overly helpful in getting things done as requested. The hotel is in the nicer, quieter part of town, which is great if you are there on business, but if you are in rome to see the sites you have at least a mile walk before reaching anything of significance. I would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Aging, a bit dirty, but convenient”
Reviews.Author: IslandLifeGuam
Reviews.Content: The hotel probably was very nice in its prime, but is in need of some updating. One indication is that after evening showers, the kids feet became instantly dirty again after walking on the carpet. Rooms are roomy and have classic decors. The bathroom was large, but also suffered a little bit from lack of bleach (or maybe the plumbing was/is old). The staff appeared a little haughty and arrogant, except if the wife made inquiries ... for her they bent over backwards :) In-house restaurant a little pricey for its offerings.

Reviews.Title: “Very Quiet, Very Pleased (Updated)”
Reviews.Author: dsweet
Reviews.Content: This review has been updated to correct erroneous star ratings. I have requested removal of the original review. I had some concern about staying at the Westin Excelsior after reading the reviews. I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. We arrived at the hotel at 8:30 am. The room originally planned for us (top floor, street view) was not yet ready, but the hotel was able to immediately check us into a top floor courtyard view room. We found the room to be spacious and VERY quiet. Quiet hotel rooms are not easy to find in Rome, a city known for noise. Nevertheless, our room had sound dampening wall coverings, and doors tight enough that a person sleeping in bed could not hear the shower going in the bathroom. No observable street or hallway noise whatsoever. This dramatically contrasts with my experience at other Via Veneto hotels, including the Marriot and the Majestic. Carpets were clean, as was the bathroom. The hotel supplied real bedsheets instead of the horrible duvets most European hotels use. Real facecloths were also available. Service requests were responded very quickly. For example, we arrived on a Sunday, and I had a business meeting on Monday. My suit needed pressing, but the sign in the hotel room (as in all Rome hotel rooms) stated that no iron was provided because local law prohibited them. The hotel service directory stated that pressing service was available in the daytime Monday to Saturday, but not Sunday. A call to Service Express resulted in an iron and ironing board brought to our room by Housekeeping in less than 3 minutes. The housekeeper even offered to do the pressing for me. We did not eat lunch or dinner at the hotel (there are far too many wonderful Rome restaurants to eat hotel food), but as breakfast was included (after direct negotiation with the hotel at time of booking), we did have the breakfast buffet. The breakfast buffet, while expensive if not included, may well be the best in Rome. Omlettes, eggs, american bacon, italian sausage, yoghurt, cereal, waffles, pancakes, smoked salmon, all types of breads, pastries and cakes - the buffet had it all. The food was terrific. The lobby is dramatic and quite beautiful. We would absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “5 star.”
Reviews.Author: redesdale66
Reviews.Content: on my second stay at this hotel in 3 months. i'm a demanding guest and was happy to return. the excelsior is a proper deluxe 5 star in the traditional sense, not a dusty/quasi-5star with a fancy old name like most of the hotels on via veneto. it's traditional elegance might not be for everyone, i usually go for modern design hotels, but there's just something cozy about staying at a swanky old grand hotel sometimes. the rooms are huge, not just for italy, but big by any standard. high ceilings, nice linen, big formal marble bath with dressing room (not a suite im describing, just a regular deluxe room). don't be afraid to settle for an interior view room if it means a bigger space - the courtyard view is nice and bright, and some of the in-facing rooms are vast. food & bev are expensive, of course. many reviewers here expressing shock at this, what they would expect at a hotel in this category? don't eat at the hotel, leave the minibar, what can you say? it's rome, plenty to eat & drink outside the hotel.. or, stay in and eat, and prepare to pay for the 5 star environment. concierge service is good - they can be very useful at getting you (last minute) into certain advance reservations-only museums & galleries. Last week the presidents of both the U.S.A. and China, their families and delegations stayed there.. so i'm comfortable recommending the staff as professional.

Reviews.Title: “terrible service, very unfriendly staff at the reception, business center”
Reviews.Author: Maximilian72
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a lovelly hotel, so you have found a great place. But be aware, the service is really bad. The staff is really unhelpfull and unfriendly.

Reviews.Title: “Uhmmm like a Palace - Regin Lagaac”
Reviews.Author: reginlagaac
Reviews.Content: Very convenient and staffs are hospitable and friendly. with indoor pool and healthclub with technogym equipment and free weights. knowledgeable and enterprising staff, services are ready to reserve even the most difficult tables in town, connect you with hotel services, recommend a nightspot for entertainment or find just the right city tour. Nearby local attractions.... i don't want to mention but you will be surprised! Regin Lagaac, United Kingdom

Reviews.Title: “Resting on their past glory”
Reviews.Author: stonefree
Reviews.Content: The hotel has beautiful public rooms, but the guest rooms are tired and need a renovation. The staff is snobby and 30 Euros per person for a continental room service breakfast is crazy. Great location on the Via Veneto. Small indoor pool and small fitness center. Difinitely not worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best..”
Reviews.Author: Snuffles3
Reviews.Content: The room was pretty amazing with the high ceilings and decor. But for a Westin, I wouldn't say I was super impressed. The rooms do need a bit of a renovation, and the staff were not that efficient and friendly. DO NOT take their recommendations for dinner as the one they suggested for us was a major tourist trap! Restaurant pricing was 5 times more than usual, and the entire place was full of tourists. Go to a local place by just walking around and looking at the menus and people. I'd say find another place if you're going to spend this much $ on a nice room!

Reviews.Title: “The Excelsior is fading - perhaps along with Westin”
Reviews.Author: LouisSullivan
Reviews.Content: The Excelsior has a great location in central Rome near the Villa Borghese, and is a grand old structure. But the service, while attentive, is hotel chain variety, although there are some good exceptions at the concirge, restaurant and desk. The physical elements of the hotel are the worst -- and slipping badly, carpet is worn and dirty, bath tub had mold and a damaged ceiling, the A/c didnt work well, the pool would be a very nice amenity but is was also dirty and needing repairs -- --easy fixes that Westin is obviously ignoring- at the cost of letting top name of the Excelsior decline. IF you can get a very good rate it might be worth a stay, but only if.

Reviews.Title: “Tutto bene !”
Reviews.Author: SheilaKentucky
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Excelsior Rome June 5th -8th. We could not have been happier. The lobby has gleaming , shiny marble and opulent chandeliers.I did not think it looked tired at all. It was old world charm to me. Mariarita checked us in. She was WONDERFUL ! She greeted us with a smile and gave us a free upgrade as we had hoped for. We got a 2 room suite, one with a huge living/sitting area with Bang-Olefson TV and 3 windows overlooking the fashionable Via Veneto. The bedroom was separate and with the heavenly bed. The bathroom was all marble. The windows were soundproof and we did not hear the street noise at all. But whenever we were in the room we turned the A/C off and drank in the view of one of the world's most fashionable streets dotted with cafes, good looking people, and Versace. I don't know , who would NOT enjoy that. But everybody is different. We had a free lunch in our plan and had it at the side walk cafe at Doney..the H club. Breakfast was included daily in our rate. We also got the 4th night free plan , so at 489 euros per night, that was great ! The Concierge staff was magnifico ! Esp Paolo. Hi Paolo ! He made us great reservations at nice restaurants in walking distances. It was great ! I highly recommend him to anyone travelling there.He was so helpful. We had a tour of Pompeii and Capri on 2 days. I used VIATOR and toursitaly.com. I highly recommend them. They were very efficient and the tour was well organized. Now , a WORD of CAUTION. This has nothing to do with the hotel. It is about pickpockets. I am posting it here , since so many people use this site. We were well alert and I had my purse laying flat across me, with one hand on it. My husband carried his money in the front pocket. NO CC or wallets. We had taken the taxi from the train station to the hotel on the 1st day. The driver spoke good english and was suave.When we arrived he pointed to the meter and said 25. So we got out and gave him a 20 and a 5. Then he said 5 extra for the luggage. So we looked thru my purse and my husband looked into his pockets. When we looked up he was holding a 10 and a 5 ...this puzzled us but we did not think about it and gave him the 10 that he now needed. Later, when we were in the room my husband suddenly said, when the taxi driver got into the car he looked thru his billfold, pulled out a 10 and put it in his pocket. My husband saw that and was surprised. Only then we figured out what he had done. He had ingeniously pickpocketed us ! While we were fumbling thru our purses he had put away our 20 and got out the 10 from his pocket! Con artist ! I told the front desk but what could they do? But do look at the cab number on the side and report it to them. This I learned later. Anyway for the rest of the trip, I announced the money aloud as I handed it to the person. This was a great scam. I hope everyone benefits from this incident.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, but..”
Reviews.Author: SuzanneNewOrleans
Reviews.Content: Grand hotel in a prime location. Overall, we were pleased with our room as it was quite comfortable and roomy with a lovely marble bath. However, the guest rooms and public spaces are in need of some refurbishing as we found the carpets to be stained and walls in the hallways scuffed up. Some of the furnishings were tired, as well. With that being said, we would definitely return to the Excelsior or recommend this property to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing for a Westin”
Reviews.Author: MariuMontreal
Reviews.Content: The actual experience at the Rome Excelsior paled in comparison to the brochure's vivid photos of a once grand and luxurious hotel. It is obviously past its prime and in need of sprucing up. The bed however, was up to the usual Westin standard. The Via Veneto location is beautiful and within quick walking distance to the Villa Borghese park, which provides a welcome respite from the noise of the city. After a 5 night business stay , we moved to a 4 star hotel (also overrated) but which was far more reasonable for the leisure portion of our stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A Variable experience”
Reviews.Author: BusyBeeWeybridge
Reviews.Content: Stayed in May over a 4 day weekend (Bank Holiday). Tried using my Starwood Gold card to get an upgrade, but unless you're related to Gianluca's uncle through a second cousin, forget it, this is Italy and Starwood should be under no illusions they can enforce any other standards! Room was shabby in an Italian baroque style, not what I had in mind, not what the pictures indicate and with red all over the walls, it's difficult not to "see red" The lobby a massive, cold unused space had little to commend it but was overtaken by the European Energy Ministers, who had a conference over 2 days of our stay. Housekeeping when they respond are the best thing going for this place. Despite chasing, they do have plugs (don't expect standard European to work here) and they did make up our bed into a king size. The concierge: what can I say, here's my best advice. Only ask for a restaurant recommendation if you can afford to pay €200 per meal. Any extras: The only 5 star quality to this hotel is their exhorbitant prices: whether it be breakfast, €30 for a continental! (seriously we're talking bread and coffee, no extras), to the internet service (although I guess they are like all hotels on this one), to the bar. And finally, some marketing spiel describes this hotel as having been refurbished with Marble bathrooms..... Ever heard of composite resin? Having worked in the industry I can reliably inform you it is plastic, occasionally bearing some resemblance to marble, but let's not kid ourselves, it's plastic and that sums up my view of this hotel, a pretty mediocre, low quality, man made experience

Reviews.Title: “Much Better Than Expected!”
Reviews.Author: scottca075
Reviews.Content: I am still trying to pump up my Starwood points, but based on my last couple of Westin experiences I was hesitant to book here. I am not sure if it was low expectaions or what, but I couldn't have been happier. The staff was very attentive and helpful. My room was larger than what I have come to expect in many Italian hotels and very well appointed. They have also added a great fitness area since my last visit. I was very happy and I will be back here for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great service great location great rooms”
Reviews.Author: emankin
Reviews.Content: As a family of four, the staff was most gracious and accommodating. We moved from one room to another without running into any problems, the folks had our room ready early, and the concierge was always helpful with suggestions -- like how to take the bus to Campo Da Fieri (sp). Also, there isn't any other Roman hotel with a pool like the Excelsior's. Not the largest in the world, but all very elegant.

Reviews.Title: “Better than Expected”
Reviews.Author: 77Man
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Westin Excelsior during Easter week. Experience was much better than expected versus reviews that I had read here. Upgraded to a very large room (albeit with interior courtyard view) as SPG Gold member. Very good fitness center with swimming pool, locker rooms, saunas, etc. Dinner at restaurant was one of the best meals we ate in Rome (and no more expensive than mediocre, tourist-oriented restaurants nearby). It's also in a nice, upscale neighborhood (across the street from the American Embassy, 3 blocks from a very large park,, 5-6 blocks to the Spanish Steps). There is also a cab stand right next to the hotel. Overall I'd rate this as above average versus the typical Starwood/Marriott property in Europe, especially after factoring in the location/neighborhood. Occupancy seemed very low, though.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but pretty run down”
Reviews.Author: MEEStockholm
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin Excellcior. In general, it is pretty run down. Old carpets and curtains. My TV did not work one week. The remote next week. Rooms are ok, but not more. No problems with noise, but I am a heavy sleeper. Staff is ok, but I would expect more. I ate breakfast the first day, and it was amazing. Then I found out it was not included in the room and cost 30 EUR. It was good, but not 30 EUR good. If you are in the neighborhood, try to find the restaurant Papa Baccus, only a couple of blocks away. They have really good food, at very reasonable prices. Another good thing to know, the city of Rome has a 40 EUR price maximum for a ride from and to the airport. There are also large signs at taxi line in the airport stating this. But every taxi driver I had (8 of them) tried to charge more. Not until I threatened to call the police I got the right price (and I did not tip). The trick they use is to turn the meter on, and hope you dont know there is a maximum. Then they point at the meter when you it is time to pay. Don't fall for the trick.

Reviews.Title: “Westin says this hotel has AC - but beware.”
Reviews.Author: HoustonTexasMom
Reviews.Content: My husband, son and I just spent 3 nights at the Excelsior in Rome. The room as quite large with a balcony. However - it proved to be extremely uncomfortable because there was no AC and no fan. When we inquired about this - the hotel told us that the AC is only operative in the summer. Our room was hot and extremely stuffy - since no air was circulating. We had to leave the door to the balcony open. This was a nightmare since our room faced the Via Veneto -- the music and noise from the bars and restaurants kept us up until 1 or 2 every night. I'm sorry - but a hotel does not have AC if it's not on when I stay there. Westin needs to be more truthful in its description of this property.

Reviews.Title: “My daughter says”
Reviews.Author: Family_Of_4_From_MA
Reviews.Content: We were a little nervous about staying at this hotel based on the other reviews. Other travelers have said it was pricey. However, as a SPG member, we really wanted to stay in a starwoods hotel. We looked at the Starwood Hotel hoptions (Sheraton, Westin, St Regis, etc) and decided to take the plunge, even though it was a little more expensive. As US travelers, we were worried about how the Dollar would stand against the Euro. We found a great deal by going on the Westin's own website and paid less than $200 per night for our gorgeous deluxe room on the 6th floor. From the moment we stepped in the hotel, we were pampered. They took our bags and whisked us in. This was probably because the hotel elevators were so small, getting all 5 of us plus our bags in the elevator would of been impossible! The hotel was beautifully decorated and VERY spacious (more so than many rooms in the US). Our room was probably 3 - 4x as big as the rooms in an city (no exaggeration). Because we were on the top floor, the ceilings were so high that you could of easily added another room above us. Plus there was a balcony, a LARGE walk-in closest, and a bathroom that could of easily fit my whole family. My 5 year old and 8 year old kids were very pleased with the location and service. The only downside was that the pool was a little on the small side. However, you don't go to Rome to go swimming in the pool anyway, right? The hotel is very close to the Spanish Steps (especially if you know the short cuts) and a beautful park (about 3 blocks away) that houses a museum and a zoo. If you have children, this is great, especially after traveling the streets of Rome all day. It is also about 3 blocks away from "the Bone Church." I don't know how else to describe it except for saying that YOU HAVE TO GO. We were also right next door to the US Embassay. What a relief!!!! As someone that brought small kids, I would recommend this hotel, especially given its location. Everything is in walking distance in Rome. We walked everywhere. Yes, my 8 year old and 5 yr old walked to the Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, and the Pantheon all in the same day and didn't complain. Just be sure to stop for Gelatos!!! We also walked to the Vatican, the Colesseum, and other major attractions from our hotel. If walking isn't your thing, there is a subway stop about 3 blocks from the hotel (down the hill, yes, the hotel sits atop a steep and winding hill) RIGHT IN FRONT OF THE BONE CHURCH!. My last bit of advice, bring a water bottle and take advantage of all of the free fountains that give out free, cold water. You would be a fool to continue to buy bottled water or even soda every day. Soda, especially in a restaurant, can cost you uo to 5 euros a day (now think about that in US dollars). The cheapest we found a can of Coke was in a supermarket for .70 cents/euros. Long story short, we are already anxious to go back to Rome and plan to stay at the same place. It was well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Old Hotel, Lackluster Service”
Reviews.Author: LuxuryTraveler42
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin Excelsior in Rome for four nights on points, my husband and I are both Starwood Gold. When we arrived prior to check in, the front desk staff were extremely welcoming. We were pleased to receive the SPG room upgrade since it was not a busy weekend, as well. The hotel is in a great location, walkable to the Spanish Steps and many central points in Rome, with a Metro stop quite closeby. However, the location is better than the hotel itself. While the building has a gorgeous exterior and historic interior, it is definitely an old hotel and in need of some upgrades. The rooms are pretty, decor is traditional european and looks like it's received good care since being redone in the past 10 years, but if you're looking for a modern hotel, this isn't it. We had a problem with the ventilation system in March - the cool air hadn't been turned on for the season, hence any ventilation that you got was heat being pumped into your room. Our room was on the sixth floor and got very warm and stuffy without any ventilation, so we were forced to sleep with the french doors open, which resulted in bug bites every night - not fun and not what you'd expect from a top hotel. Our second big surprise was the concierge, they were very brusk, bordering on rude (we never saw a woman at the concierge desk, all men during our visit). I agree with everyone who says they were treated like an inconvenience while asking about routine things in a respectable way. The hotel was noticeably empty when we were there, yet they still acted like this. We achieved the dinner reservations that we wanted, but it was an unpleasant chore every time. Additionally, when we arrived at 4:00 and asked where we could get a casual snack (sandwich, etc), they directed us across the street where a sandwich was 25 Euro, said that was the only place open at that time of day. We knew better and walked around the block, only to find a coffee shop with tons of sandwiches and light food within 100 yards of the hotel. Were they not aware of this, or trying to send our business to the most expensive tourist trap in town? They gym was pretty good. On basement level, so no windows, but a decent number of new machines with TV's, so quite comfortable. The pool was small but very nice and the pool room was relaxing and pretty, I brought a book down and read one evening. The spa services offered seemed extraordinarily expensive (as did the room service, by the way) and the setup seemed like an afterthought - treatment rooms were right next to the treadmills, in the hallway next to the pool entrance, etc. With two other Starwood hotels within a half mile, we would definitely explore the Hotel Eden and St. Regis next time. If we'd paid cash instead of points, I think that all three would have been almost the exact same price. There is also a Marriott right next door on Via Veneto. Happy travels!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Westin Excelsior”
Reviews.Author: mefandjef
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin Excelsior from Feb. 15th through Feb.21st. We booked on points for the first four nights recieved the fifth night "free" and used points for a lesser sixth night rate. We arrived quite early after a long flight. The hotel was fully booked the previous night due to Valentine's weekend; so, i did not expect an early check in time. From the time we arrived at the front door, the staff was wonderful! We were warmly greeted by all. Lauren took care of our check-in and made sure we relaxed with a pot of cofee in the stunning lounge of the palazzo while they readied or room for our early arrival. She also let us know that we had an upgraded room which looked out on the Via Venetto. The room had a lovely balcony, crytsal chandeliers and was very large. The marbled bath with deep soaking tub was clean and lovely as well. She welcomed us like we were family! All the concierges were friendly and helpful as well. We felt welcomed and well cared for the whole week. The staff at this hotel made our stay in Rome a delight. Is it an expensive hotel? Yes. However, the hotel did send food coupons via email with our reservation confirmation. We did not eat in the hotel since we spent the week touring the sights: thus, we ony had a pot of coffee in the morning. There is also a small market two blocks around the corner of the hotel for anything you might want or need while touring about Rome. Loved the hotel and the staff!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Craigtown
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel over valentines weekend during our visit to Rome to watch the Irish rugby team take on Italy in the six nations. On arrival I was told that our request for an early check in had been granted, which I was impressed with as it was big rugby weekend and the check in staff told us the hotel had been full on the previous night. Our room was cosy and nicely decorated and although it was overlooking a side street, we could still look out onto the Via Veneto to our left from the balcony. My wife wanted to rest for a while, so I took the opportunity to check out the pool. Located in the basement, the pool and gym seems to have been created as an after thought, but it was quiet and I had the place to myself, so it did not matter that it was very small and compact. Other people have mentioned that the staff aren't the most customer service orientated and I would say that this is true to a certain extent. We had done our reserach and knew where we wanted to go and what to see so we didn't really need the staff's help, but what interaction we did have did not overly impress me. There was nothing seriously wrong with the service received, it was just that the staff didn't seem overly interested. After returning home from dinner we decided to have a drink in the bar and found that the Irish and Italian rugby teams had been in the hotel for their after match dinner. The G7 leaders had also had meetings in the ball room the day before, so obviously the hotel books some high end clients and functions, but 18 Euro for a beer and a coke in the lobby bar was a bit steep. On the last morning I used the hotel's business centre to check in for our flights and print off our boarding cards and found it to be good value at 3 Euro for the 15 mins I used. This included free colour printing and use of the telephone to book our car to the airport. I found the business centre to be one of the best that I have used on our recent travels. The hotel is situated in a nice location and is a short walk to most attractions. We chose to walk to the nearby metro stop and made our way to the Colleseum before walking past some of the major attractions on our route north and back to the hotel. Our deal included breakfast, which is not always included with other hotel rates and my advice to those who do not have breakfast included is to steer clear of the hotel. At 32 Euro per person for a continental and 42 for a cooked breakfast the hotel have vastly overpriced the food that they offer. I would imagine that in the summer it would be nice to enjoy breakfast on the street terrace overlooking the Via Veneto, but compared to the breakfasts I have eaten at other 5 star hotel around the world the Westin comes a poor second. There are several places on the Via Veneto who offer a superior breakfast at a lower price. For us the breakfast was included in the rate and was perfectly acceptable, but as an add on to your rate I would avoid. Overall this was a nice hotel in a good location and provided us with a welcoming base from which to explore the beauties of Rome. There are certain issues with staff, but nothing that would be likely to make your stay an unpleasant experience. The positives outweigh the negatives on this one and I would be most likely to stay here again given the chance .

Reviews.Title: “Loved it again”
Reviews.Author: Conbeck
Reviews.Content: The best hotel in Roma. Best service and the rooms are fabulous. Also a great location to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel in The Big City”
Reviews.Author: TravelJunke
Reviews.Content: Had a great time in Rome. The hotel is in a great location, just removed from all the chaos that is Rome. A short walk and you're at the TOP of the spanish steps. Service was lovely. We had an amazing suite. We parked down the street at a garage for much cheaper than the 48 euros they wanted. For an old hotel, they've managed to keep it up. Also had the breakfast buffet one morning. Very American with an omelette station and eggs, bacon, potatoes and sausage. Fine by me. Not for the budget traveler at 42 euros per person for full access to the buffet, otherwise limited to continental at 30 euros. Fine hotel and highly recommended. I personally think its a great location. The trevi fountain, the spanish steps, and the monuments are a short walk. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Happy There is a Westin in Town!”
Reviews.Author: docoliver
Reviews.Content: I am so happy that there is a Westin in Rome! I came to the Westin after not being able to tolerate the rock hard bed and the lack of internet access in the room at the Albergo del Senato Hotel. The Westing is 5-star in all regards. I have no complaints. The Hotel is in Via Veneto which is a very upscale area of town. The have a Heavenly Gym with pool, Sauna and Turkish bath which is good in order not to gain so much weight with all the good food that you eat in Rome in places like Dal Bolognese. The heavenly bed is priceless. Would definitely stay here when back in Rome. Also there is a nice Bar (Italian for Cafeteria) going to the right in front of the hotel and a right at the second block which has an awesome breakfast and the best eggplant ever at lunch time. Ask for this "bar" at the concierge desk.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice”
Reviews.Author: bcaha
Reviews.Content: We used Starwood points to stay at the Westin for 3 nights. We had two rooms, both were beautiful. At first I was worried about noise because the rooms were both facing the main street in front of the hotel, but it did not turn out to be a problem. The rooms and bathrooms were both clean and comfortable. We did have a little problem with the heating in one room one of the nights, but other than that the stay was perfect. In terms of location, we walked much of the time and when we were too tired, we took cabs. Several people had told me to stay "close" to the Spanish steps. I'm glad I didn't listen to them, it is too congested there. The concierge took excellent care of our dinner reservations (arranged prior to our stay) and also gave us good directions when we were walking to various destinations. We ate breakfast in the hotel one morning, when we wanted eggs. The other mornings we wandered down the street for croissants and coffee, there were several places to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms - Not Best Location - Expensive”
Reviews.Author: avjwc
Reviews.Content: I used my starwood points to stay here for 4 nights. The hotel room is very nice, with lots of marble, very clean and updated. The gym with pool is also a nice feature. You can get free fruit from the gym. There is a Despar supermarket two blocks away. It is hard to find though so ask the front desk. Ask the front desk to make a reservation for the Villa Borghese. Only downside about the hotel is the price and the location. It is not that close anything but since Rome is so small, you can still walk to the Spanish steps, Trevi fountain and the Villa Borghese from the hotel. The metro and bus system is great in Rome. Get a ROME PASS which includes unlimited rides on the metro and bus for 3 days. Also no one ever checked for tickets on the buses.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded my expectations!”
Reviews.Author: jadbow
Reviews.Content: Of all the hotels we stayed at in Italy, this was the best. This is definitley the best Starwoods property we stayed at in Europe. The location is great, next to the US Embassy and within a short cab ride to any attraction in the old city. The hotel is 5 star all the way. Rooms are HUGE and elegant. The breakfast buffet is fabulous. The front desk people are great and concierge helpful. The concierge directed us to the best little restaurant we found in Italy. It is near the Spanish Steps and is called Restaurante 34. Ask for Renzo, the best waiter in all of Italy. They also have a nice indoor pool for the kids. Strongly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “NO CAN DO attitude”
Reviews.Author: KBLDUB
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Excelsior for two nights in September. I have never heard as many "can't do that" or "sorry can not help" from 5 star hotel staff. The lobby is permanently ocupied by five men standing around doing nothing and totally unwilling to help. One day it was raing heavily and a staff member was using a hotel umbrealla, he refused to loan me his umbrealla so my family had to go out in the rain while he kep his umbrella planted in a flower pot! Rooms are dirty, carpets are tacky and uncomfortable, bathrooms need a lot of money spent on them. Location is great and the pool is very nice, but go elsewhere, there are better hotles around for this price. Service levels need a dramatic overhaul

Reviews.Title: “WOW”
Reviews.Author: Chris-and-Gail
Reviews.Content: What a hotel. The rooms and bath are very large and well appointed. We had a king bed and added a temporary single bed for our son and still had lots of space. A superior hotel in every way. The service was tremendous and the concierge desk very helpful We liked the location-walk to Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain and lots of shopping. Excellent resteraunts nearby. We hired a car to take us to the vatican and received an excellent mini tour as well. The pool is the indoor type and small, but the exercise facilities were excellent. Our son said "it was the nicest place we ever stayed" Given how we loved being in Rome, he may be right.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Grand Old World Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TransCon1
Reviews.Content: We had two rooms on Starwood Starpoints on a stopover in Rome. I don't know how I would feel if I had to pay dollars, but I was well pleased with the property. The rooms were beatiful with upholsteried walls, marble baths and large rooms. The hotel felt very historic and old world in an authentic way. The staff was friendly and warm -- particulaly towards our 7 month old son. When I went to pick up the rental car, I came back to find the two doormen, passing him back and forth and brining out toys for him. The Italians really love kids. We got a nice crib with wonderful bedding along with a Westin Kids kit with a hat, and backpack and tub toys. The hotel was central to everywhere we wanted to go either by taxi or by foot. Meals at the hotel were very very expensive, but we had no problems finding places out to eat. Remember that an american breakfast is not something the Italians do, so its mainly put on for tourists and priced accordingly.

Reviews.Title: “Westin Excelsior Hotel Room in a bad shape”
Reviews.Author: techfundoo
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel from 31st Aug for 2 nights, hotel is nice, looks very heritage, the via veneto on which the Westin is located is very good located. But unfortunately I wasn't very happy with the hotel, my room had some problems: 1. Main door Handle was broken. 2. Bathroom couldn't be closed, it was faulty. 3. Lightings had problem in the bathroom. 4. No Wi-fi in the room 5. The carpet was in awful shape i.e. it was smelly, dirty, had stains all over it. All the systems related to tech were extremely dated. The other problem is that we booked 2 rooms, and we got Starwood points only for one room, I have written them 2 emails, for the past 3 days, no response. The hotel itself is okay to stay in, but is over priced compared with the room and related services.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay to End Our Italian Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Hoyas2000
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here on our last night in Italy. After two weeks of traveling through Italy and 5 other hotels, this was a WONDERFUL way to end our honeymoon. The service was second to none and the accomodations were wonderful. I can see why some say it needs a few updates, but the needed updates do not take away from the stay. The balcony offered a wonderful view and the location is perfect if you are coming in by train. You can very easily walk to the Spanish Steps or Villa Borgehse from this hotel within 10 minutes. We HIGHLY recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Westin Excelsior Needs Major Updating”
Reviews.Author: LaDolceVitaNYC
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from The Westin Excelsior in Rome. I would not recommend to stay here, it is in major need of updating. We were really disappointed in the condition of the room, the carpets were stained, the bottom sheet was a tiny flat sheet that as soon as you got into the bed exposed you to the bare mattress which I find extremely unsanitary and the walls and ceilings were dirty. And they also neglected to do a turn down service one of the nights we were there. As Starwood Preferred guests, I asked about an upgrade and though they said that none were available, I saw that on specific rooms they were labeled Starwood Preferred Guest Rooms, yet we were not given these rooms. I did notice that they are doing renovations down certain hallways, so maybe it will improve, but, if you are planning to go to Rome soon, I would not stay here when there are so many other places to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “Underrated on TripAdvisor”
Reviews.Author: Overseez
Reviews.Content: I agree with many of the reservations of other reviewers--no ice machines, expensive room service for just ok food--but there are many good things about the Excelsior. While many hotels are cramped, even some of the luxury models in and around this one, the Excelsior is grand and welcoming. The rooms are generous. Our bathroom had a double head shower, bath, bidet and two sinks. Plus, a proper height shaving mirror (a rarity in most hotels). The bed was very comfortable, the flat screen TV had lots of English offerings, and the maid service (twice daily) was super efficient. A major plus: The window opened wide! The spa, with a nice swimming pool, Turkish steam and dry sauna, was very welcome after a long hot day of seeing the sights. Our view (behind the Via Veneto) was pleasant enough. Having stayed in other areas in Rome the only downside is that the Veneto is so darn tony, everything is ridiculously expensive (e.g., a 1 Euro bottle of water in a bar is 2, a 3 Euro beer in Trastavere will be 6 Euro on the VV, etc.) and the quality is not any different. I really like the comfort and location but it will set you back a few bucks and if it's just a dollar value then you can probably do better elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but its time has passed”
Reviews.Author: adragonne
Reviews.Content: To start our 2-week stay in Italy we decided to open with style and staying at this legendary hotel, a wish I had since the first time I went to Rome. Overall, it was an Ok experience but not as impressive as I expected. The room was nice, big and lavishly decorated but the hotel looks a little bit tired. Elevator is so tiny and unable to service the amount of guests. Service is OK but not exceptional, we kept asking for a trendy restaurant and the concierge kept sending us to touristy places that did not comply with our requests. We found the places ourselves. Location is fine, not ideal in a city that has so many places to see. We found uncomfortable to share the hotel (big indeed) with delegates attending the FAO congress, we had to zig zag our way through press and strong security. Someone told us it is the norm for the hotel. I liked the experience but there are far better places to stay in Rome. Would not return.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels in Rome”
Reviews.Author: The-Mystic-Bunnies
Reviews.Content: Don't know why this place is not in the Top 10; very nice, clean, comfortable and with classy appointments. Had private tours set up to Pompeii and Amalfi Coast....everything accessible by train. Florence, Venice and Lake Como all wonderful! Lived in Italy for over one year, trust us, this is a very nice hotel compared to other "5 stars" throughout Italy. Don't eat at the restaurants that border the big tourist sites....take a walk and venture into the backstreets! Roman cuisine is numero uno - ask for it! Email us if you want the tour guide's contact info....ex Carabineri, very nice, trustworthy, professional and speaks fluent English.

Reviews.Title: “Old "Grand Luxe" European Hotel, with all that that implies”
Reviews.Author: iamzorba
Reviews.Content: Years ago while in the Army I would walk past the Excelsior -- at the time reputed to be the best hotel in rome -- and hope that someday I could afford to stay there, with all the royalty and Via Veneto jet setters. Well, I finally did -- and wished I hadn't. Oh, it was a well-maintained, recently renovated, stately old dowager of a hotel -- but that also was the problem. I guess I am too American-- I like a hotel that has ice machines, a soda machine on each floor, bright bedside lamps for reading in bed, plenty of towels, a bathtub you can get out of without killing yourself, and so on. A nice view would have helped. But, my room had none of these. This is one of those hotels where you have to call the concierge downstairs for anything and everything and they will dispatch a porter -- with his hand out. The hotel's restaurant was only average. My room overlooked an interior courtyard and, like most Italian hotels, had shutters over the windows. Of course, the location on Via Veneto was nice. This is a very pricey place, of course, and when you figure in the weak dollar, the prices are outrageous. Next time, I'll stay at a Hilton or Holiday Inn.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: redmanfloridapvb
Reviews.Content: Arrived early 10:00 A M room was ready,. Staff was exceptional. I was visiting friends and needed flowers and some wine to bring as gifts The concierge arranged for everything in about a hour.This hotel is still a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Rome for the first time, WOW!!!”
Reviews.Author: harleynort
Reviews.Content: The Westin Excelsior is a beautiful hotel and seems to be very well cared for. It was very clean, food was good and the staff was very accommodating. We had some language problems, but that's our fault not theirs. Convention facilities were very adequate and the location of the hotel was great. We had an all expenses paid experience, but I'm not sure I would have paid the normal rack rate in other circumstances. Everything was very pricey. We certainly would recommend this hotel to others and would probably stay here again with some fierce negotiating on price.

Reviews.Title: “A Trip Back into Time”
Reviews.Author: Coolnite
Reviews.Content: Booked for buy two nights and get a third free. Was told by Starwood that it would be on a 4pm hold on the day of my checking in. As we decided to extend out stay in Florence, we called Starwood and cancelled the reservation, received my cancellation number. I then booked a night’s stay at the hotel, as the hotel’s website rate was better than what SPG could offer. Got to Rome and was told that I had two bookings; they told me they would sort it out. Came back later that night and was angry when told that the internet booking was cancelled and that 2 nights was chargeable. The room was like Jurassic park revisited. Rooms are Deluxe, but OLD. The toilet and the décor reminded me of my grandparent’s living room. Had a dank smell, AC didn’t work. Same thing applies to the staff at the front desk. This guy kept checking out the girls that walked by when talking to me. Should have given him my dad’s Andy Williams CD.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: notme_nancy
Reviews.Content: The Westin Excelsior Rome is in a great central location in the residental district of Rome. The rooms are nice, but could use a bit of remodeling. Mirrors were stained and baseboards needed some cleaning. Our room, on the fourth floor overlooked the entrance to the hotel and at night the music from the restaurant below was annoying. Que Sera Sera is not one of my favorite songs and was played nightly and loud!!! The hotel was quiet after 11 pm. Staff was friendly. Inexpensive food in a couple of small shops two blocks behind the hotel. Also, if you want some inexpensive fruit, wine or snacks, go into the subway station at the end of the street.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and comfortable beds”
Reviews.Author: TravelerTooTallTerry
Reviews.Content: While visiting Rome for the first time from the USA, we really had a great time at the Westin. The first day, we arrived and had them bring us coffee in the room- it was expensive- 24 Euros, but it was wheeled in on a beautiful, table-clothed cart with nice china and steamed milk. It was delicious and brought within 10 minutes. The staff was very friendly and helpful in finding our way to wherever we wanted. They had washcloths--something the other two hotels didn't have. The beds were very comfortable. We had a big room with two small queens and 3 ladies- so we asked them to bring a rollaway. Even the rollaway was very comfortable with the wonderful comforters on bottom and top. The pillows were great too. The very best part of the Westin for me was the spa! The lady who runs it is a tall attractive lady who was the most gracious person we encounted in Italy. The lady who gave me the massage was very skilled and really worked out the kinks I told her about. After so much walking the day before, the foot rub was especially appreciated. It was expensive to have it in the room, but felt so very luxurious and I could have napped afterwards, but it actually energized me for the rest of the day.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, definitely not great!”
Reviews.Author: AMKQatar
Reviews.Content: Just returned from honeymoon in Italy. We stayed at the Westin Excelsior for 5 nights at a Deluxe Room. Prior to our arrival, I sent the hotel an email informing them that it is our honeymoon. They assigned us to a Red deluxe room, and sent champagne and strawberries. Before our arrival to Rome, I was soo excited regarding our stay at the Excelsior. However, it all faded out once we were there. Signs of wear and tear and clearly visible everywhere in the hotel and i had problem justifying to myself the amount of money I'd paid to stay there, espcially when comparing it to other REAL 5 star hotels! The room itself is nice but it looked much better in pictures! and there was nothing heavenly about the heavenly bed! Marriott/RItz/4seasons/Luxury Collection all have better beds! The staff were OK. I agree with reviewers who said that they lacked warmth but i think that was normal taking into account the type of guests they have! Location is so-and-so. Nothing spectacular about Via Veneto itself. There were some cafes and restaurants, but they were overpriced and (lifeless). Spanish steps and Fontana di Trevi are 20 min walk which was OK since the weather was nice. Other places will need a taxi or metro. Two things that I found not excusable at this kind of hotel: 1- A/C in the room was very, very,very noisy! 2- One of the reciptionists had difficulty communicating in English!

Reviews.Title: “Our palace in Rome”
Reviews.Author: bimbabrazil
Reviews.Content: I just arrived from a vacation of 25 days in Europe with my husband and kids, 7 and 14, and the days we spent in the Westin Rome were fabulous because we stayed for free, we used our starponts and they upgraded us to a very bug 2 roons suite that my sun called our palace, we loved it

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with a pool....”
Reviews.Author: allatseaSouthampton
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Westin for four nights over Christmas 2007. We'd booked a '4 nights for 3' directly over the internet with the hotel. The trip didn't start well as we got fleeced by a dodgy cab that picked us up from the railway station - charged too much, and then with a sleight of hand pocketed one note and claimed we hadn't given him enough! Everything improved after that though - we had a (green) Grand Luxe room with a balcony, which, although it was starting to look a little tired, had everything we needed, and the bed was amazingly comfortable. The bathroom didn't have a separate shower and bath as other reviewers have mentioned, but the shower was great, and the bath was a good size.
