Room service turned up on our second evening with a birthday cake and bottle of sparkling wine - we'd mentioned on our booking form that we were celebrating my 40th birthday, but hadn't asked for anything, so that was a nice touch. We didn't eat in the hotel at all - both the restauarant and room service appeared quite expensive, and we preferred the option of seeking out smaller local cafes and restauarants as we wandered around, none of which disappointed, although those closer to the 'sights' were definitely not such good value for money as those slightly more off the beaten track. The concierge desk were very helpful in recommending and organising tours and meals, and we found them to be more friendly than the receptionists. The pool/ jacuzzi area is well presented and the steam room is great - all well received when you've been pounding the cobbled streets of Rome all day! The hotel is a bit of a trek from some places, but other than the Vatican, we walked everywhere - nowhere was much more than a 20 min walk.... Although we probably would stay somewhere different next time just for variety's sake, we had an enjoyable stay, with no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel....”
Reviews.Author: Chicagohoneymooners
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Excelsior in May 2007 while on our honeymoon and absolutely loved it! We stayed in a non smoking newly renovated grand luxe room, the room had lovely furnishings modern amenities like a flat screen TV and a marble bathroom with a separate shower/bath. The only complaint I have with the room is there were a lot of marks on the walls, but this wasn't a big deal as other than the marks the room was very clean. Our room had a large balcony and was very spacious compared to other hotel rooms in Europe that I've stayed in. We didn't have any problems with our room smelling of smoke like previous reviewers. The hotel is in a good location, it's a pleasant short walk to the Spanish Steps and nearby shopping areas. We loved the nearby Villa Borghese which is very romantic if you're looking at this hotel for a honeymoon. The restaurants near and located in the hotel are very pricey but had delicious food. The local area also felt very safe. The staff were incredibly friendly, the check in staff were a delight and spoke English well. The hotel had left champagne, strawberries and a note from the manager congratulating us on our recent marriage, which was a lovely welcome. I'll definitely be staying at this hotel next time I visit Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, decent location”
Reviews.Author: Wakky_J
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Westin Excelsior 30 Oct-3 Nov. We stayed on SPG points. The hotel was very nice and the room and bathroom were nicely decorated. It had all the amenities one would expect. Note: there was no clock radio, coffee maker or iron in the room. Wake-up calls always worked. Concierge staff were helpful the few times we had requests. They were very formal though so don't expect warmth. Our first night in Rome we went to Galleria Borghese and when we got out it was pouring rain. You know when its raining so hard it hits the pavement and comes back up again and causes immediate flooding? That kind of rain. Of course we couldn't get a cab no matter what we tried so we decided we might as well walk the 10ish minutes back to the hotel. Despite rain jacket and umbrella we were both soaked by the time we reached the hotel. The doorman backed away from us like we had the plague and when the concierge saw us he quickly looked away. I'm not sure if our sodden sight offended them or they were trying to save us the embarrassment of being seen in such a shameful state. I still can't decide if I'm mostly annoyed or amused - some of both I suppose. I found the location to be so-so. Quite close to Trevi Fountain and Spanish Steps and a metro station. But everything beyond that is a 20+ minute walk or a cab ride. I enjoy a walk but after more than 12 hours of pounding the pavement it would be nice not to have to walk even further to get back to the hotel. Fortunately the cabs were very reasonable. If you are going to the Colosseum or the Vatican it doesn't matter as you will need the metro or cab to get there anyway but all other areas are near each other but not so near us. Plus the area around the hotel has no character or charm in my opinion. If I went again I would stay in the Piazza Navona area or for character in Trastevere. I almost did that this time but since we had points for Westin, well you can't argue with free as my husband says. In summary, a fine hotel - clean and well kept in a decent but not great location for our needs.

Reviews.Title: “A true Roman classic.”
Reviews.Author: J_and_A_1
Reviews.Content: We visited Rome for the first time five years ago and considered staying at the St. Regis Grand again because we enjoyed it so much and thought it was an outstanding property. We ended up at the Excelsior because we wanted our second visit to be a little different and the Excelsior has a pool which the Grand does not. We were a little concerned about our choice since the reviews on this site have been mixed, but after our stay, I think we would come back here over the Grand. This conclusion is not based on our luck at getting a major upgrade to a very large corner suite. The suite was amazing, very well appointed and in great shape. No frayed edges here. The bathroom was equally grand with separate shower and tub. I had a chance to walk around the hotel during maid service in the mornings and got to glance in many rooms. All looked in good shape and appeared to be good size or better. The only negative I could see is that the Deluxe room bathrooms have not been remodeled like the Grand Luxe bathrooms, so they have older looking marble in colors that may not appeal to all. As for the rest of the hotel, it is grand, imperial, and overall does not come across as one of those grand old hotels that has seen its best days. Especially impressive is the spa area. Clearly renovated in the last couple of years, this area of the hotel is a standout. The gym is nice, with a fair amount of equipment and good lighting. The indoor pool was wonderful and is located in a great setting. The pool area also includes a spa, steam room, showers, and bathroom. These areas have a nice new modern look and are a fun change from the rest of the style of the hotel. The locker rooms also have a new modern look. We did not have breakfast included with our room, so we only had breakfast once in the hotel. The dining room used for breakfast has also been redone in a more modern décor. We passed on the 42 euro buffet and ordered a-la-carte off the menu and had a nice breakfast for two for under 30 euros. We walked to the St. Regis Grand for sentimental reasons, and it might be a little grander and more elegant, but not by much. Given the Excelsior’s better location and spa, I think if we went back to Rome we would stay at the Excelsior again. Our only compliant is that we know this hotel is a Westin but given the grandeur and prices at this location it would have been nice to have toiletries from a high end designer instead of Westin’s personal brand. Overall, we were more than happy with our accommodations in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go”
Reviews.Author: Megswa
Reviews.Content: The facade is beautiful, the location is ok, while the room was decent it STUNK of cigarette smoke (although it was a non-smoking room). The worst part was the staff – they were AWFUL!!! I have never encountered a hotel staff this rude!! During my entire stay the only staff member who was nice was the woman at the desk in the fitness center. NOT recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, ok hotel”
Reviews.Author: anna78
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights, during a business trip. This hotel is part of Starwood's luxury collection. It has a nice facade, but the hotel is pretty old and hasnt had a major facelift in a while, although the rooms are updated with flat screen TV's. The hotel is conveniently located in the very center of the city - so its easy to walk around. That being said, I think there are nicer hotels in the area that are in the same price range (that also have the charm of the orginal facade but are completely renovated and more modern on the inside). The restuarant at this hotel is also really expensive - the breakfast is 42 euros, and even the place across the street is very expensive (5 euros for a banana!)

Reviews.Title: “Elegance on our honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: seattle_maslow
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for the first five nights of our honeymoon and this hotel exceeded our expectations. I'm currently an SPG Platinum member and was upgraded to a HUGE room despite the fact that we used points to book the stay. This room may have been the largest hotel room I've ever had, with soaring ceilings and a very large bathroom. We found the service to be impeccable, with one small blemish: we had emailed the concierge to make four dinner reservations and he missed one, but said it was confirmed nonetheless, so we wasted a trip to the restaurant only to be turned away. That aside, we enjoyed great service throughout--room service in particular was the fastest I've ever experienced--a breakfast omelette came within 10 minutes. Yes, a glass of juice is 9 euros. If you don't want to pay that, you can get one in the cafe across the street for 3 euros. I especially appreciated the well-equipped gym and spa to stave off the damage of pasta and pastries. The machines were all very modern and well-maintained, with an impressive collection of weight-lifting options. Some of the guidebooks say that Via Veneto is past its prime, but we didn't feel that way at all. Further, it's a short walk to the Trevi Fountain and the Spanish Steps, so location-wise, it's excellent. Further, there is a taxi stand next to the hotel, which we used several times a day. I'm not sure I would ever pay full rack rate for this hotel, but it's easily worth $500/night, given the cost of hotels in Rome. If you have a chance to stay here, you won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: “The Excellsior lived up to it's reputation”
Reviews.Author: lanerikeel
Reviews.Content: Everyone that has ever been to Rome twice, has said they missed staying at the Excelsior the second time. They tried to save money. Compared to other areas, it is the most luxurious place and location, at a reasonable price, for a five star place. The free breakfast is a must if you can get it - otherwise the buffet is $40 each. Also, the "bar" has an outside sitting area with a fabulous lunch - and at the right price. Besides that, don't the Westin name get you down - this is Rome's most historical hotel. It's a must - once in a lifetime - if you visit Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cupcake333
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel and location...Large well appointed rooms and beautiful lobby (Reception is attractive though) Nice indoor pool.

Reviews.Title: “Stuffy and Overrated”
Reviews.Author: Rinkman
Reviews.Content: As other travelers have suggested this hotel did not live up to expectations for me. The staff "was stuffy"/"snooty"....(Sorry I dont have better words at this time.) The location while "pretty", is not convient to anything unless you have even more money than it takes to stay here. Staying at 5 different places in Italy over 17 days this place was by far the most difficult to find anything great to say. Not that anything was overly bad....just wasnt worth staying there for even 1/2 of what I paid. The Westin here should take some lessons from the people at the E and R in Venice..

Reviews.Title: “Decadently Luxurious”
Reviews.Author: givemesunshine
Reviews.Content: We arrived at this hotel in the middle of the night from Africa desperately graving luxury and this hotel did not disappoint. Since we were the only people in the lobby, we got great and friendly service and were promptly taken to our rooms. We are a family of four and at this hotel only two people were allowed in a room so we had booked two adjoining Deluxe rooms. Between the rooms was a large beautiful living room with a desk, sofa and plenty of space for a nice meal at the hotel. The rooms were very opulent with damask walls, empire furniture, large chandeliers, velvet chairs and marble bathrooms. One of the bedrooms had blue walls and the other had bright red walls. The quality of room service food was great. I had one of the best penne all'arrabiatas ever. The portions were huge and the hotel had a special kids room service menu. Even though this hotel is pretty central it is not in the shopping district, which has many restaurants and more action. For adults the walk there is not an issue (it is maybe 1/2 mile), but with young kids it was not convenient. Overall this is a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Overall Nice Experience”
Reviews.Author: mdski
Reviews.Content: Just stayed with family and had very nice experience. The location is quite convenient. Breakfast is excellent, rooms are quite elegant, staff is accomodating, and the pool is quite refreshing after a day of touring Rome. If you can stay here at a reasonable price compared to other five star Rome hotels, I would consider it especially with children.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: pepper99
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with our stay at the Westin Excelsior. Unlike other reviewers, we found the staff generally pleasant and helpful, especially the concierge. There is a very nice fitness center and pool and the business center is open 24 hours. I agree that the lack of irons in the room was a drag but that was minor. The location on the Via Veneto was ideal for some of the major sights in Rome, especially the Trevi Fountain, the Pantheon and the Borghese Gallery. The only real disappointment was the prices of breakfast in the restaurant on sight. We ordered two cappuccinos and the price was 8 euros each! Since we were a family of four, breakfast at the hotel was out of the question. Other than that, we would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Rome without Italian atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: pophammy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin Excelsior in a 3rd floor Grande Luxe Room. We booked on the hotel web site and as SPG gold members we had hoped for an upgrade and a late check out but sadly nothing was offered! The hotel is well located to experience the “Dolce Vita”, being in the middle of the Via Veneto. The Grande Luxe Room itself was large and classically elegant in décor, almost Louis XIV in style. However it seemed a little bare, lacking a bit of furniture and was not really what you would describe as “luxurious”. We had an extra bed in the room for our daughter but she did not like it as it was more like a camp bed and not very comfortable. Our bed was large and comfortable though and so she spent most nights trying to sneak into our bed! The bathroom was nice and spacious, if a little dark and decorated in dark, red marble with double sinks and a separate shower. There are no facilities in the room to make tea or coffee, something us Brits we would definitely have appreciated. We tried to connect to the WiFi in the room. It cost 13 Euro and is run by “Linkem” but the system they use just could not be made to work, a problem we’ve had before in Westin Hotels. Our room was on the side of the hotel and despite being away from the main road it was still quite noisy from early on but you can’t expect much else in a city. The breakfasts in the Café Doney were very good but make sure you book a breakfast inclusive rate otherwise they are very pricy. We only ate dinner once in the Hotel’s restaurant, there is only one, the Doney. Although beautifully presented it lacks Italian ambiance. It does have a nice bar, the Gran Café Doney, opening onto the Via Veneto and we found that a nice place to go to people watch and enjoy “happy hour” cocktails and free canapés from 5 to 7 pm. The Excelsior’s cocktail bar in the hotel was comfy and never busy. The bar tender seemed desperate for some one to order a fancy cocktail to allow him to display his skills. The public rooms in the hotel generally were nice if somewhat underused. The existence of a swimming pool was an important part of our decision making process in deciding to stay here. It was invariably quiet, the décor classically Romanesque but it did have some scary looking electrics. Bare wires beside water never look good, even if they were in the process of doing a repair. All in all the hotel was just lacking something to make it special. I think it starts with the reception area which is just too cold and bare. There is no flow between the bars and lounges and the foyer. The best hotels feel welcoming and this is usually based on a nice central area where you can meet people or just sit and watch the world go by. There is no specific criticism of this Hotel but I doubt we would stay there again. Near to the Hotel there was some nice Italian fare to be had. Try La Giara around the corner where the food is more traditional and run by a lovely couple. Not big on speaking English but that was half the fun. On the Via Veneto itself, The Café Veneto opposite the hotel was not as good as Café Doney and rather overpriced for what we had. We only had drinks in the Café de Paris and Harry’s Bar which are both nearby. In the 1950’s these were very much the centre of life in Rome but are nothing special these days. The Café Roma was our favourite for snacks and Cappuccinos, it is on the corner just before you get to the Hotel if you are walking back from the shopping areas. Worth noting as 5 o’clock approaches is the fact that you can often buy a bottle of Frascati or Pinot Grigio cheaper than a beer and a coke! Nearby the Ristorante Ciao Bella may sound tacky but was better than any of the more famous ones further up the Via Veneto. Away from the hotel we enjoyed most of the big sights such as the Trevi fountain and Spanish Steps which are only 10 minute walk from the Hotel. Even further a field is of course tourist attraction number one, the Colosseum. Do not go to the Colosseum without first buying a ticket at the tourist offices or via the concierge the day before! The queues are horrendous at the gate, it can be over two hours wait, but if you have your ticket you can just go to the left of the queue, labelled ‘groups’ and go past all the tours and straight through. The tours seemed rushed and most people were not even listening. Go round slowly and sit down and just imagine the history. Sadly we found that you get excellent mobile phone reception in the middle of the Colosseum! There are no food/drink stalls inside the Colosseum or the Forum and very few toilets either, so be prepared. Piazza Navona is a good spot for a lunch and feels more Roman. We went to the Vatican which, like most of Rome, has poor signposting and unhelpful staff. We made the mistake of thinking the Sistine Chapel was at St Peter’s Basilica. It is not, but nobody tells you it is in the Vatican museum which is up a hill, half a mile away! It is very busy and crowded there. Everything about the Vatican appears commercialised and geared to making money which we found rather surprising. Be prepared for a long walk inside the Museum with no sign posting or food/beverage outlets, although there are lots of “stalls” selling books, pictures and souvenirs!

Reviews.Title: “No Better Way to Experience Rome!”
Reviews.Author: Monkey714
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Rome---what a great European city!! I was there for a corporate event 8/5-11, so room reservations were handled by our corporate travel agency. I had previously stayed here in 1998 before it became a Westin property, so was curious to see what changes may have taken place. If you've stayed at Westin properties, you won't be disappointed! The Excelsior retains it's authentic Roman flair from the 50's-60's yet has the modern conveniences we've come to expect in the States. The rooms are very well decorated, very ornate, and the bathrooms are very nice with lots of Italian marble. Maid service was very good, but be sure to lock your door or hang your DND sign on the door if you sleep late. Maid service was at 8am, and they just knocked and came right in! Only complaint I have is that you can not get an iron in your room. If your clothes are wrinkled, you must call and have them ironed for you at $6.20 Euros, which is close to $10 US per item! My advice---take a travel iron. Beds are very comfortable and the TV is a large plasma with multiple channels from across Europe. Dispite previous articles on TA, I thought the hotel employees were very nice, especially the maid service. Concierge is good at recommending restaurants. I took a Frommers guide, and they recommend eating elsewhere from Via Veneto as prices are high. They were right. Food is good but pricey. Go a few blocks in any direction and you'll save money and have a good meal. The hotel bar is nice, but a little small. The bar tenders are very nice, but drink prices are expensive, but I guess that is to be expected. Probably similar to a hotel in New York or San Francisco. The hotel is just a short 10 minute walk to the Spanish Steps, which leads to multiple other Roman site-seeing attractions. We never needed a cab, but they are readily available at the hotel if you need one. You can exchange dollars/Euros at the hotel, but they charge a 5% surcharge. Overall the hotel is very good. It is about a 25-30 minute trip from the airport. Beware---the Rome airport is horrible with getting your luggage to the carousel. It was front page news about the horrible service from the baggage handlers. We had to wait almost 30 minutes, and several of our traveling companions had to wait 1-2 days for their's to be delivered to the hotel. I suggest packing a few days clothes and bathroom items in a carry-on just in case. Enjoy Rome---it is a great city, very safe, and a wonderful way to spend a Summer vacation in Europe! Feel free to e-mail me if you have any questions. Ciao!!

Reviews.Title: “OK Hotel, not a luxury experience”
Reviews.Author: snapps
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 night before a cruise. The room was clean, and was a decent size. The shower was a "rain shower head" that didn't work well, hardly any pressure. I read other reviews regarding the concierge service. I agree with the reviews which found the service to be lacking. The one time we asked the concierge for help finding a monument in the city, he circled the wrong spot on the map. (Michaelangel's statue of Moses) He had the right church, but the wrong location. Cost us about 1/2hr in looking for it. Our room included breakfast. The breakfast is large and excellent. Location- about a 5 minute walk to the subway. 10-15 minute walk to Trevi fountain or spanish steps. It is right next to the American Embassy.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: samanjp
Reviews.Content: This is easily one of the best hotels that I have stayed at anywhere. The staff was wonderful and the rooms were beautiful. The concierge was very helpful, he tracked down the tour service that forgot to pick us up and was hard to get in touch with and made sure that we had alternate reservations. Of course, this is a concierge's job, but the ones at this hotel were extremely nice and made us feel safe after a disorienting expierience. The hotel is in a good location, walking distance to the spanish steps and right by nice resteraunts. The rooms were beautiful and big and the hotel is also beautiful. I could not recommend it more.

Reviews.Title: “WEstin Excelsior - good location”
Reviews.Author: skclkc
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a nice location. The area is very upscale. We stayed at this hotel for one night with a points award. This is a good use of points since rooms in Rome are very expensive. The front desk staff was helpful but the concierge was pretty snooty. If I were purchasing a room- I would stay elsewhere due to the cost. We had friends staying at the Sofitel just around the corner and were very impressed. The rooms and appointments looked brand new there. The Excelsior rooms were pretty but they showed some definite wear. This was a pre-cruise brief stay so it worked out just fine for a points award.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Place”
Reviews.Author: RichardWeybridge
Reviews.Content: Probably the worst hotel EVER....Just checked in for two nights; if the City wasn't full I'd check out immediately. The staff are uninterested, unhelpful; they just don't care. Very small rooms despite a high room rate, mini bar virtually empty so everything has to be ordered, bad decoration....and miles away from reception. I'm due to move onto the Westin, Milan but will be sure to try and change that reservation...... Best avoid this place is you expect anything better than a 3 start hotel....

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Place to Stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: kissel
Reviews.Content: Although we only had one night in Rome as we concluded our honeymoon, the Excelsior was a fantastic choice. Using Starwood points, we were ungraded to a spectacular suite, which included an oval living room and four balconies. The hotel is well situated within a short walk to the Spanish Steps and a short cab ride from the train station. It's a shame that we didn't have more time to appreciate this fabulous hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great location and service”
Reviews.Author: equipmentmanager
Reviews.Content: The Westin Excelsior is a wonderful, convenient, but pricey place to spend a few days in Rome. Our room, which was one of the less expensive ones, faced a "courtyard " but the room itself was huge. It must have been recently redecorated, as it was lovely. My daughter was sick and I remained inside for two and a half days, but the staff was very solicitous, made up our room at our convenience, called an excellent doctor, and made arrangements for a wonderful guide to the Vatican. My only quibble is that the tv station selection left something to be desired in both languages, and room service was outrageously expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected...”
Reviews.Author: BigTipper
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin in mid-May, 2007. Overall, we found the staff and accomodations very good. Going in, I had rather low expectations, after reading several reviews, but I found the actual experience better than what I had prepared myself for. I only booked this hotel as I was using Starwood points. When we checked in, we were early (noon), and the front desk said that they showed us as a couple, not 3 persons (our 19-year old daughter was with us). They quickly said "No problem" and said that there would be a 45 Euro/day charge for a cot. The call centre at Starwood had warned me about this charge when I booked, so I was ready for that. They got us into a large room that accomodated the cot, and all of our luggage, easily. I was surprised that we got into our room early, but it was great as we needed to freshen up after being on the plane all night. With a few exceptions, our experience was top notch. The only things that were a little negative were the following: - Lack of facecloths: not a popular item in Europe, it didn't surprise me, except that on the 2nd day of our 3 day stay, we actually DID receive facecloths (No, not the little towels by the bidet, but real facecloths). We did not have them when we checked in, nor on the 3rd day of our stay. - The 45 Euro/day charge for the cot. Even though I knew about the charge before I arrived, I feel it is ridiculous. Nickle and diming guests and Starwood members is not professional. The darn cot didn't even cost the hotel what we paid to use it for 3 nights. - Charge to use the internet in the business centre was a bit of a surprise. I'm used to free business centres in North America. - Charge for minibar use (38 Euros), when we didn't touch anything, made me wonder if they were trying to rip us off, but they took it off the bill when I mentioned it, and did not argue or even look at me suspiciously, so that was fine. - Prices for food and drinks is high, even for a centrally located luxury hotel. I just about swallowed my tongue when my wife told me what the price for breakfast was. I've paid up to $25 CAN for breakfast in North America, but this worked out to something like $75 CAN for bacon and eggs. WOW! On the positive side: - Staff: All staff, including the concierge staff that many reviewers complain about, were great. Everyone was friendly and accomodating. - Room was large. Bathroom was huge, had two sinks, large walk-in shower, chandelier, etc. - Walk-in closet was great. Room safe was handy. - Room was in good shape and had a large LCD TV, two chandeliers, and a couple of small balconies (with table and chairs). - Pool and spa facilities are very nice, and in good shape. The jetted pool, attached to the main pool, is not heated however. - Location and neighborhood is good. The rack rate on the room was posted as 1140 Euros, which I doubt anyone has actually ever paid, but even at 500-600 Euros (which it typically goes for), I would have a hard time justifying the expense. If you could get this room for 300-350 Euros, I think you would be getting fair value.

Reviews.Title: “Nice building and location, mediocre hotel”
Reviews.Author: maxxjd
Reviews.Content: We read the reviews and new what to expect, so we were not surprised. We used points to pay for five nights in the last two weeks in May. The Hotel is beautiful (though decorated more like the 1950's grand tour of Europe style), and the area around Via Veneto was a welcome respite from the noise and crowds elsewhere in Rome. The easy access to Villa Borghese is also nice. The service though was far less than I have come to expect from a hotel of this caliber and price (and I have stayed in everything from the Red Roof Inn to the Waldorf and Plaza in NYC). The concierge service was the worst I have ever experienced. We tipped them handsomely when we had questions or requests, but they always acted as though they didn't need to be bothered with us (and although we area not fluent, we do speak some Italian and did to them). On several occasions we were told that sure, they could help us but the guy that knows about that will be back later so come try then, rather than the concierge simply taking the details to pass on. Later, it would turn out that guy would not be there until the next day. They also had a very ill-tempered manner about them. Overall, the stay was adequate, though not memorable, and I would not pay to stay there in the future....

Reviews.Title: “Classy Old Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 75north
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in an upscale area just a short walk from the Spanish Steps and numerous restaurants. It's on a very nice, tree lined street. Cabs and buses are available right around the corner. The hotel is old but beautiful. Our room was large, the marble bath was very large and well equipped. A beautiful view of the skyline of Rome from our balcony. Everything first class. The staff is helpful and they speak good English.

Reviews.Title: “Great location-poor service”
Reviews.Author: pennez
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 days--always had problems getting a washcloth and soap replacements and had to ask for them every day. Also, the concierge service was extremely snotty and hardly could be bothered with our questions. While the public areas of the facility are very nice and in a great location right next to the US Embassy, the poor service and deteriorating quality of the rooms wouldn't cause me to recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Best in Italian Elegance & Hospitality!”
Reviews.Author: RLegacy
Reviews.Content: Very impressive! A big hotel with a bed & breakfast feel. Although we had the misfortune of arriving on the day of a 1-day national labor strike, the management worked tirelessly to get us checked into a room in a timely manner. We stayed in a charming corner suite on the south east side of the hotel - not much view, but quieter than staying on the much desired Via Veneto side (rooms ending in 41-51). Our king bed was created by moving 2 full beds together, but quite comfortable in the tradition of the Westin "Heavenly Bed" (the only "true" king beds, as well as whirlpool tubs, are in the most luxurious suites). The hotel is right next door to the American Embassy, and within walking distance of the Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, high-end shopping on the Via Condotti, mid-priced shopping along the Via del Corso, great restaurants on the Via Veneto and the tallest palm tree in Rome (this 17th-century tree is still growing in the courtyard of the ultra-expensive George's Restaurant). For the active/adventurous and fitness buffs, you are close enough to the Villa Borghese and Gardens (jogging trails, racetrack, children's playgrounds), as well as neighborhood exploring around the Pantheon and the Piazza Navona. If you make it by foot to the Piazza Navona, you are now in proximity to a bridge across the River Tiber (Tevere in Italian) to Vatican City (but take a taxi back to the hotel from the Vatican as it is an uphill walk back). The hotel doesn't have any programs for children (their "Kid's Club" just means that they have the capability to provide necessary items such as cribs, guard rails, high chairs, bottles and bottle warmer, children's menu, etc.), but you can utilize the concierge to recommend great places to take your children, as well as excellent places for adults. Tip them generously, for their recommendations are excellent and priceless! The on-site restaurant provides a delightful combination of Mediterranean cuisine and Roman specialties (couldn't get enough of the extremely fresh fruit and mouth-watering lemon mousse), and you can sit at one of their sidewalk tables to people watch along the Via Veneto. Room service was quick, as well as the laundry service - just be prepared to bring your own travel iron (and converter) if you don't want to pay roughly $10 USD to have a skirt pressed. If you are a person who appreciates luxurious accommodations in the Empire and Biedermeier styles, then this is definitely the place to stay while in Rome. I highly recommend it and look forward to staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: flaming_lamborghini
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Westin Excelsior at end of April. Location was great, service was great, though some staff could have been more friendly. Room was great and totally peaceful. Only complaint was the annoying practice of charging for mini-bar items that were not actually consumed. Why do most hotels do this?

Reviews.Title: “Ornate Incompetence”
Reviews.Author: Travelpartner7
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 days April 20-23. At 6:30AM I awoke to the sounds of construction. I called the desk and they said yes, they are renovating on the floor below. Should I have been informed at check-in and given a different room??? Of course. I asked the concierge how to get to the Tomb of Cecilla Metalla, a very popular site. He said 20 minutes walk from the Circus Maximus. It's a 2 hour walk along a very dangerous road (Appia Antica). He's the concierge and doesn't really know where it is. This at the WESTIN?? An upscale hotel?? Pathetic. A friend's room on the second floor was too hot. AC not up to the task. This is the only WESTIN I have not liked. The GM should be fired. Despite a good location, I would NEVER stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “5 star? I don't think so, at least by American standards...”
Reviews.Author: bankerdavid
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Excelsior Rome two weeks ago (Apr 24-30). Truth be told, we were not all that impressed with Rome, other than the architecture and the churches (which is exactly why we went, to begin with), but almost everything else left something to be desired. Hotel: Booked our trip with Starwood points. First room was terrible-on the backside of the hotel, mediocre room. I asked for a change but hotel was booked that night, so had to sleep in this room. No clock, no iron, no coffee pot, chandelier was crooked, missing an arm-need to hire someone to update this room! They changed us the next day, but while the room was nicer, the same amenities were missing. Since there was no coffee in the room, we went downstairs to the restaurant for two cups of coffee-at 15 euros! Outrageous, as was the price of the breakfast buffet! That was 42 euros! I asked for a wakeup call the first night, and the phone rang (once) at 1am. Being used to the automated systems they use here, I picked up the phone, but got a dialtone, and without looking at my watch, we started getting ready-this was our fault due to jet lag. By the time we realized it, we were almost ready to leave, but caught our error. One other amenity was missing-when you book with Starwood Preferred, you always get a bottle of water every day in the room-just a small thing, but we hated the taste of the water. In all honesty, the staff was excellent, the hotel exteriors were beautiful and the location was great. I got pickpocketed the last day there, and the staff was very helpful to get my cards cancelled. I would call this a good hotel, but doesn't rate 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Not all that”
Reviews.Author: thankful1
Reviews.Content: I was at the Westin Excelsior April 5th to the 10th. I used starwood points, so that made me feel good. The location is great, near a lot of little stores, and about a 5-10 minute stroll to the spanish steps. If I had paid $500-600$ a night for this hotel, I would have been very upset. One would be talking $2500 for a five night stay, I personally feel it's not worth it. It has a beautiful ambiance when you walk in, but after that to me it's just nothing impressive to me. I had a nice room, with floor to ceilling windows, descent size, but again nothing to write home about. I don't know about you, but i like a room to have at least an iron it. Why do I have to pay to get something press, and then have to wait for it also. A can of soda is $8.00. One is paying enough already, when do you get a break. The bathrooms are so dim, if you have a pimple on your face you won't see it, I guess that's a good thing. Don't get me wrong it's a nice hotel, but if i had to pay for it, I would probably find anothe hotel for half the price that is more modern and fresh.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience at a Historic Palace”
Reviews.Author: CMHTraveller
Reviews.Content: Our family was in Rome for a confrence, and our original hotel, The Cavileri Hilton, was all sold out. We were able to get a distressed rate at the Excelsior, and I'm sure glad we did! This hotel has the LOCATION, SERVICE, and ROOMS that you would expect from a Westin, but so much more. The staff was always friendly, greeting us by name upon entering the hotel, and the rooms (we had a standard, about 400 sq ft). My one let down was that the view of our room was of all the other interior rooms, but who cares about that....its ROME. The restaurant on-site serves a spectacular breakfast arrangement, and the business center makes it quite easy to check e-mail. **Ask the concierge for: Santa Padre, this restaurant has no menu, but very affordable prices and FANTASTIC food. I highly reccomend this hotel to anyone travelling to Rome in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable, but over the top decor!”
Reviews.Author: GriffoBristol
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, although the rooms are well over the top. Huge Chandelier dominates the room. Good health club, small but ok pool. Steam room excellent. Bar very nice, but well expensive. Beware prices of EVERYTHING at the hotel if you are on a modest budget. We booked using starwood points, but friends stayed elsewhere nearly as nice but less than half for the room price with breakfast. Irish rugby team and wives were at this hotel with us at the same time, which may tell you something! Location very good, plenty of nice cafes and eating joints.

Reviews.Title: “Outdated, Overrated - the Dingy Westin Excelsior”
Reviews.Author: murphydoodle
Reviews.Content: This hoteld is far past its prime and in terrible need of a facelift. We stayed here with our 9 year old for 5 days in March and I am sorry that I wasted our starpoints on this hotel. It is easy to imagine that it was once a gracious hotel, but that was sometime ago. I saw 3 rooms at the hotel and they all had dirty walls, faded and stained carpets, chipped and worn furniture, and old beds. Hardly a Westin heavenly bed. The service was also atrocious. On our first night we were put in on the first floor front side of the hotel where it was terribly noisy. When I complained, I was told my bags would be moved to a quieter room the next morning. We came back to find that we had been put in a similarly noisy room, just smaller. The hotel acknowledged this, but did nothing to improve the situation. For hundreds of Euros per room per night the hotel should invest in some quiet windows. During our stay we also had problems with a leaky tub in a bathroom that was otherwise lovely, but it took hours to get a repairman to come to the room. There appears to be quite a lot in disrepair at this hotel. Our room had numerous bulbs out and some sockets not working. The hotel spa has a steam bath and hot tub, but both were out of order during our visit. Overall, this is a terribly expensive hotel that is just not worth the price. I would rank it as a low 3 star. I have not stayed in a hotel as dingy as this since I was a college student.

Reviews.Title: “Nice if you don't look too closely”
Reviews.Author: Paul71
Reviews.Content: The Westin Excelsior in Rome is a beautiful hotel but definitely is showing signs of aging. Located in a more expensive district in Rome that is somewhat far from the major attractions (Forum, Pantheon, etc...) but very close to a taxi stop, the hotel is obviously a place that once was very grand, but chipping paint, loose floor tiles, and worn furniture didn't seem to make this hotel worth the prices that are typically charged here for a room. The room itself, despite the obvious wear, was very nicely decorated and well appointed. The bathroom was large and was probably more recently renovated. The buffet breakfast in the Doney restuarant was very nice, although a bit "overpriced", which is typical from what I have seen in Westin hotels. The noise level outside of my room was a bit excessive though, especially considering the fact that the air conditioning was turned off due to the time of year, and windows had to be left open as the room was rather warm. Overall, it was a very comfortable place to stay, but I'm not sure it was worth the price unless you're getting some type of discount on the room.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful! March 14-15,07”
Reviews.Author: BSV1823
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel one night on SPG Awards. This has to be one of the best hotels I've stayed at. The staff was wonderful, the location was excellent and the hotel was gorgeous. The bathroom and the room were HUGE! Guest can use the spa for free and you must try the Turkish Sauna. If you have points and you are in Rome you MUST STAY HERE!!! A+++++

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic.”
Reviews.Author: nic1047
Reviews.Content: Fantastic. Redeemed a lifetime’s collection of Starwood points for 2 rooms in this extremely grandand oppulent 100 year old hotel. I felt a little miffed that Platinum membership only yielded the expected room upgrade and complementary gift for 1 of the 2 rooms, however, as the regular room was more than spacious and absolutely immaculate the case was put to rest.  Decor, fixtures and fittings, the large flat screen TV’s in both the suite and standard room were all of the highest standards and exceeded expectations. The double balconied living room of the 2nd floor 2 room suite could only be described as palatial. Front desk and concierge staff all spoke excellent English and proved to be exceedingly helpful. Nearest subway station, Spagna, adjacent to Spanish steps, is a 10 minute walk, but the adjacent taxi rank was always occupied, ready and waiting. We did not sample the hotel restaurant as there were many alternatives within a stones throw. Overall the hotel was superb.

Reviews.Title: “A bit more Excelsior and less Westin...”
Reviews.Author: JennieMcMc
Reviews.Content: Great location, wonderful buidling and beautiful rooms. The Excelsior is one of Rome's grand hotels with a long history of hosting luminaries and being "the" place. Unfortunately these days it is a little too much Westin and too little Excelsior. From the horrible piped music in the bar, to the spotty concierge service, to the too American buffett breakfast, one no longer feels that one is staying in one of Europe's grand hotels. With the larger hotel chains acquiring all the classics, it would be nice if they started respecting the heritage of some of the more special venues....

Reviews.Title: “Be warned!”
Reviews.Author: mnhappywanderer
Reviews.Content: I was very disappointed in this Westin. Having stayed at many Westin hotels around the world, this was not even close to the experiences I have enjoyed at others. The food was terribly overpriced, room service was slow and the food cold. They promise your food in 30 minutes, and never made it on time. My breakfast one morning was 40 minutes late, over an hour wait, and cold. My room was an upgrade with a very large balcony, but something outside my window kept setting off alarms throughout the night. Perhaps not the hotel's fault, but nonetheless, disturbing. I found the male staff of the hotel to be rude and condescending. As a woman traveling alone, I had never had this problem before. The female staff members were very gracious, however. The heat in my room refused to turn off and it required two calls to housekeeping to have it repaired. The internet service was very difficult to connect to, and refused to send my e-mails. The bathroom was very nice, huge shower and somewhat large tub. The room was well-decorated, but I don't pay that kind of money for a pretty room. The hotel was in a terrible location, on the Via Vinetto, which meant all the surrounding restaurants were way overpriced, and far, far away from any of the sights, i.e. Vatican, Coliseum, etc. I will not stay at this hotel again, nor will I recommend it to my friends. Be warned!

Reviews.Title: “Good experience”
Reviews.Author: HEJ1949
Reviews.Content: This combines all the very best elements of both a top American hotel and a top Italian Hotel. The large lobby / bar area is luxuriously and elegantly furnished, yet very comfortable with friendly staff. Bar ,and breakfast / lunch restaurant excellent. Rooms are exquisitely furnished, spotlessly clean and quiet. Staff could not be more friendly or efficient. All in all a fantastic place to stay in Rome! Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Extra Special Excelsior!”
Reviews.Author: toodogsus
Reviews.Content: Just returned from four nights in this exquisite hotel. We were using Starwood points for the entire stay (which would have cost several thousand dollars otherwise) and checked in with a Starwood AmEx, so the front desk asked us to wait an hour so they could upgrade our room. It was well worth the wait--our room was huge, with two balonies overlooking the Via Veneto! The walls were covered in bright green padded embroidered silk, it was lit by two crystal chandeliers, and the ceiling and columns were carved and gilded. The bath was huge, with a double sink. Our friends' room was slightly smaller, but was decorated similarly (only in red silk!) and also had a balcony. The hotel has two bars, one inside that is tucked away and quiet and another with seating on the street, perfect for people-watching. The staff was extremely helpful and efficient. We loved it and can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “A very nice hotel on Via Veneto”
Reviews.Author: CousinGreg
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice, although it is a pretty good walk from the main tourist attractions. Via Veneto is one of the pricier locations for dinner, but the restaurants are pretty cool. Many of the restaurants are located on the sidewalk in glass enclosed buildings that are beautiful at night. Our room was very nice, but nothing exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “Rest Assure with the Excelsior Rome”
Reviews.Author: bonapart
Reviews.Content: This hotel remains one of Rome's grandest in every way. You must consider that most of the guests are "Starwood Preferrerd" something. It is not easy to upgrade every single guest. The hotel staff will do everything possible to make your stay memorable. The location is fabulous. The Via Veneto is an elegant avenue offering fine dining and shopping. Most attractions are in walking distance. We preferred being here and not next to the Spanish Steps, that are always so crowded. You can walk there in 5 minutes. The rooms are all different. The "Grand Deluxe" category is nicer then the "Deluxe" if available. The breakfast buffet is one of the best. If you can find an all inclusive package you will not be disappointed. Most important is the genuinely caring staff. They want you to be happy. If it is in their power to do so, they will! This is the best hotel in Rome. Families are welcome. If you have any doubts, contact the hotel directly, before you reserve!

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay here at the rack rate”
Reviews.Author: Fredddie
Reviews.Content: I stayed for one night on a recent business trip and can generally recommend the hotel for this purpose. Certainly the hotel has a grand feel about it and the front desk staff were extremely professional, but I agree with an earlier comment that the communal spaces did feel a little cold. The room was extremely well appointed and breakfast arrived BANG on time. If I wanted to be highly critical, I could point out that when I called down for toothpaste (which is now normaly for those flying out of the UK for overnight hand baggage only stays, even if BA now give you steel knives and forks again!) it took several attempts to find someone to speak to and once I was connected they had run out! Also beware going for a stroll around the block as at least 6 people asked me if I wanted to go to their "gentlemans club", even if they were quite polite. DO beware the taxi scam and note that the fare sould be around €60 and if you do choose to go "independent" you can prob do better than that. I can recommend to book ahead if you arrive late to avoid standing in the queue for 1 hour as happened to a colleague. Overall, very decent but I would not pay the rack rate for a personal trip.

Reviews.Title: “our favorite hotel in italy”
Reviews.Author: jessicaandadam
Reviews.Content: rome was our last stop on our honeymoon and we could not get over how grand our room was. we loved the location and the room was so beautiful and romantic; complimentary delicious chocolates and wine, beautiful view of st. peter's basilica--we never wanted to leave!! staff were so friendly and the conceirge very helpful. we just loved it and would definately recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Better for Business than Holiday?”
Reviews.Author: GrandTourist
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over New Year 2005-06 and whilst the Hotel was very grand, and our room was very well appointed, stylish and comfortable the overall feel of the hotel is somewhat cold and formal. The public rooms are opulent but somewhat dead, though the bar is very smart. The swimming pool is small, though a rarity in Rome. A tip for visitors to Rome - beware the taxi scam from the airport. Whilst we had been warned to only use a licensed taxi the warning should really be only use a licensed white taxi, as the privately run (though licensed) one we took charged us 130 euros to the hotel. Even the hotels limo service 'only' costs 95 euros. The drivers are pretty predatory at the airport so have you wits about you and beware. The lcation is very good and if I visited on business the Excelsior would be an obvious choice. For a holiday visit next time we would look for somewhere different.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent but not Perfect”
Reviews.Author: AFA86
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was amazing and grand. However, I expected to be much more. I was a bit disapointed with the rooms and the lobby. All in all I would give it 4/5. I do recomend the St. Regis Grand Hotel though, it's afordable and service is fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice As a Backup”
Reviews.Author: EastSideKid
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights this month with family in two rooms and found the experience to be generally pleasant but found the hotel to be a good 4 star than a 5 star. Our rooms were spacious adjoining rooms on an interior courtyard, lacking a view but very quiet. The hotel is quite large and dominated, during our stay, by American visitors. The hotel features an indoor pool that our teenagers enjoyed, a decent included breakfast and a professional, if often distracted, staff. The location is a bit out of the way for most sightseeing, restaurants and shopping although close to the Villa Borghese and a subway stop. Flat screen TV's, air conditioning and other amenities worked fine. The hotel fails to capture the charm of this special city but is a reasonable option, especially for families.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in need of major upkeep!”
Reviews.Author: mw1
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Westin for 4 nights in August in a very nice room. Hotel is lovely but scratch the surface and there are some problems. One of the two small elevators was always broken-every day so only one elevator for all the guests. Main floor washrooms were beautiful but toilets always plugged up and water faucet would come off in your hand if you needed to use it. Front desk staff pleasant but concierges all short on information and very huffy. I was there alone with my daughter initially, and I noticed a big change when my husband joined us a few days later. That is not good! Breakfast was lovely and plentiful. Staff very courteous in restaurant. Do not be fooled into thinking the hotel is "at" the Spanish Steps. It is not. It is a good 15 minute walk to the steps. Not too bad going there but not so great walking back in the dark at night. The hotel says it is a 5 minute walk--everything requires conversion! Had to call maintenance several times before they got room airconditioner working properly but eventually someone came who knew what they were doing. Lovely hotel but best for someone wanting to be right on the via Veneto-not because they want proximity to Spanish Steps.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: RacingFan2006
Reviews.Content: Spent four nights at this hotel at the end of July with my wife and our two teenage kids. We took advantage of Westin’s program where the second room is ½ price for accompanying children. We could not have been more pleased with the accommodations. We had two huge connecting rooms on the 4th floor. The rooms were large, modern and had very nice furnishings including plasma TV’s. The all marble baths were very spacious. The hotel definitely has a prestigious, high end feel to it. The hotel guests consisted of business people as well as a fair amount of American tourists. Everyone (doorman, front desk, restaurant, baggage handlers, etc) was friendly. The only exception was the concierge personnel. During our 4 night stay, I had 3 separate occasions to ask them a question on different items. While they were professional, they were not overly accommodating. Still we enjoyed the hotel, its location and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: dmahl
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure why there are so many negative reviews about this hotel. We stayed for 7 nights - one fully paid room, one booked using starwood points. The rooms were fantastic. Beautiful decor, as spacious as most junior suites I've visited, and excellent, personal service. There were no loud nightclubs (very quiet at night). We traveled with our three young children and were given two very large adjoining rooms. I would definitely recommend the hotel. When booking, it is best to ask for the rooms without the typical red/green Italian decor.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, stuffy uppity atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: gypsygrl52
Reviews.Content: Went to the Excelsior as a first stop on our honeymoon a year ago. It's taken me a year to sober up and remember as I learned how to drink wine in Italy... The Excelsior was a pretty remarkable hotel. Beautiful and massive. The beds are so comfy. The bathrooms were gorgeous and we received a welcome bottle of wine upon our arrival. The atmosphere however is not for a young couple, we saw a lot of older more refined guests with perfectly creased khakis and faces. The drinks at the bar are a bit overpriced. The breakfast buffet in the morning is very good. The staff not so friendly but not rude either. Maybe they thought we won the lottery or something since we clearly did not fit in.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I used Starwood points for a 5-night stay during our Italian vacation, and if the room was not free, I would have been disappointed. The hotel is a hike from the nearest metro stops or any tourist sights and is apparently, in what used to be the upscale part of town, but no longer. The food and drinks in the hotel are terribly over-priced; avoid buying anything in the hotel if you can. The room was comfortable, but run-down --- dirty walls, shabby and torn carpet, etc. One redeeming feature was the concierge recommendation of Pomodorino a restaurant that is a short walk away. This place was outstanding; it was reasonably priced, great food, friendly service. Even locals were eating there which is a good hint that it is good. We ended up eating dinner there 3 nights out of our 5, and wished we had done all 5 – as the other 2 nights we ended up at pricier places packed with tourists only and rude service. I will not go back to the Westin, but I will go back to Pomodorino. If you do stay at the Westin, do not miss the Capuchin Crypt, which is between the Westin and the Barberini metro stop. Very cool display of bones/skeletons (sounds odd, and it is).

Reviews.Title: “THE EXCELSIOR STILL EXCELS”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin Excelsior in June, one of the busier months in Rome, and the lobby of the hotel was a fine example of these crowds. I have stayed at the Excelsior many times; however, this was my first visit under the ownership of Westin. The hotel still retains its Old World charm, but has lost its authentic Italian feeling to this new American ownership. On the other hand, English-speakers will love this hotel because English is almost the primary language there. A big plus is the large size of the bedrooms... contrary to the small rooms often found in European hotels. The best rooms to book are either on a high floor (to avoid street noise from Via Veneto) or facing outside onto the street (because the courtyards in middle are a horrible view to look out at). The concierge and staff are very polite, with the exception of the cashier. Most importantly, the Excelsior is located in the middle of all the tourist hot spots.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and rude consierge”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin Excelsior for 2 nights in June. During my 10 day trip to Italy, this hotel was the one that I spent the most money ($800/night) and had the highest expectations. I can't begin to tell you how disappointed I was with the experience. First of all, I could not check into my room when I arrived at 4PM. They said that a Gold or Platnium member had been in my room previously and they were given no check-out time. So an hour later I was shown my new "Fitness Room". This room was supposed to be for guests who wanted to excercise in their rooms. When I entered the room it had an excersise bike in it, with the back wall completely mirrored- not what I had expected. Other items of note included that the air conditioning was not working and a maintenance man spending 30 minutes in my room at 10PM at night trying to fix it (unsuccessfully) as well as the toilet ran all night and would not flush properly. In addition, the consierge was very rude when I asked for simple directions as well as a map. The one main positive about the Westin is its prime location on the Via Vento. I would not stay at this hotel again. It was overpriced, the room was not what I expected and the service was poor.

Reviews.Title: “Good and Bad...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice...the "Heavenly" bed was truly Heavenly... The rooms were not exactly WESTIN quality.. The A/C was a bit lacking, the noise from the street and bar below were very loud (especially) from 11pm - 2pm. The bathroom had mold and mildew in several places. Not sure it was worth the extra $$ we spent to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “gorgeous hotel!”
Reviews.Author: winsumwzl
Reviews.Content: we stayed here last summer, it was wonderful. the bathrooms were totally gorgeous. a nice breakfast was included, but since i need some time to aclimate to the new day, i just ordered coffee and a roll from room service--and they gave us a break on the room service when we checked out. it is very close to the borghese gallery, and there's a nice place for coffee just across the street. the hard rock cafe is just down the street if you need a cheeseburger fix. we are going back this summer and will stay at the excelsior again.

Reviews.Title: “Worth it”
Reviews.Author: Kentish
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a weekend break at the start of April and wasn't disappointed. Location is excellent for shopaholics and public areas of the hotel very grand. Room and bathroom large and what is expected for the price; breakfast at €42 each was steep but worth it though. Fabulous for a treat.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice!”
Reviews.Author: DBSEA
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Excelsior for 2 nights last month. We thought that the hotel was very elegant. This was a gift from a relative with their Starwood points, so it didn't cost us anything! Our room was beautifully decorated with chandeliers and very quiet, however, we had twin beds instead of the king we thought we reserved. We were exhausted (after traveling 20 hours), so we didn't make a big deal out of it. We didn't have a chance to eat in the hotel due to our tight schedule, but the restaurant and bar looked very nice. We did use the spa/hottub and found the facilites very nice. Overall, I would recommend this hotel, however, I haven't stayed anywhere else in Rome to compare. For a 5 star hotel, I found the service more comparable to 4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed w/ Room but Hotel Pretty Good”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Single woman traveling alone. This was last hotel on my itinerary before going home to Hawaii. I had stayed in 6 hotels in Italy and this was the worst one for the money. The AC did not work so I had to open the window for fresh air. There was a strange black ring around the room on the walls, near the AC vent and the AC control panel. I don't know if it was smoke or mildew. The walls were also scuffed in numerous places, and lacked artwork. The shower had mildew in the grout and calcium stains on the black tiles. The mini bar was the most expensive I had ever seen. When I was sleeping, I heard a lot of rattling or jingling sounds coming from either the AC vent or within the walls. I don't know what it was, but it was irritating although not very loud. I was put in Room Number 666, and I did feel a little spooked even though I am not very superstitious! There were several redeeming qualities, however. One was the "Heavenly Bed" which although was not the 4-post dream bed as advertised, it was the best bed I slept in during my vacation. It had special down-filled blankets and excellent sheets/pillows. Then there was a big flat screen tv and chandelier. Next was a complimentary bowl of tangerines next to the lounge chair. I was happy to find a big strong chrome hairdryer that was not attached to the bathroom wall. Finally, a large lit closet. I had a glass of wine downstairs at the bar, which included appetizer sampler of salty almonds, sweet walnuts, green olives, and 2 small crab cakes. All the while listening to live piano playing 80's American hits. The service was excellent, and breakfast was the best and largest I had in Italy. In summary, the hotel was great but my room was kind of shabby and sparsely decorated for $300 euro. I would recommend the Hotel Splendide Royale for the same price. The rooms were immaculate and had no signs of wear or tear at all.

Reviews.Title: “Lukewarm feelings for Westin Excelsior Rome”
Reviews.Author: eca5416
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin Excelsior Rome for 2 nights, April 7th-8th. While the location of the hotel is excellent and the furnishings of our room were quite beautiful, I don't think this hotel lives up to its billing. Compared to our experiences in the previous days at the Hotel Excelsior in Naples and Westin Excelsior in Florence, this hotel seemed very sub-par. The concierges were not helpful for basic requests, like weather and bus information. Their knowledge seemed limited to the very expensive amenities of the hotel and the immediate area. When we arrived in our hotel room, it had two twins rather than a king. The employee who showed us to our room promised to have that changed. Upon returning to our room several hours later, we found that we had received turndown service, but still had twin beds. We had to call housekeeping ourselves to get the issue fixed. Additional room complaints: We took extra blankets out of our close which were stained; the television in our room was not plugged into the wall; the door handle to our bathroom was loose and nearly falling off, as was the panel on the bathroom wall the flushes the toilet. The worst part of our stay was that our room was located in proximity of the nightclub or another event room. The night before our departure, we returned to our room around midnight to find that the music was so loud that we could hear the reverberations of the bass in our room, as well as the music. Since we were leaving early the next morning and were exhausted, we didn't attempt to get a room change. Instead we tried to sleep through it, which ended up being the wrong choice. I'm not sure that I would stay here again. With other Starwood offerings (I'm an SPG member) like the St. Regis and Hotel Eden nearby, I might go elsewhere. Our stay wasn't horrible, but it certainly wasn't anywhere close to my expectations, or comparable of our previous experiences with Starwood's luxury hotels in Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Westin Exelsior - Great Choice”
Reviews.Author: balimontana
Reviews.Content: The Westin Excelsior Rome is a fantastic hotel with an incredible location right on the Via Veneto. I'm Starwood SPG Platinum and they treat their Platinum guest members very well. We reserved a Junior Suite and were upgraded to a palatial and beautiful suite with a view of the Via Veneto. A bottle of champagne and a large fruit bowl were waiting upon arrival with a welcome card from the GM. I would definitely recommend breaking the budget at this hotel and spending more for a higher category room and request and upgrade at the time of booking. As with most European "grand dame" properties there are good rooms, great rooms and then horrible rooms. Be specific when reserving and request a nice room and treat the reception well and you may very well be granted with a beautiful room. The service is okay - not 5 star. It certainly does not match the quality of the suites and facilities. The Concierge staff in particular are real money grubbers and are to be avoided at all costs. They recommended a horrible trattoria filled with American tourists, mediocre overpriced food and no ambience. Obviously commissions and kick-backs are what the Concierge staff at this property are working for and not your wellbeing. Room service is extremely overpriced and to be avoided. Poor quality food and surly waiters. The dining room downstairs (can't recall the name) offers a fabulous buffet breakfast and overall excellent quality food at what passes for reasonable prices on the Via Veneto. Overall, a great hotel. If you are a Starwood Preferred Guest member looking for incredible service and a high level of luxury though the St. Regis Rome is a far superior property. However, the only caveat is that the Westin Excelsior has larger suites and more variety of suites than does the St. Regis. If you are going to book a regular room, go for the St. Regis. The service and rooms are nicer than the Westin Excelsior. However, if you are going to book a suite, the Westin Excelsior has better suites (larger and more comfortable). Too bad the service levels at the Westin Excelsior Rome do not match the luxuriousness of the suites.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent but pricey”
Reviews.Author: Walberto
Reviews.Content: Positives: My girlfriend and I spent two nights here to celebrate our birthdays (both the same day!). Her father paid for the hotel stay(a cool 725 euros). I am normally happy with a bed and bath provided both are clean as i never intend to spend alot of time in the room but my stay in the Westin Excelsior has totally raised my standards. The room was beautifully decorated, extremely comfortable and i just loved the marble bathroom. The location (Via Veneto) was also superb. Being a young couple we didn't mind walking so found getting to the attractions extremely easy as they are all within walking distance. Negatives: When we first arrived at the hotel the room was extremely hot. As this was far too uncomfortable I got the attention of a maid passing by to show me how to operate the air conditioning. She didn't speak English but as i speak a little Italian we managed to get by. She told me that the air conditioning was switched off for winter so i called reception and within 5 minutes a fan had been brought up. The next little problem was probably my fault. I left my case open on the floor and in a zipped compartment i left £40 in cash. It was not on show so without unzipping the bag you would never know it was there. I went out for one final walk before leaving for the airport and when i returned this cash had disappeared. I was literally gone half an hour and when i got back i felt that someone had been going through our stuff. I raised my concerns with reception when checking out but there was nothing they could do without delaying our departure. I wrote a letter when i returned home but never heard anything back. So just a little warning: always use the safe or carry your cash with you AND always use the "do not disturb" sign even when you are not in (unless you want your bed made!). I thoroughly enjoyed my stay here and didn't let these problems ruin it for me. If you have got plenty of cash to spare then this is the place for you!!

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Figa7
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. My sister and I booked a deluxe room but were upgraded to a suite. I don't understand how people weren't able to get help with their luggage on arrival - we arrived in a taxi and the doormen came straight over to the car - one opened the door for me while the other helped the driver with the luggage. Check-in was easy - I don't expect a major conversation with check-in staff so didn't really take any notice of personal or impersonal service - they checked us in quickly and that was all we cared about. The check-in staff were friendly and welcoming without being overbearing. Our luggage was taken up to our room for us. The suite was massive - 2 double beds and tasteful decor. Bathroom was pretty huge too - big tub and seperate shower. We had just come from the Grand in Florence where we had had a junior suite - rooms in both were typical Italian oppulence. Which I love. Room and service were definitely 5* - staff didn't disturb us once. When we passed staff in the hallways they never failed to smile and say hello - friendly but not overly-friendly - perfect. We didn't eat in the hotel as there are so many fantastic restaurants to eat in nearby so I can't comment on the food. Check-out was easy too - quick and friendly. And it was raining when we were leaving the hotel so they gave us large westin umbrellas, free of charge. Loved the hotel as it is in a great location with plenty of historical sites nearby. We took a bus tour of the city and one of the stops was right around the corner from the hotel - very convenient. Have nothing bad to say about the hotel at all.

Reviews.Title: “One of the nicest in Rome for the $s”
Reviews.Author: jimlerbs
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week at The Westin Excelsior in Rome. It is part of the Westin's Luxury Collection and there is a great package through their Welcome to Rome savings plan. At first -- $489 per night appears expensive, but when you consider that this is in dollars (not Euros), includes all taxes and service charges,and breakfast, it really is a pretty good value for the money. The excelsior is a beautiful grand old hotel but has been well maintained. We were actually there twice -- Monday through Friday, and again the following Monday, after returning from Florence and another one of The Westin Luxury Collection hotels -- The Grand. Rooms are a good size, furniture nice, and the heavenly bed and bath superb. Bathrooms are gorgous. Only issue at this time of year is that the air conditioning is not turned on, so on a warm day or night, you may need to open the balcony door. Service, breakfast, and the bar (Bar ONice) was very good. Breakfast was better than The Grand in Florence. Rooms in the front may be noisier because you are right on the Via Veneto and you can hear the music from their outdoor patio bar. We did call down and they immediately turned the outside music off. Location is great. Rome is a wonderful walking city, and you can basically walk any where from The Excelsior. The Spanish Steps are near by, and shopping and dining is plentiful. Try Santopadre on Rivio Tullio for a great home cook meal, or Girarrosto Fiorentino, which is right around the corner. If it wasn't for the lack of air conditioning at this time of year, and the the one night we stayed in a larger room but above the front bar, we would have rated it excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Good for kids”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got back (3/17) from Rome and stayed at the Westin. My wife and my kids (5,2) were very happy with our stay. The location was nice, walking distance to the the Spanish steps and Trevi fountain. The staff was very helpful and extremely tolerant of my kids especially when they were tired and whiney (something that would not be tolerated in Switzerland). The pool was exactly what we needed after a night of travel. The room needed a little touch up but otherwise nice enough and clean. The staff was very generous when we needed a late checkout. I guess the best compliment is that we will stay there again when we return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “An impersonal hotel in need of refurbishment”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a large suite for 3 nights. The room's furnishings were quite opulent,though dated. The service was impersonal at best. Housekeeping appeared twice in our room without ever bothering to knock. The elevators are tiny for the size of the hotel and so is the gym. While the hotel has all the neccessary amenities, I would not stay here if you are seeking the luxury hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: mikebush99
Reviews.Content: I was traveling for work - nonetheless I pre-read all the reviews on TripAdvisor as I had the luxury of selecting where I wanted to stay within a certain budget. I am particular about where I stay and there are certain things that I like in a hotel i.e. good safe location, so I can sightsee when I am not working, internet connnection, good gym, or close proximity to a park, good bed, room in good condition etc. This is a big hotel - and I wanted this. If you want small and intimate where everyone greets you or knows your name, then this is not the hotel for you. Nonetheless the staff were friendly - no they didn't take my bag when I arrived, but I am sure they would have if I had been struggling - they did help me to my room. The staff were helpful and friendly from the receptionist to the concierge. I always ask the concierge a lot of questions - and they were very patient and eager to help. The staff were seasoned - took their jobs seriously and were able to assist with my queries. Brought up an adaptor for my computer as soon as I called. The bed was comfortable, not really the true Westin beds you get in other Westins but close enough. I did not have a non-smoking room when I arrived (but I may have forgotten to ask for one in my reservation). So although the hotel was booked out, they kept looking until they found one for me - I hate smoking floors. I ended up with an excellent room (non-smoking) looking into the open air center of the hotel - there was scaffolding up outside the window, but honestly I wasn't there to look at the window and didn't even notice it until I went to open the window for some fresh air the second day. I like the fact the windows open. If I was a serious tourist though I might have asked to change rooms because of the scaffolding. The hotel is in a great location - not right in the touristy part, but close enough. Yes it is opulent, but most hotels in Italy are. I didn't think the hotel needed a strong refurbishment. I always notice if wallpaper is peeling and bathrooms are run down. I recently stayed at a very exclusive (5) star in Cannes, France which was a dump. The Westin's decor however may not be to everyone's liking, but you are in Italy so it seems fitting to have a bit of the opulence around and the room was in very good condition. Even the bathroom shower had the Westin showerhead and rounded shower curtain (exactly as the last Westin I stayed out in early January in Palm Springs). The elevator is small but each floor has a grand ballroom-like center in front of the staircase and elevators. I enjoyed walking up and down the great staircase everyday and actually preferred this rather than taking the elevator. The gym was excellent - I used it everyday. Some of my colleagues stayed in very exclusive boutique hotels in Rome and said they wished they had stayed at the Westin, particularly because of the gym. Would I stay here with my kids - probably not. But my children are still small, so running up and down the great staircase would probably not go over well, although Italians love children and may not have minded, other guests might have. When we come to Rome as a family - we rent an apartment so we can feed the kids at our leisure and have more room to run around. In conclusion, it is best to know exactly what you want before you book any hotel in Italy - the service in this hotel is good, not over the top, but excellent just the same. You feel like you are truly in Rome when you are in this hotel. I got what I wanted and I would certainly stay at this particular Westin again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful older hotel”
Reviews.Author: DrewInLA
Reviews.Content: The Westin Excelsior in Rome was our first stop on our Italy-France trip, and we liked it very much.
