It's an older, slightly formal, but friendly hotel with big rooms and a very friendly staff. It's also expensive. We did not eat in the hotel, but restaurants are all over the Via Veneto, and we always had good luck in them. The staff at the Excelsior was unfailingly polite and very helpful--even brought up a birthday "cake" (a large, very fancy tary/pastry) when they noticed (from our passports)it was our younger daughter's birthday! How very nice. Can you imagine another hotel doing that? Our room was very large, nicely furnished with older furnishings, a very large closet, a large bathroom. All very clean and in good shape, but clearly in need of upgrading--a bit worn on the wallpaper and trimmings. Nothing bad. Elevator is slow and small, but broad stairs are available. The building exterior is spectacular. We were just very happy with the Excelsior, although we might try a more updated hotel next time--for the high price.

Reviews.Title: “Lives up to it's 5 stars however is an impersonal place to stay”
Reviews.Author: NorfolkR
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights in early Dec05. I'd recommend this hotel for business travellers as it seems to cater for them and not really anyone else. We arrived and weren't treated with any special care as one expects when staying at a 5 star hotel. No one offered to take our luggage to our room. When we arrived at our room the new LCD tv system wasn't working however one phone call later and a staff member came up and reset it. I don't know what is is about these new large LCD tv screens in hotel rooms these days however most I've come across seem to exacerbate poor tv reception to the point where your eyes start to strain. The staff are helpful when you make requests. The first day we were in Rome it absolutely bucketed down. When we arrived back to the hotel we asked if we were able to have our clothes put in a drying room which they were more that happy to do at no cost. Any extras at this hotel are very expensive such as breakfasts, room service etc. It also appears very much to cater for the American business traveller who is familiar with the "Heavenly" marketing concept they have at this group of hotels, the Heavenly Bed, the Heavenly Shower etc. Although there is nothing wrong with this concept it becomes rather predictable. It won't be long before they have the Heavenly door handle, the Heavenly lightbulb... As I say it's more suited to business travellers who are after consistency and predictability. If you're after something with a bit of an Italian character I'd recommend trying somewhere else. In summary there's nothing wrong with this hotel however if you're staying in Rome on holiday there are plenty of hotels that are cheaper and aren't as impersonal. One thing I almost forgot to mention was the bar attached to this hotel. It's a great place to unwind at the end of the day. Has great cocktails and the barstaff are very attentive.

Reviews.Title: “Good location - nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: MassTraveler
Reviews.Content: Spent five nights at the Excelsior in January 2006. Good location near the Spanish steps, parks, restaurants, and shopping. Hotel is full of all the perks. Our room was very nice. Service was what you would expect from an upscale property. Gladly recommend this hotel to visitors to Rome. Enjoy

Reviews.Title: “Expected much more”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Given the praise lavished by other reviewers, my expectations of this hotel were quite high. Unfortunately, our experience was underwhelming. There was actually nothing wrong with our stay, but we found the staff impersonal and disinterested. On check-in, the receptionist asked us for our passports, handed us our keys, smiled, and said Room 123. That was it! The concierge brought our luggage, smiled, took his tip and left the room. There was no guest directory in the room. In a top-class hotel, I expect someone to tell me where the pool is, what time breakfast is served, what amenities are available, how to turn down the sweltering a/c, etc. Nobody volunteered anything to us except polite smiles. The hotel had a conference group staying, but you'd never know - the bar and lobby were deserted for the entire week of our stay (so it wasn't as if the staff were too busy to give us the time of day). A charming pianist played to an empty room every evening at 8 o'clock. There was no price-list for the minibar, and other reviews here had alerted me to crazy pricing. A nice touch, though - a comp bottle of wine and a bowl of clementines were delivered to our room on the first evening as a welcome gift. For some reason, even though we drank the wine on Day 3, the housekeeper did not take the empty bottle or the empty bowl away for the duration of our stay. Our room was very quiet and very comfortable (though too hot for the first few days). It was turned down every night, all toiletries were provided, and although a tad dusty after a few days, it was perfectly fine. On checking out, we asked for our luggage to be brought down. We stood by the concierge desk in the lobby waiting for 20 minutes (no, really) and all that time, nobody asked if we were okay. When we reminded the concierge, he immediately summoned one of the three bell-hops who was standing around waiting for something to do. We could not have been more obvious - we were the only people in the lobby at the time. Like the previous reviewer, we found January perfect weather-wise - 10-12F, dry and crisp. The Galleria Borghese was wonderful, and we ate in some great restaurants. We did not eat a single meal in the hotel over our seven days - we felt happier spending our money in charming, atmospheric, reasonably-priced restaurants where the staff were interested in our business. This was my first time staying in a Westin. It was an inauspicious first stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, been to much better”
Reviews.Author: g12doc
Reviews.Content: The Westin Exclesior is on the Via Vittorio Veneto, which has a number of other 5 star hotels and the American Embassy so it's unreasonable to expect budget prices - and the Excelsior makes no attempt whatsoever to do this. The key things you look for in a hotel, whatever the star rating or location, are comfort, privacy and above all SILENCE in your room at night. Our first room was 225 - avoid this side of the hotel at all costs unless you intend to return to your room after 3am. The club outside the hotel called the George (see my photo taken at 3am - when highly exasperated as well as exhausted) did it's best to play the worst 100 songs of all time accompanied by amplified whoops and cheers of obviously highly inebriated clientele. Great. Next morning I asked to be moved which the staff did without any problem and most courteously although they offered no apology for what must be an all too common occurrence. Unfortunately we got DOWNGRADED to a less opulent room - but it was worth it as this was wonderfully quiet at night. Not sure what The HEAVENLY BED is all about. Fairly ordinary hotel bed as far as I could see and certainly not a selling point. The location is good for the Barberini Gallery and the Borghese Gallery and park and the Trevi fountain and Spanish steps are only about 10 minutes walk away. A previous report suggests asking the Taxi to drop you off at the Hard Rock Cafe as the prices go up when you ask for the hotel. We found no evidence for this at all having used both drop off points on a number of occasions. Either way it will only cost 7 Euros to the Colisseum, 8 to Travastere and 9-10 to get to the Basilica. Hardly bank breaking if you're paying 300 Euros a night for the room! General advice: *January is a great time to visit as the weather, while cool, is like a spring day in the UK, but sunny. Additionally - no-one else seems to be there so there are no queues worth speaking of for anything! *Don't eat locally unless you want to pay 150 Euros for a 2 course meal! Get an 8 Euro Taxi to Travastere and eat & drink like a king for 40 Euros. We did both - and guess which we preferred! The 3 star rating is simply because the hotel, while very pleasant, was not really distinctive and I have spent time in lesser rated hotels that offer better customer care.

Reviews.Title: “Great upscale hotel”
Reviews.Author: Outtolunchatty
Reviews.Content: Great classic hotel on Via Veneto. Expensive, yes, but quiet and sophisticated. We bought bottled water at nearby supermarket and left in on the balcony to chill (worked great) so we didn't need to use the minibar. Did the same with some wine. Room terrific with chandelier over the bed and large marble bath with american style shower, overlooking via veneto and we could see St. Peters in the distance. Breakfast buffet OK (free with our rate) but wouldn't pay for it separately. Nearby restaurants include Cafe de Paris (surprisingly good, particularly for lunch or late night drinks), Das Tulio (steak) stuffy and mediocre, but the spaghetti with white truffles looked terrific. Around the corner is a large, new, hip, wonderful pizzeria called Pommidorios, serves pizza, salads, etc. Large hangout for young locals, always busy but no wait, great place, ate there many times. Go to the Jewish Ghetto to eat..great food there. Anyway, hotel has great service, worth every penny for comfort, convenience and safety. Concierges are reliable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was the third of our three Starwood points stays on a month long trip in Italy. Like the other two - Venice and Florence - the accommodations were superb and the room was extremely quiet. We had a very large room on a quiet side street with a huge walk in closet and great bathroom. The hotel service was excellent and the furnishings very comfortable. A Roman couple we met suggested that the location - Via Veneto - was not an "in" place to be for either shopping or action. We found it reasonably convenient and the fact that it was away from the action a plus rather than a minus. Of the three Starwood properties we stayed at, the Excelsior had the most attractive public spaces and seemed the liveliest. Breakfast prices were about the same as in Florence and, although lower than in Venice, still ridiculously high. We had a satisfying dinner at the hotel the first night for not much more than breakfast would have cost. Fortunately, we have become very adept at eating at bars standing up, which leaves more time and money for museum fees, etc. This is definitely a place I would return to.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Platinum Members Perspective”
Reviews.Author: DiamondMember78
Reviews.Content: I am a Starwood Platinum member and was very impressed with the hotel and rooms. Rooms were very well appointed and bathrooms were huge with tons of marble. Couple of things to be "aware" of: Local Taxi Drivers WILL charge you move to get to the hotel as they aware of the "status" of those guests choosing to stay at the hotel. In multiple instances we experienced higher cab fare when requesting transportation to the hotel from other parts of Rome (e.g. Vatican to Hotel, etc.). I would suggest telling cab drivers to take you to the "Hard Rock Rest." as it's across the street and you'll probably pay alot less for the cab fare. Also the hotel automatically charges each room $1.00 Euro for UNICHEF without asking you. If you would like them to "remove" the charge they will upon your request. In my opinion, the hotel shouldn't automatically add any "donation" to your bill, it should be added upon request. For those Platinum members, I received an upgraded room over looking the front part of the hotel with a sitting area. The "ameniti" was a choice of wine, fruit bowl, TV Movie Credit or Mini-bar credit.....no starwood point bonus. Food and Drinks physically at the hotel are VERY VERY VERY expensive, plan on paying 15 Euro for coffee delivered to your room in the AM. DO NOT eat at the hotel unless you've got money falling out of your pockets. Hotel wise, service was great and rooms were of the quality I would expect at a Westin. If I were to retun to Rome, I would again stay at this property.

Reviews.Title: “If Money Is No Object, Go For It”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Excelsior was truly a five-star experience. The public rooms are incredible. We were upgraded to a superior double which was large enough to be a suite. The marble bathrooms were decadent. The beds were great. The only negative thing was the prices in the hotel restaurant/room service...even for a five-star, they were over the top. (Twenty euros for a smallish scotch at the bar.) The location in Rome is the best.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel. Great location. Best in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Escaramujo
Reviews.Content: Beautiful Hotel, super clean, super luxurius. Stayed for 5 nights sept 22-27, with starwood points. Upgraded to a remodeled room, very contemporary with a great bathroom, specially the shower. You want to take a 2 hour bath. (There are 2 types of rooms in this hotel: the traditional ones and the remodeled ones). A personal opinion about the heavenly beds: They do not feel the same than in other westins in the US that I have been to. Matress is too hard, pillows and sheets do not feel the same than in other Westins. Had the same experience in Florence at the Excelsior there. Whens asked at the front desk in this hotel, they assured me they were heavenly beds. My wife and I both agreed that they are not nearly the same than other Westins we have stayed before. Am I the only one who think this? I dont know but I can assure you I have slept in better beds. Another personal comment: the hotel is so big that you lose the personal touch: 3 concierges at the same desk (you are almost assured you will have to wait in line) were very helpful but impersonal. You are simply one more guest of the hundreds ones. Also, prices in the hotel are ridicolous: Breakfast is 40 euros, mini bar coke I beleive is 7 euros. Crazy. A very helpful thing is that they returned our car to the renting company (we drove from Florence throught Tuscany. Great trip for 3 days). We got to the hotel and they took over. GREAT!!! Every hotel worker is always smilling and willing to help with anything: Taxis, towels, etc. In general a fantastic hotel. Tips in Rome: You are going to walk big distances, but this is what is all about in this city. Watching other people and just walk everywhere. We would only take a taxi late at night when we went for dinner after taking a shower and after walking the whole day. There is a supermarket at the subterraneum passage to the subway to Piazza di Spagna from Via Venetto. The passage is accross the street from the Marriot Hotel 1 block from the Westin. We bought water, sodas and even things for breakfast that we kept in the minibar refrigerator. Great. From all the restaurants I went I am only going to recommend 2. Great value (less than 60 euros for 2 people and great food: Assinocotto in trastevere and here comes my big tip: GRAPPOLLO D'ORO ZAMPANO in the piazza dela Cancelleria near campo de Fiori. WOW!!! Food in this 2 places was extraordinay and not the tipical pasta with sauces that you find everywhere else. Prices were very good too. Ditirambo was a dissapointment although came with great reccomendations. I didn't like it. Another writer gave me the tip about transportation to the airport. It worked great so I am going to repeat it: M.L.M. (tel: --------) is a company that for 35 euros will get you to the airport in a big Mercedes van. (Hotel wanted to charge 90 euros). For shopping, if you cannot afford the prices at the via Condotti (you have to walk around here anyways to watch the beautiful people), there is a street near the vatican called via Cola di Rienzo (finishes in the piazza de Popolo. Less crowded and you can find some less expensive and beautiful clothes. Via del Corso is very crowded but near Piazza de Popolo have stores with good prices.There is a mall called Cinecitta but it was dissapointing and far (you can get there in the subway). Ah..the subway....AVOID. Too crowded and dangerous. A friend of ours had her purse cut. She only had a bottle of water so nothig was stolen but this experts robbers wil do anything. Be careful. Almost every taxi we took tried to overcharge us one way or another. One added a suplement at a time when no suplements were legal. Many of them took longer routes than necessary. Just be aware that this happens. Buy your ticket for the Colisseum at the Palatino. There is no line and the ticket includes both things. For the Vatican you are going to wait in line because of the security check. Get there early and hope for the best. St Peters Cathedral is free. It i worth to get there early in the morning and you will walk there quick and will have the whole cathedral for you to admire In general I thought Rome was a great city with beautiful people (Ok....beautiful women, wow!!!), great shopping, lots of history, great food. The Excelsior was a great hotel. Im could go back at any time.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased with the Westin Excelsior!”
Reviews.Author: Jayde88
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our honeymoon and I believe we were definitely upgraded when we arrived, even though they didn't say so. Our room was supposed to be around 430 sq feet and the room we had was at least double that. Very spacious, high ceilings & beautiful decor, we were extremely pleased, especially after coming off a bad experience at the Dei Borgognoni Hotel, which was located not that far away. The staff were always polite and the hotel is located in a nice area of the city which is about a 10 to 15 minute walk to the Spanish Steps. We had a great dinner nearby at a restaurant called Giovanni's. Overall a pleasant experience that you would expect from a Westin 5 star hotel & would definitely return here if I went back to Rome! However, would also agree that if breakfast is not included in your room rate, the prices are somewhat high compared to just going out into the city to find breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel for a Round Birthday Celebration”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent five days at the Excelsior for his 60th birthday and had one of our best hotel experiences ever. We had booked a grand deluxe room but upon our arrival were unexpentantly and pleasantly upgraded to a lavish suite -- crystal chandeliers (yes plural), a marble fireplace, and sumptuous cushy furniture. Everyone from the people at the reception to the chambermaids to the concierage was kind and cheerful. Our breakfast (42€) was not included and drinks at the bar were expensive -- but about average in price when compared to other grand hotels such at the Gritti palace in Venice (50€ for the breakfast buffet) or the Manderin Hyde Park in London (42 pounds for a continental breakfast). Besides it is wonderful fun to sit on the sofas outside of the Doney restuarant, drink a glass of champagne and watch the beautifully dressed Italiens stroll by. That experience alone is worth a few euros more -- that and the absolutely chaming bar staff. Another plus is that many of the top sights -- Spanish steps, Villa Borghese -- and terrific restaurants are reachable by foot. La Terrezza at the Eden, for example, is only 300 meters away. It offers a rooftop view of Rome, a Michelin-star chef, and an unforgettable dining experience. (The resturant is visited every evening by a personable and very hungry seagull who watches the guests from the other side of the windows. Even if you consider seagulls to be rats of the air, this particular seagull was so funny, so incongurous in such a romantic setting, that it added that extra something to create a memorable evening for us. ) All in all, my husband and I were more than pleased with the Excelsior and its location. I'd recommend it to anyone who is looking for something special and is not shocked by the prices at lux hotels in great cities. The Excelsior is worth it, and we'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious, good service, but with accomodation discrepencies!”
Reviews.Author: travelinspiration
Reviews.Content: My husband and I (ages 33/29) recently stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. We are blessed to travel extensively for pleasure (no kids yet) and try to stay in the best 4.5 or 5 star hotels. I had extensively researched hotels 8 months before our trip to find the perfect one (this was our first trip to Italy). I picked the hotel based on: size, star rating, opulence, location, and service. Also, we have had wonderful experiences at many Starwood hotels and thus wanted to try another one. I did not book the Hotel Eden or Hotel de Russie, for the Excelsior was pictured as having more "old world charm/luxury" and Via Veneto seemed to be described as a beautiful street/area. Also, prices more affordable at Excelsior for what you actually get (accomodation size, etc). Everything met our expectations except our initial room accomodations. We arrived at 12:45pm on a Thursday and they said our room was ready. I had booked a grand luxe room, with requests for high floor and view over Via Veneto. I had corresponded extensively with their reservations supervisor by e-mail in order to book the perfect room. There is a virtual tour of the grand luxe on their website (which the supervisor confirmed was correct) and she added in her e-mails that many are located on high floors and they're 40sq/meters (430 square feet). Well upon being shown to our room, I immediately realized we were given a superior double (big difference in decor and size), however it was on the 6th floor (highest) and overlooking Via Veneto. I kindly told the lady (who worked the front desk and was escorting us) that this was not a grand luxe room as described/pictured on website. She "ADAMENTLY" stated that is was and that we were given the nicest one due to our Starwood loyalty. Basically, she was flat out "LYING" TO US and I could easily prove it!! I also showed her all my correspondence with the hotel directly (e-mails I had printed) and she still continued to lie. When I kindly asked to be shown a grand luxe room, she stated we were already in one. I then asked to speak to the reservations supervisor in person. After making a phone call, the lady said that person was at lunch and would be returning in 40 minutes. She then went on to say that the hotel was sold out and this was a very, very nice room we were being given. I then lost my patience and demanded to be taken back downstairs to wait for the supervisor or even better a manager. She said if we went back downstairs we could risk losing our room since the hotel was sold out (thus having no room at all). Also, she said the hotel only had "1" manager and he was busy. At this point it was a good thing my husband was there to calm me down - obviously I was fuming at this point. I told her this was "TOTALLY UNACCEPTABLE" and we've "NEVER" had "ANY" problems at a Starwood hotel, much less one this big!! I told her they either needed to get me the correct room or find one at the St.Regis (their sister property/1 mile away). If not then I would gladly seek out other 5 star accomodations in the city, who I'm sure would be happy to take the 540Euro/night plus tax that I had planned on spending. She then said there was nothing she could do and insisted once again that we were in the right room. Well, I took my luggage downstairs and immediately called the manager at the Florence Excelsior where we had just stayed (Best Hotel Ever - see review) from the concierge desk. I wanted advice on how to proceed since obviously no one was coming forth to help us. The mgr. in Florence said he had no control over that hotel ( I already knew that) but would make a phone call immediately so we were not left stranded. Well, to wrap up this already long story - our lunch was bought and we were upgraded magically to a GORGEOUS SUITE overlooking the Via Veneto, however on the 1st floor ( I took it because I was tired of dealing with the situation) and the manager (Rooms Division Manager) was very accomodating and excuded excellent customer service!! However, this was all after being led to yet another room that was not like the one on the website (right decor, but smaller). The mgr. explained that the one pictured on the virtual tour was actually not a "grand luxe" but a higher room category and there was ONLY "4" in the hotel/ none overlooking Via Veneto; also, they're reserved for families since they are the only connecting rooms. He then said the website would need to be changed in order to not mislead people (too late this time!). I found it ever so ironic that these other rooms magically became available, especially a junior suite - which had to be at least 550 square feet plus private large foyer area (next door/connected to Royal Suite!) Fortunately, the 1st floor room was not noisy at night and not even that terrible during the day - I was very surprised. We were able to walk to things very easily/quickly. Only downside to location - no cheap eating places anywhere close, which I somewhat already knew but was hoping there would at least be a pizzeria or geleteria on a nearby side street. The rest of our stay went smoothly (I had a package that included daily buffet brk. - which is priced at 42E/each, OUCH!). The food was average at best, so do make sure it's included or eat elsewhere. Upon returning to Rome, I will either stay at the St.Regis (which we visited, though location not ideal) or another 5 star hotel that is similar size. Westin obviously books a lot of groups/conferences and that is why I think they tried to dump the lower room category on us. I will definately continue my Starwood loyalty for this is the first problem we've ever encountered, and we've recently have stayed at 6 of their properties (all 5 stars) in various destinations and our experiences were "WONDERFUL". Hopefully this will never happen again. My advice: definately correspond with the hotel directly before booking in order to get the exact room that you're paying for. I don't mind paying top dollar as long as I receive the right accomodations/service. Please feel free to e-mail with any questions on this hotel or Rome (great city!). Happy travelling to all!!

Reviews.Title: “Better than NICE place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin Excelsior for 1 week during our Rome vacation. The hotel's service was impeccable. We had an issue with our reservation and they were very accommodating to ensure our needs were taken care of. They put us (family of 4) in the largest room we have EVER stayed in. Being use to 5 star quality; the hotel was an older hotel; however extrememly GRAND! I however, am more inclined to stay in newer, more modern hotels. The hotel is in an excellent location. I highly recommend to get the breakfast plan; otherwise, you will pay an arm and 2 legs for breakfast in this hotel. The only downside to the hotel, is that they have a small swimming area.

Reviews.Title: “Was a wonderful place to stay and service was excellent!”
Reviews.Author: vacation200807
Reviews.Content: We walked into this hotel after a long day on a train wanting to switch from another hotel. The lady at the reception (Minna?/Minnia?) was very welcoming and found us a room that would meet out needs (2 adults and 2 children) , she went above and beyond to help us. Her professionalism and style in treating us well was wonderful. The room and the rest of the hotel was gorgeous and the service from all areas was excellent! Highly recommend this hotel to enjoy your stay in Rome, very central with lots of restaurants around. Pool was great.

Reviews.Title: “Do stay here”
Reviews.Author: janps
Reviews.Content: Have to agree with the great reviews of this property- the rooms were clean and large and the service was wonderful! Stayed on the second floor and it was much larger than another room on the sixth floor. Traveled with a teen and the rollaway fit in the room with much space around it and was comfortable too. Loved the quiet room looking inward with no view but windows that open for fresh air without the street noise. Highly recommend. Down side - slow elevators. Il Pomodorino, around the corner, excellent restaurant and reasonable, 90 euros for 6 with appetizers, wine, sodas, main courses and dessert.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Service”
Reviews.Author: Chris123
Reviews.Content: After tirelessly reviewing the many 5 star hotels that this magnificent city has to offer we eventually decided to spend our time at the Excelsior. As we were getting married whilst in Rome we would be spending 9 nights the hotel of our choice- it needed to be special. I have been fortunate enough to have stayed at some exceptional hotels throughout the world over the past few years most recently the famous Copacabana Palace in Rio de Janeiro, the Ritz in London to name a few. This hotel offered by far the best attention to detail and customer service I have recieved, which simply made our wedding/honeymoon all the more memorable. We had been allocated a room on the 5th floor above Via Veneto however this room had a more traditional look to it and I was aware that they had more modern rooms in the hotel after there refurbishment. I asked to change and they were more than happy to do so, nothing is too much trouble for them whether it be reception staff, in the restaurant or at the pool. As an earlier reviewer commented they don`t offer an iron, bit frustrating , instead they offer a pressing service- €8.70 for a pair of trousers as an example! My tip- hang them in the "heavenly" shower! The beds truly are "heavenly" it`s not just a marketing gimmick. The air con is great and needed at this time of year. The hotel is absolutely spotless wherever you look. Staff in all areas are dressed immaculately, true Italian style. One nice surprise which I haven`t seen at any other hotels is that if you have paid for breakfast in your room rate, you can order it in the room at no charge. If you order it for 7.00am , it will be there at 7.00am! Many of the staff were here before Westin took over and are truly proud of the hotels heritage and place in Rome`s history, does this make a difference to the way in which they treat you - I think so. I have to mention Jessica on reception she was exceptional, her father worked at the hotel for 40 years, she is in her 13th year, the hotel is home to her. What an asset to the the hotel and to Westin. As you would expect it`s not particularly cheap to get your trousers pressed €8.70 or have a cup of tea in your room €8.00 but you won`t feel short changed beacause everything is done to perfection. We`ll be going back it`s just too good.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bevchris
Reviews.Content: Our stay here was awesome. This hotel is First Class. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The meals we ate here were awesome and our room was WOW! We had a fantastic stay here and wished we could have stayed longer than the 5 nights we stayed. We will certainly stay here on our next trip to Rome. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Much much better than expected”
Reviews.Author: carlyle
Reviews.Content: This hotel gets a beating from travel agents and these boards...I had made back up reservations at the eden just in case the bad stuff was all true...not so...this place is great....trust me there are short comings - no irons in room or availabel at all, no coffee service except by room service, not even take away coffee in teh retsaurant...but this hotel has one thing that tops everything...IT IS THE CLEANEST HOTEL YOU WILL EVER STAY IN....does not sound like a lot but it is, it is impecably clean, the marble shines the elevator shines, the bathroomes shine, wow it was almost unreal....concierge was incredibly helpful, arrange private car tour of rome in ten hours notice...starwood plat room upgrade was nice...pool and steam were wonderful, pool is at 25C/80F temp was geat and just what we needed after 6 hours in the vatican touring...check out was sincerely silly and frustrating...but this hotel is the real deal, if you are an american and especilly if you have starwood status this is a great choice

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: cmeaux
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Westin Excelsior. The location was great. We felt comforted that the American Embassy was right across the street, and there is plenty of shopping and sightseeing within walking distance. The room was plenty spacious, and we got a kick out of the fact that you can actually open the windows and enjoy the fresh air. We found the staff to be courteous and helpful. We got a massage the first night, which proved to be a wise decison, it really fought off the blahs from a 13 hr. flight. The spa was not quite what we expected, more like a gym, and a little pricey, but the massages were great and just what we needed! Carry euro, as you cannot include gratuities in the bill as you can here. It was also helpful to have currency exchange right downstairs at the concierge, and the rate was fair. The only bad thing I can think of is that the elevators are tiny and SLOW. I mean slow. Overall, it was a very enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and Staff”
Reviews.Author: KJP_52
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Excelsior before our cruise in May 2005. I have never had a bad experience at a Westin, and the Excelsior is no exception. I didn't even bother to read the reviews before booking; and was not disappointed. I liked the quiet area and it was not too much hassle to catch a taxi to the more distant sites, but beware that some taxi drivers attempt to rip you off. We chose taxi because of the horror stories about the metro. But the metro is a short walk away. Many excellent restaurants are nearby, but not much souvenier shopping. The hotel was a welcome treat after longs days of walking around the many sites of Rome. The wonderful soaking tub and the Heavenly bed was just like home. The front desk staff were all very accommodating and friendly. I asked for a room change because of the street noise below, and was given a much bigger room that was indeed quiet. I highly recommend this hotel and would definetely stay here again. Rome is a beautiful city, take the time to enjoy it to the fullest.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal for Starwood members!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for free on husband's brothers coupons-our room was large and well kept and you could live in the bathroom. We usually opt for smaller, less fancy places so this was a treat. Since breakfast was not included for free stays, we went across the street and around the corner to several little places for the Italian cappuchino or expresso and pastry breakfast (2 to 3 euros as opposed to hotel's 30 euro probably great breakfast). We did splurge on drinks before dinner (not cheap) which included some very good nibbles. We did not eat dinner in the hotel since there are many small and great restaurants nearby. I am sure the hotel could suggest many off the beaten path places but we were taken out to dinner with locals 1 night, too tired to care the 1st night (ate around the corner, it was fine) and tried an internet restaurant the 3rd night. The Galleria Borghese is a short walk away and worth a visit-you can make the necessary reservation before leaving home-we saw it late the day we arrived- fatigue and all-easy to do from this hotel. You can also get to the subway a short walk from the hotel. Beware and pay attention to your guidebooks, my brother-in-law got his pocket picked on the subway on the way to the vatican. The rest of us used a few more precautions but did not go crazy worrying before or after this incident. Lastly, our luggage got lost between London and Rome. It arrived in the middle of the night and when I went down about 8 in the morning to ask if the hotel had heard anything, they had the luggage but were waiting so as not to wake us! It is that nice a hotal.

Reviews.Title: “Excellant room, pool, service, gorgeous”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Excelsior in August 2004. After a 3 or 4 block walk from the train station (uphill, but not bad), we checked in to find that our room was a little dated, but pretty, so we called the front desk and requested one of their newer rooms & they kindly moved us to a newer, gorgeous room, we were soooo happy we asked. The Westin beds are very "Heavenly" as well as their "heavenly "shower in the marble bathroom. Everything was top of the line. We did soo much sightseeing that we only used the beautiful indoor pool and spa once ..but it was great. We did not use their restaurants but did go to the Hard Rock Cafe a block away. Our friends who stayed at the top of the Spanish Steps at the Intercontinental had a complementary hot breakfast & wines & champage daily, but less Superior rooms/ambiance. NOTHING was included at the Westin, but you're paying for Luxury, not free food. Both Hotels were good, safe, choices we will reccomend.

HotelInfo.Name: The Westin Excelsior, Rome
HotelInfo.Address: 125, Via Vittorio Veneto, 00187 Rome, Italy
